loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is 33 years old married woman, a mother of 3 children, she lives in Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan.
Abeer is looking to have a loan of 400JDs thus she can buy a sewing machine and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Mairamkul

texts.ru: Майрамкул, 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У нее - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Майрамкул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Майрамкул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Mairamkul is 46 years old, married, and raising three children with her husband. She has secondary education, and as the main breadwinner of her family she is engaged in animal husbandry, having started ten years ago. 

Thanks to Mairamkul's persistent hard work, today on her farm there are three cows and fifteen sheep. The monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). 

In order to further develop her farm, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep in order to increase her number of cattle. Mairamkul plans to invest the finances from the loan in the further increase of the number of her livestock, and she plans to save up to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy some sheep in order to increase her herd headcount

loans.name: An

texts.en: Mrs. An is 63 years old, married and has two children. She has always earned her living in agriculture and livestock raising alongside her family who taught her these skills. For some months now she has had her own pigs to raise and fatten and then sell in various parts of town. Her goal is to increase the number of pigs she is raising. She is seeking a loan to buy several pigs and the feed she requires to raise them. The money she earns from expanding her business will increase and she will be able to have a better standard of living with no financial problems. Her two children depend on the success of her business. Her greatest dream is to have a house of her own and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy several pigs and the feed she requires to raise them

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce M. is a Patchwork and Embroidery designer specializing in wall hangings of flowers, animals, birds, and persons. She joined Life in Africa 2 years ago and she has since then been a very active member of the WE Center. She has passed on her skills to some of the members of the Center and she is actually the best person one would ever want to work with.

She has developed a good reputation with many International families living in Kampala and they have become customers. She has a stall near her home where she hangs and displays her work but she also does many hangings by special order for her customers. She is now in a good position to expand her business since the demand for her products is now more than what she can produce herself.. And in doing this she will be able to offer jobs to one or two other LiA members to assist her in the production process.

To fund this expansion Joyce is seeking a loan in the amount of 800,000us. This will purchase enough materials to complete 100 wall hangings. These will be sold from her stall, at bazaars and at exhibitions as well as to her current client base. With the addition of some hired help, she will be able to complete the 100 hangings in four months.

Below is her budget of what she needs to buy.

  • Item/ Quantity/ Cost/ Total
  • Poly Viscose. White 30 Metres x 4000 = 120000
  • Poly Viscose. Cream 30 Metres x 4000 =120000
  • Poly Viscose. Army Color 30 Metres x 4000 =120000
  • Cotton White 90 Metres x 1500 =135000
  • Cotton Cream 90 Metres x 1500 =135000
  • Cotton Brown 90 Metres x 1500 =135000
  • Cotton Green 10 Metres x 150 =15000
  • Transport 20000

Total 800000

According to Joyce's current income, she will be able to repay the loan in 12 months. She has designated the community impact portion of the interest she pays to support Life in Africa's Internet4Change Team, who need more computers so they can better help Joyce to sell some of her patchworks online.

Read more about Joyce at http://joyceM..blogspot.com/

loans.use: materials to produce 100 wallhangings

loans.name: Kayi

texts.en:
Married with four children, Mrs. Kayi A. is also responsible for a sister and a bother who she has made apprentices. Educated to secondary level, she is very experienced in the stocking of corn. Mrs. A. started in the corn business at an early age in order to make an effective contribution to household expenses. She received an initial loan of $150 which she was soon able to pay off without any problem. Mrs. A. is requesting a second loan of $850 which will allow her to purchase a substantial stock of corn, which she will resell during a period of shortage. The income from these sales will be put towards family expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère d’une famille de quatre (04) enfants, Madame A. Kayi a à sa charge une sœur et un frère qu’elle a mis en apprentissage. Instruite de niveau secondaire, elle possède une grande expérience en matière de stockage de maïs. Très tôt, Madame A. s’est lancée dans le commerce de maïs pour contribuer efficacement aux charges du ménage. Elle a reçu un premier crédit de $150 qu’elle a pu solder très tôt sans incident. Madame A. Kayi sollicite un second crédit de $850qui lui permettra de faire un stock consistant de maïs qu’elle revendra en période de pénurie. Les revenus de la vente seront destinés aux dépenses familiales.

loans.use: To buy, store and resell corn

loans.name: Altagracia

texts.en:
Altagracia O. supports her four daughters and one son by selling new clothing and shoes in her community. Most of her profit comes from selling dress shoes and shirts but her client base is larger because she also sells miscellaneous items that appeal to a broader demographic - including cosmetics, accessories, toys and personal care products.

This $400 loan will finance the expansion of her business - specifically purchasing more new clothing and shoes to increase sales. Plus, she will be able to afford better quality garments that can sell for a higher profit margin, which will give her more money to invest in savings and the needs of her children, on top of putting money back into her business.


Altagracia is one of Esperanza's special individual borrowers. She is still part of her Bank of Hope, which her group has named 'La Simpatía', but because of the success and size of her business, as well as her payment of previous loans, she is now eligible for larger, individual loan sizes.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and shoes

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Maria is 21 years old and single. She lives with her mother and she works in the production of tablecloths, napkins and other embroidered products. She and her mother don't have their own shop, so they sell their crafts to wholesalers who in turn sell to the Santo Domingo artisan's market. She also sells special orders to people in the community. With this loan, she hopes to buy more thread and fabric to increase production and sell in a small shop that is frequented by tourists.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA VICTORIA TIENE 21 AÑOS ES SOLTERA JUNTO CON SU MAMA SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE MANTELES, SERVILLETAS Y PIEZAS DE BORDADO ARTESANAL, NO TIENEN LOCAL PROPIO POR LO TANTO VENDE SUS PRODUCTOS A MAYORISTAS QUE VENDEN EN EL MERCADO DE SANTO DOM INGO( MERCADO ARTESANAL DE LA CIUDAD ) Y TAMBIEN VENDE A PERSONAS DE SU COMUNIDAD A PEDIDO .ESPERAN CON EL PRESTAMO CON SU MAMA COMPRAR MAS HILOS Y TELAS PARA AUMENTAR SU PRODUCCION Y PODER INSTALARSE ELLAS CON UN PEQUEÑO LOCAL DE VENTA EN SU COMUNIDAD LUGAR MUY VISITADO POR TURISTAS.

loans.use: Craft sales

loans.name: Zoyir

texts.ru:
Zoyir S., 55 is a father of 3 children. He has a high school education. Zoyir has been selling plastic pipes for 7 years. His wife is a school teacher. After school, Zoyir’s youngest son helps his father to sell. In 2003, when Zoyir received his first MicroInvest loan, his business assets were only $200. After receiving and carefully investing multiple loans, Zayir increased the volume of the goods sold and began to purchase the pipes wholesale. He also began to sell brooms in addition to pipes. Now, Zayir’s business assets total $1100. In the future, he plans to expand the place of business. P.S. Zayir’s son is on the photo.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шодмонов Зойир отец троих детей. Ему 55лет, образование среднее. Вот уже 7лет занимается продажей пластиковых труб. Жена работает учительницей в средней школе, младший сын после школы помогает отцу в торговле. В 2003 году начал получать займ в МЗФ «Микроинвест», его активы в то время составляли 200$. После получения неоднократного займа и целевого использования он увеличил товарооборот, оптом стал закупать товар и добавил в свой ассортимент веники. Сейчас его активы составляют 1100$. В будущем хочет расширить место деятельности. P.S. На фото его сын.

loans.use: To expand the place of business

loans.name: Faletaulupe

texts.en: Living in a rural area is not so simple for the townswomen. Faletaulupe, who comes from the town of Vaivase, gets along nicely. She is married to a farmer from Saleaumua and is raising four children. Her husband runs a taro plantation along with 3 laborers. She goes to the market twice a month, and she can make $150-$200 every week. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, weed killer, and other supplies for the taro plantation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gramoxone (a weed killer), and other supplies for her taro plantation

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 48 year old father of four children. He lives with his family in south Lebanon, in the region of Nabatieh. This is the third time Hassan is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. This time he needs $1200 USD to buy a new oven for his bakery. His wife is also helping in the business since she bakes a special kind of bread that is called 'markouk'. Hassan's bakery is visited by the inhabitants of the region who are faithful customers.

loans.use: To buy a new oven for his bakery

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
Juliet N. collects about 3 trays of eggs a day. She wants to take a loan to construct another poultry house, purchase feed, and bring in 100 more chicks. She had 6 children and looks after 2 orphans.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase poultry business

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Mr. Koku A. was born in 1973 in Badou Tomégbé. He was apprenticed for three years and became a mechanic. He is married to a retailer with whom he has three children. Dynamic and a master of his trade, he is a good businessman and has been able to invest wisely and repay the loans he has received in a timely manner.

In view of the present difficult financial situation, he is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a motorcycle to use as transport and for his business. This will allow him to make more money and better support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Koku est né 1973 à Badou Tomégbé. Devenu mécanicien après trois ans d’apprentissage, il s’est marié à une revendeuse avec qui il a fait trois (3) enfants. Dynamique et maîtrisant son métier, il est un bon entrepreneur et a su gérer les crédits obtenus et les a remboursé sans aucun incident. Pour faire face à la situation économique difficile, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acquérir une moto pour le transport et des matériels de travail. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus afin de mieux entretenir sa famille.

loans.use:
purchase of a motorcycle

Achat de moto

loans.name: Dory

texts.es:
Dory lives in the district of Juanji in the province of Mariscal de Cáceres. She sells fruits and vegetables in the district's number 2 market.

She's been in business for 10 years. The idea to start the business came out of the fact that the family was in need and she wanted to help cover household expenses. She started selling small quantities of fruits and vegetables outside the market, which she had collected from her parents garden. Then a friend invited her to Banco Central's "Honesty and Work" to ask for a loan so she could rent a kiosk at the market and buy items to help her begin selling her produce.

With the recent loan of 3000 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she'll buy items for her business such as bags of oranges, yuca, onion, potatoes, flour, boxes of papaya, bananas and other.

Sara Dory is a 44-year-old mother of two. She lives with her husband who is supportive of her and who himself works with some businesses. She plans to buy land so she can build a house.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

La sra. Dory vive en la provincia de Mariscal Cáceres distrito de Juanjui, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado Nº 02 del distrito.

Tiene dedicándose al negocio 10 años, la idea del negocio surgió a raíz de la necesidad que estaba pasando su familia ,quería poder a poyar con los gastos del hogar, es así que empezó vendiendo frutas en pequeñas cantidades que traía de la chacra de sus padres a las afueras del mercado, una amiga la invito al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo” para que pida un préstamo y pueda comprar algunos utensilios para la venta y alquilar un espacio dentro del mercado.

Con el reciente préstamo de S/.3000.00 el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará artículos para su negocio como sacos de naranja, yuca, cebolla, papa, harina, cajas de papaya, racimos de plátano y otros.

La señora Sara Dory, tiene 44 años, 02 hijos de los cuales los 02 aún están a su cargo, vive con su esposo quien la apoya y con quien trabaja en algunos negocios, tiene proyectado comprar un terreno para construir su casa.

loans.use: To buy bags of oranges, yuca, onion, potatoes, flour and other

loans.name: Chanphun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanphun Y. and her husband have been married for six years. They have no children. Chanphun and her husband live with her father, who is a motor taxi driver. The family lives in an old house, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chanphun is a garment factory worker. Her husband, Sary Yin, has been a carpenter for thirteen years.

Mrs. Chanphun is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $800 to purchase a motorbike. She would like to replace her father's old bike. He runs a motor taxi business. They would like to use the extra income to repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one. Her father runs a motor taxi business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 27-year-old Elizabeth B.. She is married and has an 18-month-old child.

In 2006, Elizabeth established her cocoa business. Elizabeth has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase more cocoa in bulk for resale. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase cocoa in bulk.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
In the Condega neighborhood in the city of Estelí, you can find Luis G. working his hardest in an effort to improve his family's living conditions. Luis has been able to get ahead thanks to his hard work.

Today, in an effort to provide his children with a better quality of life, Luis has decided to rebuild his house, which has been in need of repairs for some time now. He has already rebuilt part of the house, but lacks the economic resources to complete reconstruction on the other part of the house.

Luis is requesting this loan from Ceprodel in order to buy the construction materials he needs to complete his home repairs. It should be noted that Luis has been a reliable client for Ceprodel, having repaid all of his previous loans in the agreed-upon form and time frame.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

En el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí, el caballero Luis G. se dedica arduamente a su negocio con el objetivo de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia el cual necesita de él para subsistir. Es de suma necesidad que este señor ha logrado salir adelante gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos. Hoy en día al estar consciente del deber de brindarle a sus hijos un mejor nivel de vida ha decidido iniciar con la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación el cual ha estado en mal estado por mucho tiempo. Al haber iniciado esta labor ha logrado reparar parte de su vivienda sin embargo la otra parte aun no la ha iniciado por el hecho de la ausencia del recurso económico.

Hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo crediticio en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el crédito necesario que le permita la compra de los materiales de construcción para continuar con su reparación de su casa de habitación. Es necesario destacar que ella es una fiel cliente de Cerprodel habiendo cancelado todos sus créditos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 32 year-old Beatrice M.. She is married and has four children aged between 5 and 15. She has two dependents who live with her because they are orphans. In 2002, Beatrice established her auto parts business. Working seven days a week, 13 to 16 hours a day, she earns about US $260 every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband.

Beatrice requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of auto spare parts in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately US $50. In the future, Beatrice plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy auto spare parts in bulk to expand her current stock

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
Mariluz is a 26-year-old mother of one daughter, who means a lot to her and fuels her desire for self-improvement. She lives with her husband, Sergio, who owns a motorcycle taxi business. Mariluz has been selling groceries and basic need items for several years. With this business, she has been able to help with the family expenses. Due to her charisma and kindness, Mariluz has many customers, which is why she needs to expand and develop her business, eventually converting it to a mini market. In order to do this, she requires this loan so that she can achieve the plans that she has laid out.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariluz tiene 26 años y es madre de 1 hija que significa mucho para ella, sobre todo sus ganas de superación, ella vive junto a su esposo Sergio quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en motocarro. Mariluz se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad desde hace años atrás, y con ello contribuir con los gastos familiares. Debido al carisma y amabilidad en su trato Mariluz tiene gran cantidad de clientes, por ello se encuentra en la necesidad de aumentar e implementar su negocio y posteriormente convertirlo en un minimarket, por ello requiere del presente préstamo para lograr su meta trazada.

loans.use: Expand general store

loans.name: Ni Ketut

texts.id:
In the midst of toughening economic condition, Ketut K. has a sizable responsibility to fulfill her family's needs. Her husband's farming income is not enough to fill all her family's needs, especially that their children are still infants. Ketut K. decided to start a pig farm at home with training and financial assistance from DINARI. From her first loan, she bought 1 breeding pis and 1 slaughter pig. After 6 months, she earned $30 profit per month. Because of this positive experience, Ketut Kartni decided to apply for second loan from DINARI that she plan to use to purchase 2 slaughter pigs and feeds for her newly purchased breeding pig. Ketut is hopeful that from these additional pigs will bring her increased profit. The profit from her pig farm really makes a difference in her family's quality of life.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Di tengah himpitan ekonomi yang semakin berat Ketut K. memiliki tanggung jawab yang besar untuk dapat menghidupi keluarganya. Suaminya yang sebagai petani tidak dapat mencukupi semua keperluan keluarga ditambah dengan kebutuhan anaknya yang masih kecil. Akhirnya Ketut K. memutuskan untuk memelihara babi di rumahnya dengan pinjaman modal dari program DINARI. Setelah pinjaman terealisasi dibelikannya 1 ekor induk babi serta 1 babi penggemukan. Setelah 6 bulan pemeliharaan diperoleh keuntungan dari penjualannya sebesar Rp.300.000,- sebulannya. Karena keuntungan yang bagus inilah maka Ketut K. melanjutkan ke pinjaman kedua dengan DINARI. Pinjaman kedua ini digunakannya untuk membeli bibit babi penggemukan 2 ekor serta pakan babi untuk induk babi yang masih dipeliharanya. Ketut sangat berharap ada pertambahan keuntungan yang diperoleh dari penjualan selanjutnya. Karena hasil beternak babinya ini besar pengaruhnya terhadap kelangsungan keluarganya sehari-har

loans.use: Purchase Piglets and feeds

loans.name: Moa

texts.en: Mr. Moa S., 44, is married with five children and works as a construction foreman. He typically makes around $6 per day. His wife has started a business making and selling desserts for the people in her community. She makes around $5 of net income each day. The daily income she and her husband make is just enough to cover their family's expenses but is barely enough to have sufficient savings for emergency cases. In reality, each month this couple has to spend $96 on food, $10 on utility, $10 on their children's tuition and over $20 on gasoline spent by her husband as he uses his motor-bike to commute to work every day. In order to raise their daily income, this couple would like to ask for a loan from KIVA to buy their son a motor-bike to operate a motor-taxi business. This would greatly benefit their family's well-being.

loans.use: To buy her son a motor-bike to operate a motor-taxi business to generate additonal income for his family.

loans.name: Rose Namiti's Group

texts.en:
Rose is the leader of 4 members of a group. She is a 32-year-old married woman with 3 children, aged between 14 and 10. All of the children go to school. She resides in and rents a single-room house, where she is staying with 5 people. Rose doesn't take care of any additional family members. They do have electricity but no piped water at home.

The family gets 3 meals a day. Rose resides and works in a semi-urban area that is on the outskirts of Kampala. Rose operates a bar in Namungoona, one of the city suburbs. She purchases from suppliers who purchase from the villages. Rose works 7 days a week and rents her business premises. Her major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises, electricity, medication, food, and school fees. Rose sells to an average of 20 customers daily and sells both wholesale and retail. She has been with MCDT for 3 years and is servicing her eighth loan. She wants to invest this loan in this business. Rose is aspiring to build her own commercial room and stop renting.

loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Teofila es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Teofila tiene una tienda en el Jr Grau que se encuentra cerca al mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende ropa de niños, su mercadería lo adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además Teofila junto a su esposo tienen una mototaxi con el cual su esposo realiza transporte publico.
Teofila necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos, pantalones.
Los sueños de Teofila son tener casa propia, un local propio para realizar su negocio y la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the Community Bank "Despertar" (meaning, Awaken).

Teofila is married common-law, she is 25 years old and has one son. Teofila has a store in Jr. Grau which is located near the central market in the city of Ayacucho. She sells children's clothing ans she acquires her mechandise in the city of Lima. Teofila, together with her husband, also has a motorcycle taxi which he drives, providing public transport.

Teofila requires a loan in the sum of 1000 soles, funds which will be invested in the purchase of polo shirts, and slacks.

Teofila's dream is to have her own home, to have her own store where she can carry out her business, and to provide an education to her children.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Teofila requires a loan of 1000 soles, funds which will be invested in the purchase of polo shirts and slacks.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria A. is 33 years old and the married mother of 3 children.  Two of her children are in school and her youngest, shown here, goes to work with her everyday. To provide for her family, Gloria sells a variety of medications in her village.  She lives in Wome, a small town approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital.  She carries the two baskets pictured here on her head and walks throughout the village market selling her products.  Gloria hopes to use this loan from Kiva to travel to the capital and restock her inventory, as more medications are now becoming available in Lomé.  Gloria contributes to the medical needs of her community and with the profits that she will earn from her business, she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To restock her inventory

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
A 48-year-old widow, Mrs. Samnang T. has four daughters, two married, one a silk weaver, and the fourth a student. The family lives on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Samnang has been a silk weaver since 1984, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh. Samnang is now requesting a loan for $500 to purchase more silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Llegando Lejos Iii Group

texts.en: Eugenia M. J. is bank coordinator for a group called Llegando Lejos (Going Far). Her group has five members. She is 35 years old. She lives with her spouse and five children; ages 16, 11, 8, 7 and 2 years old. She sells chicken in her own community in El Seybo. She has already received three loans from Esperanza and is about to receive her fourth. She would like to increase her business by selling a greater quantity of products, such as sugar and coffee; and to expand her activities by selling deodorant. She finds keeping the clients happy to be the biggest challenge in her daily activities. She would also like to improve her house and make her business grow to provide for her large family. On behalf of Esperanza and the Llegando Lejos Bank of Hope, thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase new consumer goods and expand business with new personal care products.

loans.name: Zuwena

texts.en:
Zuwena  has been a fish (majongoo) seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 1 year. 
She belongs to Tumekinai loan group (Group code 2008).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70.Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.  She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fish for her business. 
She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, pay school fees for her children and save money for future use.  

Zuwena is 32 years old, married, and has four children: age 11, 9, 7 and 1.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business

loans.name: Sehllin Liseth

texts.es: La joven Sehllin vende ropa, nueva, usada, zapatos y electrodomésticos, negocio que inicio desde hace siete años, con capital propio y ayuda que dio su mama. Tiene 29 años de edad, reside en Loma linda en la ciudad de Managua, tiene un niño de 5 años de edad, su esposo es maestro de obra. Con este crédito quiere invertir en la compra de ropa variada, zapatos y comprar tres pacas de ropa para ofrecer a su clientela y poder mejorar los ingresos a través de sus ventas. El  objetivo de este inventario es la captación de nuevos clientes. Sus planes para su hijo es poder hacerle un cuarto para que tenga privacidad.
texts.en:
Young Sehllin sells new and used clothing, shoes and appliances, a business she started seven years ago with her own money and help that her mother gave. She is 29 years old and lives in Loma Linda in the city of Managua. She has a five year old child. Her husband is a construction foreman. With this loan, she wants to invest in the purchase of varied clothing and shoes and to buy three bales of clothing to offer to her customers and to be able to improve her earnings through these sales. The objective of this inventory is to capture new customers. Her plans for her child are to be able to make a room so he may have privacy.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing for children and adults and shoes.

loans.name: Tumurtogtoh

texts.en:
Well-respected locally, Tumurtogtoh D. lives with her husband and two grown children in Uvurhanghay province, one of the central provinces of Mongolia. They've called Uvurhanghay home for 24 years, and along with her daughter, Tumurtogtoh operates a small retail stall for men's and women's apparel in the Khuleg shopping center.  Once a month her daughter, Luusenjiimaa, goes to Ereen, a Chinese border town, to buy wholesale clothing, while Tumurtogtoh works as a saleswoman at the stall. 

Their business capital is 4.3 million tugrug ($1 USD=1,500 MNT), and with this loan, her daughter will purchase spring clothes to increase their business inventory.

loans.use: To buy apparel.

loans.name: Damiana

texts.en:
Damiana P. is a 64 year-old woman and happily married. Her husband is a laborer. They were blessed with nine children. Damiana is already on her fourth loan cycle. Her business is a “sari-sari” (general) store of which her primary customers are students, municipal employees, and also the folks of the neighboring barangays. Her business is growing and customers are increasing.

She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 hoping that this will help her in purchasing additional grocery items and meeting the existing needs of her present customers. Damiana believes that the business could grow larger and more stable in the future if it is managed correctly. She’s so thankful for Paglaum’s existence in the community and its program components that helped them realize the significance of patience and hard work.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra.: DOMINGA, ella es natural de la provincia del Cusco del distrito de Ollantaytambo ubicado a 1:30 minutos de la ciudad en transporte público.

Nuestra socia tiene 39 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos de (21, 18, 14) años, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tiene una carreta de venta de golosinas la cuál la surtió con poco de artesanía y se ubica cerca de la puerta de la estación principal de trenes con dirección a la ciudadela inka de Machupicchu. Cada madrugada ella lleva su carreta desde su casa hasta la estación para lograr un espacio y así comenzar su venta diaria, se queda hasta las 10 p.m. que terminan de retornar los trenes y es cuando ella termina su día. La socia requiere el préstamo en razón de que necesita implementar con artesanía variada su carreta y comprar botellas de aguas minerales.

Ella está muy agradecida con el préstamo otorgado y valora el apoyo que ustedes le brindan mediante este medio, así mismo ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Dominga is from Cusco, in the Ollantaytambo district, which is an hour and a half from the city. Dominga is 39 years old and has three children (ages 21, 18, and 14). She supplements her work at home with a small business selling candy and handicrafts. She is stationed near the door of the main train station that offers service to the Incan city of Machupicchu. Each morning Dominga wakes up early to wheel her cart to the train station to make sure that she secures a space. She sells all day, staying at the station until 10pm, when the trains return. Dominga needs a loan to repair her cart and buy bottled mineral water. Dominga thanks you in advance for the loan and values the support that it offers. She promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Set up her cart to sell sweets and handicrafts.

loans.name: Wenlove

texts.en:
Wenlove L. is from the village of Canicapan Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old and married with one school-aged child. To make a living, Wenlove has a vocational school. Her main source of income comes primarily from providing quality education to the local community. She has had her business for over two years and earns approximately 50000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Wenlove joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan for 20,000 PHP to purchase school equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve fund for school improvement.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase school equipment.

loans.name: Amy Demba

texts.fr: Amy DemB. B., 43 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants  en charge.. Son activité est la restauration et le commerce. Elle compte acheter des fruits, de l’huile de palme, du savon et des provisions pour préparer des sandwiches et vendre pour renforcer son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amy DemB. B., age 43, is married and has three children to support. She works in commerce and in the restaurant business. She plans to buy some fruit, palm oil soap, and supplies for making sandwiches to sell in order to bolster her business and to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell sandwiches, fruit, palm oil, and soaps

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina T., 37, is married with six children. She has many years of experience in the sewing and elei printing business (a style of cloth printing which is unique to Samoa and is used in much of Samoan clothing). She sells to the public and villagers five days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD). She has three previous loans with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Penina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This program helps the most in improving her family’s living standard which is very different than it was in the beginning.

loans.use: To purchase cotton materials, needles, thread and a new sewing machine to replace the old one

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en: Gertrude is 38 years old and is a divorced mother of six children. Currently all her children attend school. She sells smoked fish and started her fish selling business 20 years ago at the community market where she lives. She buys her stock of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana and sells them from a table stand and sometimes through hawking. She prepares and serves her customers with a very tasty and good quality fish and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She has a high customer base. Many travel from other parts and from the surrounding communities to buy her fish. She requests the loan to increase and upgrade her stock of fish. She hopes to provide her children with a quality education through the proceeds of the business. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked and dried fish.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Mrs Vanna L. is from Tuol Pang Ror village in Takeo province. She is a 26-year-old mother of two children who are too young to work or study. She sells duck eggs in the local market. Her husband, Mr Saem PhalL., is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he also owns an electric cow and is hired by other villagers to plow their fields. However, currentL. he faces an obstacle with his electric cow and Mrs Vanna L. has decided to ask for a loan to repair it. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To repair the electric cow

loans.name: Redoble

texts.en:
Redoble I. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old and single. To make a living, Redoble makes and sells specialty snack foods, such as desserts and fruit salads, in the local community. Redoble has been in business for more than one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Redoble joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Redoble has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Redoble is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Redoble from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe JIGUISSEME de l’association Sinjiya est constitué de  4 femmes mariées   ayant  une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Médine un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de  fruits.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter,  25 chargements de charrette en fruits (orange et banane). Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages environnants. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché, de façon ambulante dans les quartiers, dans la famille,  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.000 FCFA dont une partie sera réinvestie dans les activités et l’autre partie servira d’épargne.
texts.en:
The group named Jiguisseme of the Sinjiya association consists of 4 married women, with an average age of 28 years, and they each have 3 children. Most of them live in with their families in Medine, a quarter in the city of Sikasso, the 3rd administratrive region of Mali.

They are currentlyh on their sixth loan with the microfinance institution of Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). Their goal is to meet the demands of their clientele.

They carry out various activities, amoung which, is the sale of fruit.

With this new loan they plan on purchasing 25 crates of fruit (oranges and bananas). They are merchants in the large market in the city of Sikasso and in the surrounding villages. They sell their merchandise in the market, or throughout the city quarters, and among family. Their clientele is made up of men and women and they mostly pay in cash.

They forsee having a monthly earning of 23.000 FCFA where a portion will be reinvested back into the business and another portion will be used as savings.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit.

loans.name: Proeun

texts.en: Proeun N., 37, is married with three young children living at home in the Siem Reap province. She makes and sells cakes, typically making US$5 each day and her husband is a policeman. Her husband, Chon Cheat, typically makes about US$3.5 each day. Proeun N. would like a loan of US$1000 to make a few investments. She will buy a motorbike for a family transportation and reinvest in her cake business.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike and reinvest in the business.

loans.name: Hodewa

texts.fr: Cette femme assure seule l’éducation scolaire de ses 02 enfants ; elle a loué un petit entrepôt de vente de maïs dans le quartier de Kagomé à Lomé. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2005 et cela lui permet de subvenir à tous les besoins de sa famille. Elle approvisionne presque tout le quartier en sacs de maïs ce qui leur permet de ne pas parcourir de longues distances pour se rendre au Grand Marché de Lomé. Elle vend aussi bien en gros qu’en détail. Elle veut en ce moment disposer de nouveaux stocks ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour commander 15 sacs de maïs. Elle compte sur sa longue expérience pour rembourser le prêt dans les meilleurs délais.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is a 47-year-old single mother of five children between the ages of 15 and 20 years.  All her children go to school. She resides in and rents a two-room house where she is staying with four people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.  She owns a hardware shop in Natete Kigaga Zone and pays for transport costs to and from shopping.  On average, she receives 20 customers a day. She works in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business eight months and with MCDT six years, servicing her 17th loan, working with the same groupmates. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication. Her challenges include defaulters and thieves. Sylvia wants to use this loan to buy more bags of cement, iron sheets and nails. She aspires to see her business grow stronger and start buying directly from producers.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cement, nails and iron sheets

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 24 years old, married to Isaac Kibe, and they have two children (one school going and the other only a year old).  Eunice has been running her retail shop for the last three years in Niavasha town.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a client. This will be her first loan with KADET, and she plans to buy more dry foods in bulk, including maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and rice to sell in her business.  This will add to the variety of goods in her shop, leading to more income, as her clients will not need to go to buy these items somewhere else.

Her hope for the future is to enter the transportation industry which she views as very profitable.  She plans to start off with a motorbike and buy a mini-bus later.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add more goods for retail sale: maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and rice

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia M. runs a variety store selling food and daily use products in her community. She is 49 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Langcangan, Mahinog Camiguin. Patricia has been in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2008, Patricia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Patricia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used for additional business capital. Patricia is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her fifth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Le We Help Weself Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Le We Help Weself '(Let Us Help Ourselves) group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs who want a loan of SLL 2,000,000 to enable them to improve their businesses. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs will be accessing from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able expand their businesses, sales will thus improve, and so also will their sales-to-profit margin. With a larger profit at their disposal, they will be able to better look after themselves and their children.

The leader of this group is Augusta B. S. on the left. Augusta was born in the town of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. She is now age twenty-nine, married to a teacher, and they have one child who is in primary school. Augusta sells shoes, clothes, jeans, lace, etc. She has been doing business for six years now. With her share of the loan, she will add more shoes, jeans, lace clothes, etc. to her business.

loans.use: Buy shoes, clothes, etc. to sell

loans.name: Laure

texts.fr: A. Laure est née le 30 Octobre 1975 et vit depuis près de 19 ans à PK10 Marina, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Laure est mariée à AGBO Donald, un informaticien. Le couple a trois enfants, mais seulement certains enfants sont scolarisés. Laure vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Laure n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire, et a appris ensuite la couture. Laure exerce cette activité depuis environs 10 ans. Laure vend également des tissus et des produits de mercerie dans son atelier se trouvant à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Laure s’approvisionne. Laure est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de l’institution, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Laure voudrait renforcer son activité pour mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients. C’est pourquoi Laure sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Laure A. was born October 30, 1975 and has been living for the past 19 years in PK10 Marina, in the Sèmè-Podji district of Benin. She is married to Donald AGBO, a computer specialist. The couple have three children, but only some of them are educated. Laure lives together with her husband and children, and the couple share household expenses. Laure has only attended primary school, after which she learned sewing. Laure has been sewing for approximately ten years. She also sells fabrics and haberdashery supplies from her home-based workshop. She goes to Dantokpa, Benin's international market, for her supplies. Laure is a former client of ALIDé, having already been granted three loans by the organisation, all of which were repaid in full. She would like to increase her activities so that she can give better response to customer requests. This is why she is now applying for a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pieces of fabric and haberdashery articles.

loans.name: Leiua

texts.en:
Leiua L. is 58 and married with no children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting   variety of vegetables for sale.  Leiua has many years of experience in this business.  Leiua needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 120 tala or US $50 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2008, Leiua joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Leiua's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Leiua L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.23 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.66 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
32-year-old Roy has three children. He is from Agusan Del Sur, a province in the Philippines where most people are engaged in agriculture. Roy himself is a rice farmer. He currently owns a one-hectare rice field, which he thanks God for because it provides income for his family. He hopes to grow the farm so he will be able to sustain his children’s education.

Roy recently joined Kiva field partner CEVI and is currently on his first loan cycle. He has requested a 6,000 Philippine peso loan and plans to use the proceeds to buy farm supplies. He says he likes CEVI’s program, especially because of its low interest rate.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Vero

texts.en:
Vero is happily married with two children. Her eldest child is 10 years old and the youngest is 6 years old. Her children are still dependent on her and they go to school. Her husband is a business man and he also supports the home. 

Vero is a friendly woman. She loves her business so dearly that she sells daily from 7:00am to 7:00pm. She sells groceries and foodstuffs in her community in Sapele, Nigeria. She hopes to expand her business. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Robilyn

texts.en: Robilyn, photographed in a rice field, is married to Andres, and they have a 3-year-old child. She raises pigs for a living, and she also runs a small store. She wants to be actively involved in her business. So, she finds ways to maintain it and to, hopefully, make it grow. She recently joined CEVI to have financial support. She requested a loan of 6000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy pig feed and additional piglets. She also hopes to add supplies to her store.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and additional piglets

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn T., 40, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. Married to Santos T., a tricycle (three-wheeled vehicle) driver, she is blessed with one child. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her variety store while operating their tricycle for quite some time now.

Jocelyn has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times through CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her businesses.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 13,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying groceries and other materials needed to continue operations of her businesses.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying groceries and other materials needed to continue operations of her businesses

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: La señora Felipa es una mujer trabajadora,  desde su juventud, de edad de 48 años, con su propio negocio,  venta de tortilla y un molino que son su fuente de ingreso. Junto con su esposo  se esforzaron para tener su propia casa y su  pequeño negocio, pues inicio por no encontrar empleo y con la necesidad de poder apoyar a su familia ya que su esposo trabaja en servicio de seguridad siendo su salario bajo. Es por eso comienza a palmear tortilla el cual se hace de mucha clientela. Y luego pone el molino. Con el crédito anterior logro mejorar las condiciones del techo de su cocina. Contenta por que mediante estos financiamiento se ha beneficiado con las mejora de su casa. Con este préstamo terminara de subir el alto de los cuartos ya que están muy bajos, para mejor privacidad,  pintar, y mejorar el techo de los mismos, comprara materiales de construcción para iniciar la obra,  ante que comience la temporada de lluvia. Sus planes es lograr aumentar las ventas de tortilla ofreciendo sus productos a restaurante, pues entrega en comedores pero desea agrandar más, para mejorar los ingresos y poder cubrir los gastos básicos como personales.
texts.en:
Sra. Felipa is a woman who has been working hard since her youth. She is 48 years old and has her own business. Felipa sells tortillas and operates a grain mill in order to generate income. She and her husband struggled to acquire their own home.

Felipa started her small business because she needed to support her family since her husband receives low wages from his job as a security guard. For this reason, she started making tortillas in order to attract many customers and later acquired a grain mill. With her previous loan, she was able to repair the ceiling above her kitchen. Felipa is happy with these loans because they have helped to improve her house.

With this loan she will finish extending the ceilings of the other rooms since they are very low. This will provide greater privacy. She will also have the rooms painted and the roof above them repaired. Felipa will buy the construction materials so that the work can begin before the rainy season starts. Her plans are to increase her tortilla sales by delivering her products to restaurants and diners. She wants to enlarge her business so that she can improve her earnings to cover both her basic and personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to finish the rooms in her house

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano forma parte del banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES”, tiene 50 años, es padre soltero y tiene dos hijos. El brinda servicio de transporte en un taxi, él trbaja todos los días y empieza a las 7 de la mañana  y termina a las 7 noche. Ya son 20 años que se dedica a brindar el servicio y le ha va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Mariano es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, él requiere el préstamo para la educación de sus hijos. El anhelo del socio es sacar profesional a sus hijos y comprar una casa. El banco comunal tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, el socio manifiesta, que se encuentra contento y satisfecho con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal. 
           
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mariano is a member of the Los Diamantes (The Diamonds) Community Bank. He is 50 years old, is a single father and has two children. He offers transportation services with a taxi. He works every day; his day begins at 7 in the morning and ends at 7 at night. He has been doing this for twenty years, and it has been going very well thanks to the determination that he puts into his work. Mariano is a hard-working and enterprising person, who looks at each moment as an opportunity to go forward. With daily effort, he is achieving a better future for his children. He needs a loan for his children’s education. His desire is to have his children work as professionals and to buy a house. The community bank has ten loan cycles. Mariano is happy and satisfied with the bank’s credit, savings, and training services. Mariano is thankful for this opportunity, and he promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mariano needs a loan for his children's education

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: Monsieur Modou D. est un agent de sécurité  dans une école privée à Guediwaye. Il est âgé de 51 ans et est sociétaire  de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC –Centre de sauve garde depuis février 2003.Monsieur D.  a déjà bénéficié de 2 prêts antérieurs. Il n’a jamais fait les bancs et il lui fallait trouver un créneau  pour pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins vitaux. C’est la raison qui l’a ainsi conduit a choisir le métier de gardien. Mais dans le souci d’améliorer les conditions d’habitation de ses deux femmes et de leurs enfants respectifs qu’il  sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs destine a l’achat de ciment, fer, sable, briques et bétons en vu de construire 5 chambres supplémentaires chez lui.
texts.en:
Mr. Modou D. is a security agent in a Guediwaye private school. He is 51 years old and has been a member of the local U-IMCEC savings and loan center since February 2003. Mr. D. has already been granted two previous loans. He has never attended school and needed to find an occupation to meet his basic needs, which is why he chose to become a security guard. As he wishes to improve the living conditions of his two wives and their respective children, he is requesting a loan for 400,000 francs. The loan will serve to buy cement, iron, sand, bricks and mortar, with the aim of adding five rooms to his home.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: Dionicia tiene 47 años, ella vive con su esposo y sus hijos Antoni y Meli de 20 y 6 años de edad respectivamente. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia. Hace mas de 6 años se dedica en la venta de productos de belleza, pues el tener hijos pequeños le demandaba una labor que le diera el tiempo necesario para atenderlos, es por ello que decidió incursionar en este trabajo, ya que puede disponer de su tiempo, en donde puede alternar su trabajo y con las labores del hogar.  Su forma de trabajo consiste en visitar la casa de sus vecinas y amigas para ofrecer los cosméticos vía catalogo, logrando grandes pedidos ya que además su carisma y conocimiento sobre estos productos le han dado mucha ventaja en las ventas. Sin embargo el tener que ir a cobrar le resulta muy tedioso y más aún cuando algún cliente no paga a tiempo su cuota. Gracias a sus años de experiencia ha sabido tratar todos estos inconvenientes, es por ello que quiere ampliar su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de mercadería. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, además ella y su grupo se comprometen a ser muy puntuales con los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para tenerlos en stock y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Dionicia is 47 years old and lives with her husband and children Antoni and Meli, 20 and 6 respectively. They have their own home. For more than six years selling beauty products because having children made it necessary to have a job that would allow her to care for her children. She started this business that she can balance her job with her duties at home. Her work consists of visiting the homes of neighbors and friends selling cosmetics via catalogue. She has received big orders due to her charisma and knowledge about the products. However, having to go and collect payments can be tedious and difficult when clients do not make their payments on time. Thanks to her years of experience she has learned how to deal with these inconveniences. She hopes to grow her business by buying more merchandise. This is her second loan with MFP; she and her group promise to be punctual with their payments. With the loan she is applying for she will buy more beauty products to have in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products

loans.name: Jeaneth

texts.en:
Jeaneth J. is from the village of Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Jeaneth owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as biscuits (cookies), shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2008, Jeaneth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jeaneth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hermilla

texts.en:
Hermilla H. is from the village of Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is a 55-year-old widow, and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $100 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Hermilla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. Hermilla is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Neil

texts.es: Neil, de 23 años, es un joven muy responsable que vive en una casa alquilada.Neil trabaja en su puesto en la venta de comestibles (azúcar, arroz, fideos, conservas, entre otros). Su negocio esta ubicado en un mercado populoso de su barrio, y  sus  clientes son  las amas de casa que gustan de la buena atención que brinda. Hace varios años, el puesto era de  su familia, y él ayudaba, pero desde hace 2 años le pertenece. Se siente muy satisfecho  por la productividad de  su negocio, aunque a veces no se abastece, porque trabaja solo y le faltan manos para la atención. Para mas adelante le gustaría ampliar su negocio con mayor cantidad de comestibles, y también quiere comprarse un puesto propio en ese  mercado, para obtener mayores ganancias, y estar fijo en un solo sitio.Es el  primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que sabe que le servirá para progresar, asimismo esta muy satisfecho con el desempeño de sus compañeras de grupo porque le han demostrado ser responsables y trabajadoras.Neil tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en el  incremento de mercadería de primera necesidad, para mantener surtido su negocio, y así ofrecerles lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Neil is a very responsible 23 year old young man. He lives in a rented house. He works in a stand selling food (sugar, rice, noodles, canned goods, and others). His business is located in a crowded market in his neighborhood. His customers are housewives who like the good service he provides. The stand was his family’s many years ago, and he helped. But, it has belonged to him for two years. He is very satisfied with the productivity of his business even though it is sometimes not stocked. This is because he works alone, and he does not have help. Later he would like to expand his business with a greater quantity of food. He also wants to buy his own stand in the market in order to get greater earnings and to be in one fixed location. This is his first loan with MFP. He pledged to make his payments on time because he knows that will help him make progress. At the same time he is very satisfied with the performance of his colleagues in the group. They have shown themselves to be responsible and hard-working. Neil plans to use the requested money to increase his basic needs merchandise. He will do this to keep his business stocked. Then he can offer his customers the best.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Clarisse is 34 years old, married with 5 children.  Clarisse makes a living by selling a variety of goods in her shop.  Clarisse has been in this business for about two years and the hours of her business are from 6 am to 7 pm every day.

After realizing that her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully, Clarisse decided she needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With this loan, Clarisse will start also selling foodstuffs and increase the sale of drinks in her existing business.  These additional businesses, as Clarisse realized, can bring in a lot of money.  She says that if this is successful, she will earn more money than previously and this amount will allow her to keep reinvesting in her business and start saving for the future.

loans.use: A variety of goods, mainly foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING TWO MILK COWS

loans.name: Shi's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Shi K., age 47, was selected as the village bank president by the fifteen members of this village loan. They are located in Tranh village in Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses.

Mrs. Shi K. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that they use to cultivate rice for a living. She will use the loan that she requested from AMK for this farm, to buy fertilizer, and pesticide to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Yorn Yang, is a laborer, and is able to receive a small salary to add to his wife's savings to support the family. This couple has a child, who is a student in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en: Batbayar P. is a 45 year old single man with two adult-aged children. He lives with his two children in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. His younger daughter, Udvalnyam, attends university while his older son, Chinzorig, helps in his father's business. His wife passed away in 1991, and since then he has been supporting and raising his two children alone. Batbayar is a carpenter, producing and selling a variety of wood items in the local community. He started this business in 1998 and has gained many years of experience. Even though he has not had enough tools and equipment as are needed for production, he has been making quality furnishings with his son. In the future he hopes to expand his business and improve his family’s financial situation. His business earnings have enabled him to pay his daughter's tuition fees. He is a very modest, helpful and hardworking person. He needs more funds to celebrate his son's future wedding and to purchase new equipment for his business. Therefore, Batbayar is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan in order to grow his working capital.

loans.use: To purchase new woodworking equipment

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en: Duyen T. D. is 29 years old and lives with her family in Dao thuc village. Her main activities are growing rice and raising 300 hens. She  sells eggs to cover her daily household expenses. When she has time, she works as a wood caver to earn more money. She has participated in the credit program since 2007 and has effectively used her loans and repaid them on time. Currently, she wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and vaccination medicine to avoid bird flu .

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and vaccination medicine to avoid bird flu .

loans.name: Nohemy Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nohemy Yolanda; ella tiene 62 años de edad y es casada y tiene 8 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte tiene un carro que hace servicio turístico llevando a turistas a diferentes lugares del Cusco, la socia quiere tener un negocio de venta de repuestos. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar la letra de su carro.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, Sra. Nohemy Yolanda, 62, belongs to the SENOR DE MURUHUAY community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Sra. Nohemy, 62, is married and has 8 children.  She operates a taxi business.  She has a car in which she carries tourists to places of interest in and around Cusco.  She would like to set up a business selling spare parts.  She is applying for this loan to make a car payment.

Sra. Nohemy is grateful to everyone who has made her dream come true by this means and is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar la letra de su carro.

loans.name: Nouratou

texts.fr: B. Nouratou est née le 24 Mars 1975 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Nouratou est mariée à ADEKAMBI Sundé, un commerçant. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Nouratou vit depuis dix huit ans au quartier Agbodjèdo à Cotonou, avec  sa famille. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Nouratou a très tôt abandonné l’école, puis a appris la coiffure. Parallèlement à cette activité qu’elle mène, Nouratou vend également des mèches et divers produits cosmétiques dans sa boutique size à Midombo. Nouratou achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà bénéficié de cinq crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Nouratou sollicite un autre crédit en vue d’augmenter son stock de produits et d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
B. Nouratou was born on March 24, 1975 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to ADEKAMBI Sundé, a merchant.  The couple have three children, who are all in school and in their care.  Nouratou has been living for eighteen years in the Agbodjèdo district in Cotonou with her family.  The couple jointly provide for their family.

Early on, Nouratou dropped out of school and then learned how to style hair.  Concurrent to this business that she operates, she sells hair extensions and various cosmetic products in her shop located in Midombo.  She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. 

She is a previous client of ALIDé having already had five loans, which have all been repaid.  Facing the burgeoning demand from her customer base, Nouratou is requesting another loan with the aim of increasing her stock of goods and her sales.

loans.use: Buying hair extensions and cosmetics

loans.name: Salama Development Group 1-Mukono

texts.en:
60,000 shillings is what this decade-long coffee sales business generates for this enterprising and high-spirited 46-year-old business man. He goes by the name of K. William and belongs to Salama Development group-Mukono. It was inspiration from a close acquaintance that got him started in this trade which he has been operating at a food market in Salama-Mukono. 

His previous cattle selling business undertaking was of much help in providing the financial backing as he started. He still ekes out profits from it, though coffee selling is now a first fiddle business. With this loan he says he is going to restock his store with bags of coffee that he says he will resell. He envisions greater prospects for his business in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase coffee for resale

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo V. Jr. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan,  Bukidnon. He is 23 years old. Alfredo is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Alfredo owns and operates a service-based business, providing motorela or habal-habal transportation services to local community members. Alfredo has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP, a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alfredo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alfredo is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools needed for maintenance. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alfredo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
