Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed for maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase sewing materials such as different kinds and colors of thread, big-size needles and so on

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Don Francisco, es un agricultor tiene 54 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, tienen casa propia y se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, él tiene 10 años de dedicarse a los cultivos de hortalizas y es su fuente de ingreso.
Actualmente está en proceso de comprar abono y tratamiento para la plagas ya que está preparándose para sembrar pero no tiene lo suficiente para realizar la compra por lo que solicita un préstamo para realizar dicha compra y llevar a cabo la siembra y darle los cuidos necesarios para obtener una mejor cosecha.
Él quiere realizar una buena siembra, que su producción sea abundante y sana, con su familia quiere seguir unidos trabajando por la alimentación y la salud de ellos.
texts.en:
Francisco, 54, lives in Jiquilisco, Usulután department with his wife and children in their own house.  He is a vegetable farmer.  He has been a vegetable farmer for 10 years and it is his source of income.

He is currently in the process of buying manure and insecticides because he’s getting ready to plant but does not have enough money to buy.  He is asking for a loan for this purchase to be able to carry out the planting and provide necessary care to obtain a better harvest.

He wants to have a good crop, that his production is abundant and healthy.  He wants to continue working together with his family for their food and good health.

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides.

loans.name: Juma Abwoga

texts.en: Juma Abwoga T. is 34 years old and he has been a computer service provider for the last two years in Mwatate. His business is doing well. This is his second loan from KADET LTD and he plans to purchase more computer accessories and stationery for his business. The anticipated profits will be directed to the expansion of his business. His hope for the future is to own a bigger business premise.

loans.use: To purchase more computer accessories and stationery for his business

loans.name: Ada Petrona

texts.es:
Ada es una mujer trabajadora, madre soltera de dos hijos. Tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de leche agria, helados y bocadillos, iniciando por iniciativa propia para poder solventar sus gastos. Ya que se quedo sin trabajo, el cual laboraba como promotora venta.
Hoy en día, necesita aumentar sus productos de ventas, lo que recurre al financiamiento para lograr el objetivo, el cual comprara más leche para hacer leche agria, helados, variedad de bocadillos. Lo que espera aumentar los niveles de venta como la captación de más cliente, logrando poder cumplir con sus compromisos de pago como las necesidades personales.
texts.en:
Ada is a hardworking woman, the single mother of two children. She has a small business selling buttermilk, ice cream, and sandwiches, which she started in order to cover her expenses now that she's lost her job as a product promoter.
Now she needs to increase the amount of products she sells, so she's looking for a loan in order to meet this goal. She will use it to buy more milk for making buttermilk and ice cream, and a variety of sandwiches. She hopes to increase her sales in order to attract more customers, and so be able to make her loan payments as well as cover her own needs.

loans.use: Purchase milk to make buttermilk and ice cream, as well as more sandwiches, in hopes of increasing her sales

loans.name: Armando Jose

texts.es:
Armando  labora como Operador de pozo y es soltero tiene dos personas a su cargo es el primer desembolso que CEPRODEL le otorga, para compra de materiales de construcción para mejora de su vivienda como: cemento, arena, hierro y zinc para la construcción de un cuarto para su casa de habitación..
Agradece a CEPRODEL  por su apoyo.
texts.en: Armando works as a well operator.  He is single and has two people for whom he is responsible.  This is the first loan he has received from CEPRODEL and the funds will be used to buy construction materials for home improvements such as cement, sand, iron, and zinc.  Armando plans to build a room in his house.  He is grateful to CEPRODEL for the support.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for home improvements

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
María vive en la Zona D. Raúl D. Porras Barrenechea, distrito D. Carabayllo, tiene 43 años, conviviente, tiene 4  hijos; uno menor y los tres mayores. Recientemente integra el grupo “La Esperanza”, formado por 10 integrantes, ella es una D. las socias. 
Trabaja vendiendo comida al paso, inicio hace tres años trabajando en la Municipalidad, en un depósito, ahí vendía comida a los trabajadores. Gracias al AlcalD. ella pudo trabajar ahí, pero por motivos personales tuvo que abandonar ese lugar, y entonces decidió poner su negocio en su casa vendiendo a los moto taxistas D. la zona, también trabaja lavando ropa y limpiando las casas D. sus vecinos. Uno D. sus sueños es alquilar un local para la venta D. comida. 
Con el préstamo solicitado desea invertir en la compra D. insumos para la venta D. alimentos asi como para el alquiler D. local para la venta.
texts.en:
María lives in Raúl D. Porras Barrenechea neighborhood, in Carabayllo district.  She is 43 years old, lives with her partner, and has 4 children: one is still young and the other three are grown up.  She recently joined the "La Esperanza" (Hope) group which has 10 members, including herself.  

María works selling meals in the street.  Three years ago she started working for the Council, in a warehouse.  She sold meals to the workers there.  She was able to work there thanks to the Mayor but, for personal reasons, she had to leave the job.  She decided to set up a business at home selling to the drivers of 'mototaxis' (motorbikes with cabins in the back for transporting passengers) in the area.  She also works washing clothes and cleaning her neighbors' houses.  One of her dreams is to rent premises where she can sell her meals.

María would like to invest her loan money in buying supplies for her food business and renting premises for her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her food business

loans.name: Josphat  Musyoki

texts.en:
Josphat Musyoki, aged 35, is married to Priscilla  and together they have three children. They live in Eastleigh. He runs a grocery shop in Eastleigh market which is a busy market. He was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing client.

He has been in the  business for seven years and it gives him a monthly profit of KES. 15,000. This is his second loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to add to his stock of onions, bananas, tomatoes and vegetables in his grocery shop.

If the loans boosts his business, Josphat’s plan is to improve the living standards of his family and extend his business.

loans.use: To add to his stock of tomatoes, onions, vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 40 años y nació en la comunidad de Yanahuara. Actualmente, Francisco vive en la ciudad de donde nació, él es casado y fruto de esta unión tienen cinco hijos, él es una hombre luchador, trabajador que a pesar de las adversidad saca adelante a su familia, él trabaja en una empresa privada de obrero pero él en esta oportunidad requiere el micro crédito para comprar mercadería para el negocio tiene su esposa Yoni que consiste en la venta de fruta. 

Francisco pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Marcela de Virgen del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa  y trabaja con sus compañeras del banco comunal desde hace varias años.
texts.en:
Francisco is 40 years old and was born in Yanahuara community.  He currently lives in the community in which he was born.  Francisco is married and has five children.  He is a driven, hard-working man who gets his family ahead in life in spite of adversity.  He works as a manual worker for a private company and needs this loan to buy merchandise for his wife Yoni's fruit business.  

Francisco is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Villa Marcela de Virgen del Carmen” community bank and has been working with his fellow bank members for several years.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his wife Yoni's fruit business

loans.name: Sabougnouma. Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, et  en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des  familles monogames à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
AMINATA S. fait le commerce de friperies dans ce groupe de femmes et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 3 balles de friperie, grand marché de Sikasso ville. Elle les revend à une place fixe au marché de Hamdallaye de la ville  de Sikasso, de façon ambulante avec sa fille et en famille, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.250FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour  épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Sabougnouma groups are married women, averaging 33 years of age, with four children . They all live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, a working-class district in the city of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).

They are on their first collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of meeting customer demand.

Aminata S. is a group member who sells second-hand clothing. She plans to purchase three bales of second-hand clothing at the big market of Sikasso. She  resells at her fixed vending spot at the Hamdallaye market, as a street vendor, aided by her daughter, and out of her home, to a client base composed of men and women, for cash.

She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 15,250 West African Francs, a part of which will be used to repay her loan interest, and a part of savings.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothing

loans.name: Meldirose

texts.en:
Meldirose S. is from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Meldirose is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Meldirose owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, breads, biscuits, shampoo, soap and beverages in the local community. Meldirose has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Meldirose joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Meldirose has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Meldirose is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, beverages and snack foods. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Meldirose from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, beverages and snack foods

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky C. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 34 years old and is single. Ricky owns & operates a seafood  business, buying and selling fish like kitob, bangsi & bangus. He has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Ricky joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. Ricky is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish like mackerel & sardines. This will be his 7th loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish like mackerel & sardines

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Kodjo est marié et père de 01 enfant,il est agé de 31 ans et se bat au quotidien pour sa petite famille.revendeur de pièces détachées à lomé depuis 5 ans ,il s'approvisionne sur place.
texts.en: Kodjo is married and a father of one. He is 31 years old and struggles on a daily basis for his small family. A retailer of spare parts in Lome for five years, he gets his supplies locally.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Ramona Maria

texts.es:
Ramona Maria tiene 43 años de edad, es casada vive con la esposa e hijos, viven en Parroquia San Pablo perteneciente al Cantón San Miguel.

Los miembros de la V.R.C UNION Y ESPERANZA  se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San Pablo a 30 minutos de la oficina en San Miguel los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembra de maíz, papas y al comercio ventas de legumbres y otros.

Ramona se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de frejol, morocho un poco de papas y trigo, este trabajo lo viene desarrollando desde hace mucho tiempo, las compras las realiza en San Miguel y Vende sus productos en San Pablo y San Miguel en las ferias.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas de frejol, morocho un poco de papas y trigo, el crédito el ayudado a aumentar los ingresos y la producción, ha enfrentado desafíos como la falta de trabajadores y el variación del clima que en ocasiones a dañado los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar mas terrenso para seguir sembrando y cultivar otros productos.

Lo que le gusta es festejar las fiestas del carnaval y trabajar para tener dinero.
texts.en:
Ramona María is 43 years old, married and living with her husband and children.  They live in San Pablo Parish belonging to San Miguel Canton.

The “Unión y Esperanza” (Unity & Hope) communal bank is located in San Pablo Parish 30 minutes from the San Miguel office.  The members of this communal bank are corn and potato farmers and sell vegetables and others.

Ramona farms corn and beans, a bit of potatoes and wheat.  She’s been in this occupation for a long time.  She makes her purchases in San Miguel and her sales take place in farmers markets in San Pablo and San Miguel.

She is asking for a loan to buy bean seeds, corn, some potatoes and wheat.  The loan has helped her increase income and production.  She has faced challenges like the scarcity of laborers and variations in the weather that occasionally have damaged crops.  Her dream is to buy more land to continue working and plant other crops.

She enjoys celebrating Carnival and working to earn money.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds, corn, some potatoes and wheat.

loans.name: Sann

texts.en:
From Prey Chor district, Sann, age 27, is married to Mit, age 28. Both work in the farming business as domestic farmers. Sann has two children who attend school. Her husband has been earning a living for many years by climbing the palm trees behind his house. Palm-tree-climbing jobs are very common for poor people who live in the commune. 

Sann has a plot of farming land. She and her husband have earned a better income since her first two children grew up and went to work. 

Sann is looking for a loan to buy two cows because her old cows don’t support her field work.

loans.use: to buy two cows to support her in the field.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is married and has 4 children, ages 7 to 20. He is very skilled at automobile repairs and runs a business that rebuilds car bodies, does fabrication, and repairs car chassis. He has been running this business for 21 years and it is located in an industrial area. The main struggle is not having enough small tools to help him effectively do his job. Bernard intends to use his loan to buy a grinder and a drill. 

Bernard hopes to use the profits from his business to get more education. In the future, he would like to own his own a motor vehicle business. Bernard describes himself as zealous.

loans.use: to buy a grinder and a drill

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es: Luciano y su esposa la señora María Elena son una pareja muy estable que desea ofrecer a sus 2 hijos una mejor calidad de vida al igual que brindarles protección, la casa que tienen se encuentra ubicada en una calle muy transitada y los niños están pequeños;  por lo que tuvieron que poner  por lo pronto una barda de tarimas ya que temían que se salieran y algún automóvil los pudiera atropellar. Luciano viendo la necesidad que la madera que puso no es de buena calidad, el opto por instalar una barda de block y protecciones para que estuviera mejor cimentada y dar una mejor vista a su vivienda al igual que proteger a su familia de cualquier accidente como algún robo. Para poder lograr su proyecto el necesita comprar material de construcción y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en: Luciano and his wife Maria Elena are a very stable couple who want to offer their 2 children a better quality of life and also provide them with protection.   The house they have is located on a busy street and the children are small.  So they had to put up a fence of wood planks for the time being as they feared that as cars came out they could run over the children.  Luciano sees that the wood that he put up is not of good quality, so he is choosing to install a block wall to be better grounded and give a better view of  their home as well as protect his family from any accident, such as a theft. To accomplish his project, he needs to buy building materials and pay for hired laborers.

loans.use: to put up a wall.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.en:
Eliseo is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is a widower and has four children. 

Eliseo is providing motorcycle transport services (known as motorela or habal-habal services). He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy tools & pay for the utilities needed for the service. 

Eliseo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Eliseo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the utilities needed for the service

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is from the village of San Antonio in the province of Isabela. She is 30 years old and lives in the village with her husband Dante and children. Diana works as a housewife. The total average monthly income of the family is PHP 3,000. 

Diana requests a loan of PHP 5,000 to expand the family business. In particular, she will buy four piglets and food for them. After the piglets are grown, in four or five months, they will be sold at a higher price. The additional profits earned by the family will help them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Millah

texts.en:
Millah is a single woman with three children (two boys and one girl). She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and school fees. 

For the past year, Millah has operated a food stall, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in the area. She dreams of establishing another business in the future. With her KES 40,000 loan she wants to purchase sacks of Irish potatoes, rice and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of Irish potatoes, rice and beans.

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es: Patricia del Carmen D. treinta y cuatro años D. edad vive con sus dos hijos los cuales aun asisten a la escuela. Ella posee una tienda donD. venD. todo tipo D. productos D. primera necesidad y quiere empezar a comerciar producto escolar, su tienda es muy visitada por las personas D. la localidad pues ahí siempre encuentran lo que necesitan con buenos precios y excelente servicio; Patricia es una mujer muy carismática y emprendedora para ella el camino hacia el éxito se vuelve corto si trabaja con el corazón, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, pan, golosinas, bebidas, cuadernos,cartulinas, cromos, lápices entre otros. Patricia del Carmen quiere llenar a su familia D. felicidad y espera en un futuro darles una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Patricia del Carmen is 34 years old, and lives with her two children are are still at school.

She has a store where she sells all kinds of everyday products, and she wants to begin to sell school products.  Her store is frequented by local people, as they can always find what they need at good prices and with excellent service.  

Patricia is a very charismatic and enterprising women; for her, the path to success is shortened if you work with your heart.  This is why she is asking INTEGRAL for the loan, which will allow her to buy bulk grains, bread, candy, drinks, notebooks, cards, stickers and pencils among other things.

Patricia Carmen wants to bring her family happiness, and hopes to proviD. them with a better quality of life in the future.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, bread, candy, drinks, notebooks, pencils.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Karim, a borrower from Iraq, is 46 years old, married and lives with his wife and four children. Since 2000, Karim has owned a carpentry workshop where he constructs, erects, installs, and repairs structures and fixtures made from wood and other materials. He is also involved in the installation of kitchen cabinets.

With more than eleven years of experience in this field, he has a deep understanding of local consumers, enjoys a good reputation for his work, and is well-known in his area.

Karim is requesting a $3000 loan to purchase a diesel generator for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a diesel generator for his workshop.

loans.name: 03.12.91 Thiệu Dương Thiệu Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Gái  works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase farming tools. She is 41 years old, married, and has 4 children. Gái is the group leader of the 91 Thiệu D. solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. She lives and works in Thiệu Hóa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

In 2010, Gái joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Gái has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Gái has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Gái faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Gái hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to buy land of her own, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase farming tools.

loans.name: Toch's Group

texts.en:
Toch Y. is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Kompong Chhnang Province and is the one resident who is straightforward and conscientious.  She is hardworking so that she can help support her family live a better quality of life and her children can receive a good education at university. 

To upgrade her family's standard of living, Toch has been running a business as a fish and vegetable seller in one market near her village. She has been in this business with her husband since 1995. Toch is successful in this business because she has good relationships with her customers and is experienced in this trade. She is able to earn approximately $5 per day to cover her family’s daily expenses. 

Toch wants to see her business grow and earn more profits. She is requesting a loan through HKL, a Kiva partner, to expand her business. She will use this loan to purchase more fish and vegetables to satisfy her clients. She has chosen HKL because it provides good services, lower interest rates than other banks, and long-term periods for repaying her loan. She is hoping that this loan will allow her to expand her business. She plans on repaying the loan punctually. Toch's dream in the future is seeing her children get a good education and have good jobs. This is her first loan with HKL.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and vegetables.

loans.name: Nemat

texts.en:
Nemat, a 53-year-old divorced mother, is retired from the military. 

A year ago Nemat started making special decorations for the holiday seasons, like Christmas, New Year's, and Islamic holidays so she can be able to support her family of seven children. 

Now Nemat has applied for a loan so she can prepare herself for the upcoming holiday season here in Jordan by buying more material and items to make new decorations to sell.

loans.use: to buy more material and items to make new decorations for the holiday season.

loans.name: Erdenesuvd

texts.en:
Borrower Erdenesuvd is a 31-year-old single lady who lives with her younger brother in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, in an area without basic infrastructure. Her brother runs a taxi business while she has been operating a machine and motor oil retail business since 1996. 

First, when she was beginning her business she rented a small stall, but after she graduated her university in 2005, she bought her own stall. Now she has a 2.5 million MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) in working capital. “In winter season, machine and motor oil selling business is very popular, so I need more products.  Unfortunately I haven’t enough money to buy, therefore I am requesting a 1.500.000 MNT loan to purchase more machine oils to sell for upcoming season,” Erdenesuvd said. 

Both of Erdenesuvd and her younger brother help each other and are very hardworking people.

loans.use: buy more machine and motor oil

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is a single man aged 22. He describes himself as a hardworking business man. He has been selling shoes to make a living. He also does farming to supplement his income. He has employed two people to assist him in the business. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. Martin is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to add to his stock of shoes for resale.

loans.use: To add to his shoes stock for resale.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
Otilia, es una mujer casada de 55 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo mayor de edad,  ella  eligio este oficio porque le gusta mucho cocinar.
Otilia es una mujer responsable, luchadora y muy trabajadora con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su familia, Otilia empezó en el negocio desde el año 1990, gana semanalmente  un promedio de S/200 nuevos soles. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, lo invertirá para la construcción de su casa ( habilitación de cuartos),  El  sueño de Otilia es que su hijo siga estudiando en la universidad para que llegue  a ser un gran profesional y terminar de construir su casa para que su familia pueda vivir en mejores condiciones, la señora Otilia esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le esta brindando. Su asesor cree que es un buen cliente y que si cumplirá en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
Otilia  vive y trabaja en famous Nazca, or Nasca, Perú. The city is well known for the legendary Nazca Lines- a series of ancient, immense and inexplicable geoglyphs etched into the desert surrounding the city, generally attributed to the Nazca culture, which inhabited in the region from 300-800 AD. As such, the city attracts a considerable amount of tourism. But Nazca is also known for its hardworking people, who have preserved despite frequent earthquakes, tsunamis, and a high level of poverty in the region.
texts.en:
Otilia is a married woman 55 years old with one grown child.  She chose this job because she loves to cook.

Otilia is a responsible and very hardworking woman and a fighter who very much wants to get her family ahead.  Otilia began in the business in 1990.  She earns an average of 200 PEN weekly.

With the 1000 PEN loan she will receive thanks to Kiva, she will invest in home construction (renovating rooms).

Otilia's dream is that her son will continue studying in the university so he will become a great professional, and that she will finishing building her house so her family can have better living conditions.

Otlilia is grateful for the opportunity that is being offered to her.  Her advisor believes she is a good client who will make her payments punctually.

Otilia lives and works in famous Nazca, Peru.  The city is well known for the legendary Nazca Lines, a series of ancient, immense, and inexplicable geoglyphs etched into the desert surrounding the city, generally attributed to the Nazca culture, which inhabited the region from 300-800 AD.  As such, the city attracts a considerable amount of tourism.  But Nazca is also known for its hardworking people, who have persevered despite frequent earthquakes, tsunamis, and a high level of poverty in the region.

loans.use: to build her house (renovate rooms).

loans.name: Shukriya

texts.en:
Shukriya is a 55-year-old mother of two young men and two daughters. One of the daughters has already married. 

Her husband Ali started helping with her tailoring business at home after he retired from his job. Shukriya started her tailoring and sewing business 20 years ago on a small scale at home and has kept it that way till now. 

She used to sew traditional dresses and other clothes by hand at first, then started using a sewing machine. But now she wants to improve the business and increase her productivity so she applied for a loan to buy an electronic sewing machine that is connected to a computer so she can achieve her goal.

Because Shukriya is a conservative person, her husband Ali has agreed to appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy an electronic sewing machine that is connected to a computer.

loans.name: Gene

texts.en: Gene works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, groceries, etc. to sell in her variety store. She has been in this business for 5 years. Gene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, groceries, etc. to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Hasiya

texts.en:
Hasiya is 55 years old and married with three children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Hasiya has been breeding sheep and cows for the last three years. When she retired, she was left without daily bread, as her pension is only 60 AZN. She decided to start her business and with the help of her father, who was breeding animals for his entire life, they purchased her first cattle.

Hasiya usually buys lambs, raises and fattens them for 3-5 months and then resells them for amore profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 250 AZN and this business is the only source of financial income in her family. Mutton is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Hasiya also keeps milkier cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.  

She wants to expand her business and improve life conditions of her family. She applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN to purchase 10 sheep, one milkier cow and fodder. This will be her fourth loan from AqroInvest CU and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep, one milking cow and fodder

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy, 52, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a tailor. Her husband is a rice farmer. Two of her children are garment workers. 

In order to increase her family income, Channy needs more funds to run a new business. Therefore, Channy requests a loan to purchase rice to resell when the price is higher. By doing so, she can get extra income to support her family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home, build bathroom, and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell when the price is higher.

loans.name: Faaolo

texts.en:
"Faaolo is forty five years old and is married.  She has seven children.  Faaolo owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.    Faaolo needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to supplement her family's income.

In 2009, Faaolo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Faaolo's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is married with no children. He is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Bernard is a farmer and grows coconuts to earn a living. He has been doing this for 30 years. He has requested a loan to (Additional Capital). 

Bernard has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Bernard hopes to expand his coconut field some day.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: La socia continua en el banco comunal “Fuente de Vida” y su actividad económica principal es la venta de comida, ella tiene una pequeña picantería donde vende chicha de jora también prepara diferentes platos típicos de la región como rocoto relleno, tallarín al horno, milanesa de pollo, chicharrón de cerdo y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo.  En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar jora e insumos como carne y aceite. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en: She continues to be a member of the “Fuente de Vida” communal bank and is still selling food.  She has a small café where she sells chicha and also prepares typical regional dishes, such as stuffed peppers, Peruvian linguini, chicken Milanese, pork rinds, and other things.  She’s been doing this for several years and things have gone well thanks to her dedication.  She needs this loan to buy chicha and supplies, such as meat and cooking oil.  She is grateful for this loan and is committed to making her payments in time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en: Mrs.Ngan is 44 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall  where she sells snacks for 15 years. Her family is a low-income household, and market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Ngan faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies to maintain her small restaurant where she sells food for breakfast.This is Ngan's first loan with QB WDF. With her business profits, she hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies to maintain her small restaurant where she sells food for breakfast

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
"This business is a member of the Kandisi Wisdom Women group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff"

Miriam is married with two children who are in lower primary. She had to start a small business to assist the husband cater for the household expenses as well as household development.

In year 2005, Miriam received USD 27 from her husband that enabled her to start a small business of used baby clothes. She used to select assortment of baby jumpers, truck suits, socks that could move fast. This enabled her sales turnover to be high. She ploughed back the profits and this enabled her stock to grow. At the end of 2005, Miriam joined WEEC program. She got USD.55 and added more baby clothes plus baby shoes. Miriam has also received trainings especially on business skills and management; she is able to keep her business records. Miriam saved USD 3 per month and has saved a total of USD 38. So far, her profit per day is about USD 7 per day.

loans.use: Given a loan of USD 300 Miriam will enable her to have a permanent stall and also add stock of new baby clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: PURCHASE MILK COOLER

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace P. has been a client of Kraban Support Foundation for years now. She has had several training sessions on simple record keeping and loan management from the organization. She makes beads for local and foreign markets. She is seeking a loan of US$900.00 from Kiva to help her expand her production.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Michail

texts.en:
Michail has been in business for himself for five years. After graduating from college with a fine arts degree, he decided to put his training to work and started his own furniture manufacturing business. He currently works from his home and produces quality furniture for reasonable prices. His business has done well. In a typical month he makes about $400 profit for himself.

Michail has been a great client with Nadiya Ukraine. He has taken three loans so far – a regular term loan and two smaller express loans, and has repaid each on time. He has requested an additional loan of $500 to help him purchase some necessary equipment and buy wooden frames that he will use to make furniture.

loans.use: Michail would like to purchase tools and wooden furniture frames for his furniture store.

loans.name: Elencith

texts.es:
Elencith makes starch from cassava by using a small electric grater. She sells starch to snack food producers in her neighborhood, in the city of San José de Sisa, in the department of San Martín, Perú.

She began 4 years ago with her own capital of S/. 50.00, which she was able to increase little by little with the help of the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, through its “Corazón de Jesús” Communal Bank. She began with loans of S/.300 (approx. $94). She is now requesting a loan of S/.2,000 ($625) to buy more modern equipment for grating, sifting, and drying the cassava, and also for some ingredients. With the new equipment she is hoping to improve the quality of her product and increase her production.

Elencith is 26 years old and works every day along with her husband. She has two young children, 2 and 8 years old. The older child studies in a primary school in the afternoons. Elencith’s goal is to grow her business and provide good service in the neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Elencith produce almidón a base de yuca utilizando un pequeño rallador eléctrico . Ella vive y vende almidón a los productores de bocaditos de la zona en la ciudad de San José de Sisa, en el departamento de San Martín – Perú. Empezó hace 4 años con un capital propio de S/. 50.00, incrementándolo poco a poco con el apoyo económico que le brindó Manuela Ramos, a través del Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”. Ella ha recibido al inicio S/300 (aprox US$94), actualmente ha solicitado S/.2,000 (US$625) para comprar un equipo moderno para rallar y cernir la yuca, como para el secado del almidón y un poco de insumos. Con ello busca mejorar la calidad del producto e incrementar su producción . Ella tiene 26 años y empieza a trabajar todas las mañanas en compañía de su esposo tiene dos hijos pequeños de 2 y 8 años, este último estudia en una escuela primaria por las tardes, sus metas son crecer y dar un buen servicio en la zona.

loans.use: To buy equipment for making cassava starch and to buy ingredients

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Desak Suarsi

texts.id:
Desak Suardi is a widow with 1 daughter. Desak lives alone now since her daughter is already married and living with her husband. Her house is very simple with ground flooring and its wall is made from bamboo. Despite these circumstances, Desak Suardi still has a strong heart to handle the harsh life. She has pig farm as her only business. With the help of DINARI, she bought 2 pig babies which cost Rp. 450,000 (about $50). Every evening she prepares the pig food for the evening and the morning. She feeds the pigs twice a day; at 4pm and 8am. She does these routines with diligence and she hopes she can quickly sell the pigs. In 3 months, she could sell the pigs with total price Rp. 1,300,000 (about $143.4). She got Rp.500,000 (about $55) net profit after deducting the pig food expenses. This profit is very useful to cover her daily life expenses. For the next loan, she will use it to buy 4 more baby pigs to gain more revenue.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Desak Suarsi adalah seorang janda dengan satu anak perempuan. Karena anaknya sudah menikah dan ikut dengan suaminaya maka saat ini Desak Suarsi tinggal hanya sendirian. Rumahnya sangat sederhana lantai masih terbuat dari tanah, tembok dinding hanya terbuat dari bambu yang dianyam-anyam dan lantai tanah. Walau demikian Desak Suarsi tetap tegar dalam menghadapi perjalan hidupnya yang memprihatinkan. Kegiatan usaha yang ditekuninya hanyalah beternak babi. Dengan bantuan dari Yayasan DINARI Desak Suarsi membeli 2 bibit babi dengan total harga Rp. 450.000,-.Setiap sore Desak Suarsi meracik pakan untuk sore hari dan pagi harinya. Pemberian pakan dilakukan sehari 2 kali yaitu sore pukul 16 wita dan pagi hari pukul 08.00 wita. Hari demi hari kegiatan rutin ini dikakukan dengan tekun, dengan harapan ke 2 babinya cepat bisa dipanen/dijual. Panen dilakukan setelah pemeliharaan bejalan 3 bulan dengan total penjualan Rp.1.300.000.- Keuntungan bersih yang didapat sebesar Rp. 500.000.- setelah dikurangi biaya pakan. Keuntungan tersebut sangat berarti bagi Desak Suarsi sebab dapat membantu pendataan untuk dapat mencukupi kebutuhan hidup sehari - hari. Rencana untuk pinjaman berikutnya akan membeli 4 ekor bibit babi agar keuntungan semakin meningkat lagi.

loans.use: To add growing pigs

loans.name: Andrey

texts.en:
Andrey, pictured here in our loan office in Stryi, is an enthusiastic entrepreneur from western Ukraine. He operates a business selling special filters used in the cement industry. Andrey’s father originally started the filter business and Andrey has now taken it over. Prior to that Andrey was involved in another business where he proved to be a stable business-owner. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and open his own manufacturing facility. Andrey is single and is able to use his income to help his parents.

Andrey has requested a short-term loan of $500 to purchase material used in making filters. We are happy for this opportunity to assist Andrey in operating a successful, profitable business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Paula Azucena

texts.es:
Before Señora E. had her current business, she made candies. Nevertheless, because of the type of work, the income she made wasn't enough for her family to live on. Since she's a single mother with two kids to take care of, she took the initiative to search for another activity that would generate better profits for her.

She decided to become a member of Ceprodel two years ago, and she has received a lot of support from this instituton, having received 16 credits. This is why she started to sell cosmetics and candies as a street vendor, but this type of business wasn't working out for her. So, with her other loans, she requested a location in La Estación market, and established herself there doing what she does now, which is selling cosmetics.

Her business has increased from the loans she's received, and she has also been able to improve her quality of life and to achieve her objective, which was to obtain a location in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Señora E., antes de tener su negocio se dedicaba a la producción de golosina. Sin embargo, por el tipo de trabajo los ingresos obtenidos no eran lo suficiente para subsistir con su familia ya que es madre soltera con dos hijos a su cargo, por lo que toma la iniciativa de buscar otra actividad de negocio que le genere mayor ganancia.

Decide afiliarse con Ceprodel y hace dos años ha recibido mucho apoyo por parte de esta institución obteniendo así ayuda con 16 créditos a su favor. De esta manera inicia a vender sus cosméticos y golosinas de forma ambulante sin embargo, este tipo de negocio no le estaba resultando, por lo que con los otros prestamos solicitó un tramo en el mercado La Estación y se estableció quedándose al final en la actividad que realiza actualmente como es venta de cosmético.

El negocio ha incrementado con los créditos otorgados por la institución además de ayudarle a mejorar su nivel de vida y obtener su objetivo como lo era conseguir el local en el mercado.

loans.use: Acquisition of cosmetics

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es:
Patricio has a minibus which provides inter-city public transport between El Alto and La Paz: he drives and (as do many Bolivian women) his wife works as conductor on the same minibus (her work is to collect money from every person who gets on the minibus and also to indicate the minibus’ route). This provides the income with which they provide for their four small children: they live in the area Villa Ingenio in the town of El Alto.

The loan that Particio is now asking for is in order to buy cement and iron in order to continue improving their small family home, refurbishing it in order to provide their son with a better quality home.

This is their second Kiva loan: their prompt repayment has allowed them to apply for another loan.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Patricio tiene su minibús que trabaja de transporte publico Inter ciudad El Alto – La Paz; él trabaja de chofer y como muchas mujeres bolivianas la esposa trabaja de ayudante en el mismo minibús (su trabajo es cobrar el costo del pasaje a cada persona que sube al minibús y al mismo tiempo indicar cual es la ruta del minibús). Esta es su fuente de ingreso con lo que mantienen a sus cuatro pequeños hijos; vive en la Zona Villa Ingenio de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito que ahora solicita es para comprar cemento y fierro y continuar mejorando su pequeña vivienda familiar, con una refacción de la misma, lo cual le ayudara a tener mejor calidad de hábitat para su hijo.

Es el segundo crédito con kiva, el buen comportamiento de pago le faculta acceder a otro préstamo.

loans.use: Refurbishment of house - purchase cement and iron

loans.name: Deonisia's Group

texts.en:
Jannett, Delia and Deonesia have been members of the “Tulipanes” community bank for between one and two years. In the community bank, they have learned to save, be responsible, be punctual, be aware of their rights as women, and learned how to treat their children as well as their clients.

Jannett is 20 years old. She and her brother own a metal works shop. In addition, Jannett is studying cosmetology.

Delia is 28 years old. She lives with her partner and two children who are ages twelve and three. Delia has been selling clothing for one year. She takes orders from her friends and family and then goes to Lima to buy the products.

Deonesia is 40 years old. She is married and has four children between the ages of seven and twenty-two. With her husband, Deonesia upholsters auto seats. They travel to Lima to buy parts for their business.

Jannett, Delia and Deonesia need loans of 1000, 1000, and 1200 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and upholstery materials.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Jannett, Delia and Deonesia plan to use their savings for emergencies, to buy land, and to cover medical expenses. Their dreams are to open a beauty salon, help their families, own a home, have stable businesses, and that their children will be professionals.

loans.use: Jannett, Delia and Deonesia need loans of 1000, 1000, and 1200 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and upholstery materials.

loans.name: Maria Argentina

texts.es:
At 27 years old, Maria C. is a young rural woman accustomed to the hard work of agriculture. She lives in La Concepción, San Caralampio, an agricultural area known for fruit production. She has 3 children aged 13, 11 and 8. Together with their father the children grow pineapple, papaya and coffee. They get up very early every morning to work the land. With the sweat of their brows, Maria and her husband have moved their family ahead. They are a very industrious and hardworking young couple. They are requesting a loan with which to buy agricultural supplies for the maintenance of their pineapple harvest. The products will guarantee the quality of this important and commercially valuable fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La joven Maria C. a sus 27 años de edad es toda una mujer de campo acostumbrada al trabajo duro de la agricultura, vive en La concepción, San Caralampio una zona que se caracteriza por ser agrícola cultivando mayormente frutas. Tiene 3 hijos de 13,11 y 8 años de edad, junto al padre de sus hijos cultivan piña, papaya y café. Se levanta a primera hora de la mañana a trabajar en sus tierras, con el sudor de su frente han logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, son una pareja joven muy esforzada y trabajadora. Solicitan un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas de mantenimiento para su cosecha de piña y poder garantizar la calidad de esa fruta tan importante en el comercio de esa zona.

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.ru:
Muhiddin T. lives in Tursun-zoda. He is 25 years old and single. He has a university diploma in engineering and works at the Tajik Aluminum Factory. Muhiddin also trades crockery from his house. He has been in this business for 3 years. Because his salary is not enough, the client trades in his free time. Additional income allows his family and him to purchase necessary food and clothes.

Currently, the client wants to buy a large amount of goods from whole sale traders. Local people will be able to purchase Muhiddin's crockery without having to leave the city. Muhiddin decided to apply for a loan. He will pay back within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

Тураев Мухиддин Нуридинович житель города Турсунзаде.Мухиддину 25 лет , холост. Образование высшее ,по специальности инженер, работает на Таджикском Алюминевом заводе. Так же занимается куплей продажей посуды,торгует из своего дома. Занимается бизнесом 3 года.Так как заработной платы не хватает, клиент в свободное от работы время занимается бизнесом. Этот дополнительный заработок позволяет ему и его семье приобретать необходимые продукты питания и одежду. В данный момент клиент хочет закупить больше товара у оптовых поставщиков для реализации . Местные жители могут покупать у него подарочные наборы, не выезжая за пределы города .Мухиддин решил взять кредит . Планирует погасить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the selection of goods

loans.name: Tek

texts.en: Tek S. is 28 years old, working in Kampong Cham’s Toul Tom Pong Market. She is a chef specializing in weddings that require certain Khmer delicacies. She is rather new to the job, only having worked in the market since 2007. She is earning low wages at the time of $1.50 (US) per day. Her husband is the primary breadwinner, earning $3 (US) per day as a taxi driver within the city of Kampong Cham. Business has been tough for all taxi drivers in recent days as the cost of gasoline is approaching $6 (US) per gallon. He has been a taxi driver since 1990 and knows his trade well. They have one child together but also care for two of Tek's younger sisters, one of whom works with her as a chef. As her meager earnings from her current job are not sufficient to support her family, she wants to take out a loan to buy fish to raise in ponds by her house. She wants to continue to expand this business to include other types of livestock until she feels like she can safely quit her current job.

loans.use: To raise fish and other animals.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28 year-old Patricia O..  She is married and has no children.  In 2007, Patricia established a beauty salon business. Patricia requires a loan in order to expand her range of haircare products and wigs. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand her range of haircare products, wigs and hair extensions.

loans.name: Mamodu's Group

texts.en: These are Momodu M., Daniel T., Sayo K., Temu S. and Mamodu S.. They are all working with the military here in Makeni. They are requesting a loan of U$ 1,375.  Momodu will use part of the loan to give to his wife to do business with and with the balance he will buy himself a few pieces of furniture. Daniel and Mamodu will give theirs to their wives to do business with. Sayo said he will use his to pursue his education and Temu will use his in a house building project he has begun. Momodu M. is the leader (for this purpose) of this group. He is now 45. He was born in Koinadugu, and he is married with 4 children. His wife sells local produce.

loans.use: Give to their wives to invest in businesses and part for educational purposes

loans.name: Mohbigul.

texts.ru: Давлатова Мохбигуль бизнесмен. Занимается торговлей. Опыт работы в данной сфере 6 лет. Имеет магазин , который арендует , продает продукты питания. Бизнес дает неплохой доход , но для увеличения объема продаж необходимо финансовое вливание. Поэтому он планирует получить кредит и увеличить ассортимент товара. Ее магазин является единственным источником дохода ее семьи. Муж не работает , а дети еще совсем маленькие. Но несмотря на это все они живут дружно и весело. Погашать кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев
texts.en:
Давлатова Мохбигуль бизнесмен. Занимается торговлей. Опыт работы в данной сфере 6 лет. Имеет магазин , который арендует , продает продукты питания. Бизнес дает неплохой доход , но для увеличения объема продаж необходимо финансовое вливание. Поэтому он планирует получить кредит и увеличить ассортимент товара. Ее магазин является единственным источником дохода ее семьи. Муж не работает , а дети еще совсем маленькие. Но несмотря на это все они живут дружно и весело. Погашать кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Увеличить товарооборот

loans.name: Eung

texts.en:
Mrs. Eung O., 44, is housewife staying home to care for her children and cook food for the family. Her husband, 39, is taxi driver, earning approximately US$ 6 per day. Eung has six children, all of whom are living in the family's home in Ratanak Commune, Battambang Province.

The family is helped by the eldest son who works as a construction worker to support the family. Now Eung O. faces obstacles with her husband's car breaking down. Hence, she would like to request a loan of US$ 700 to repair her husband's car which he drives as a taxi.

loans.use: To repair her husband's car which he drives as a taxi

loans.name: Miawognoin Group

texts.fr:
Créé en 2005 à Aklakou au TOGO, le groupement MIAWOGNOIN compte trois membres. Il a pour objectifs de faciliter l’accès au crédit et d’améliorer les conditions de vie  de ses membres.

Pour répondre à la forte demande de ses membres, il sollicite un crédit qui servira  de fonds de crédit à ses membres. Soulignons que depuis sa création, le groupement n’a jamais enregistré d’impayé.
texts.en:
Created in 2005, in Aklakou, Togo, the MIAWOGNOIN group is composed of three members. Their goal is to facilitate access to credit and to improve the family living conditions of its members. To meet the strong demand of its members, the group is requesting a loan that will serve as funds for lending to its members. Let's emphasize that, since its creation, the group's records show it has never missed a payment.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Access to credit for general services

loans.name: Muška

texts.en:
A Kiva Fellow recently interviewed Muška. To see a clip from the interview, check out the youtube video at: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fvo6j84FKZ8

Muška was born in 1950. She lives in Srebrenica, a village devastated by the Bosnian war in 1995. In 1995, she was deported first to Tuzla and then to Sarajevo, where she lived until 2001. Her family was one of the first to return to her neighborhood. She now lives in Srebrenica with her husband, on a farm where she raises cows and turkeys and grows vegetables. She has two sons, both of whom are married and one of whom has children. In addition to farming and taking care of her animals, she often watches her grandchildren during the day, because their mother is a law student at a local university.

Muška requests a loan of 600KM from Women for Women, International to purchase the seeds and materials to grow and prepare a special corn-based product. The product is a mix of corn and grasses, and can be stored to feed cattle in the winter time. This is considered a specialty food for cattle, and is in high demand in Srebrenica. 

Muška’s loan will be guaranteed by her daughter-in-law, Tifa E..

loans.use: To buy farming supplies

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac O. is 29 years old and he is single. He sells motor spare parts in a motor spare parts market. He sells daily from 7am - 7:30pm. He is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more motor spare parts to sell and he hopes to expand his business. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Sokhun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhun M., 46, and her husband, Mr. Pov Kong, 31, married in 1996 and have four children; two sons and two daughters. Three of their children attend school and the other one is still young. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sokhun and her husband have been growing lotus for twelve years and have been growing rice since they were young. She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 500 to repair their motorized hand tiller and purchase fertilizer for farming.

loans.use: To repair a motorized hand tiller and purchase fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Marietou

texts.fr:
Marietou T.  a 46 ans et vit dans une grande famille avec son époux et ses six (6) enfants (3 garçons et 3 filles) à Mancourani I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Marietou T. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente des  fruits (orange) il y a maintenant dix neuf (19) ans. Elle mène son activité au nouveau marche de Médine Sikasso. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant cinq (5) ans. Après 5 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son 7ème prêt individuel, tous ses prêts precedents ont ete correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 1 chargement de camion “10 tonne” d’orange. Elle s’approvisionne dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso avant de les revendre en détail et en gros à une clientèle composée généralement des forains venant d’autres villes du pays mais d’ailleurs (DAKAR) en république sénégalaise.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Marietou T., age 46, lives in a large family with her husband and six children (three boys and three girls) in Mancourani I, one of the working-class districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having done many kinds of work without success, she got started in this work buying and selling fruit (oranges) nine months ago. She works at the new marketplace of Médine Sikasso.

Concerned about doing better in satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago now. After five solidarity loans (group loans) in a women’s association in her district, she is on her seventh individual loan. All her preceding loans have been correctly repaid. She plans to use this loan to buy a 10-tonne truck-load of oranges. She gets her supplies in towns surrounding Sikasso and then resells them retail and wholesale to customers composed generally of market vendors from other cities in the country and elsewhere (DAKAR) in the Republic of Senegal.

With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase her working capital, to help with family expenses, and to pay the loan interest.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit (oranges)

loans.name: Tumejidhatiti Group

texts.en:
Riziki J. has been a soup seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 1 year. 
She currently earns an average monthly profit of $35. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. 
She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.  

Riziki J. is 45 years old, married, and has six children: aged 19, 17,16,14, 11 and 9. 
She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Riziki S. and Sikudhani. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To expand her business (To buy more items for her business.)

loans.name: Adèle

texts.fr:
H. Adèle est née le 31 Décembre 1975 à Cotonou, la capitale économique du BENIN. Adèle est  couturière de formation; elle exerce son métier dans son atelier situé dans la rue opposée à l'église Saint Michel de Cotonou. Adèle s'est mariée à YEBA Augustin, garçon de salle au Centre National Hospitalier et Universitaire du Bénin. Adèle est mère de deux enfants dont l'aîné fait la maternelle. Adèle est actuellement à son quatrième crédit et elle sollicite ce crédit pour mieux s'approvisionner en certains produits qu'elle n'arrive pas à vendre jusque là faute de moyens financiers. Adèle met beaucoup de rigueur dans la gestion de son activité afin de pouvoir bien rembourser son crédit et bénéficier d'autre prêt. Car les crédits qu'elle obtient lui ont toujours permis de fidéliser ses clients et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
H. Adèle was born on December 31, 1975 in Cotonou, the economic capital of BENIN. She is a dressmaker by training and works at her trade in her shop, located on the street opposite the church of Saint Michel de Cotonou. Adèle is married to YEBA Augustin, a room assistant at the Centre National Hospitalier et Universitaire du Bénin. She is the mother of two children, the eldest being in kindergarten.

Adèle is currently on her fourth loan and is requesting this loan to supply herself better with certain goods she has not been able to sell so far due to a lack of funds. She puts a lot of rigor into managing her business, so as to be sure to repay her loan and to obtain other loans. This is because loans always enable her to win the loyalty of her customers and to increase her turnover.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two bolts of cloth and some sewing-related items

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina sells provisions and foodstuffs to people living in her community. She is 40 years old and married with four children.  She lives in Delta State, Nigeria and she has been in this business for years. She needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase more provision and foodstuff to sell. She is a LAPO. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Faraji

texts.en: Faraja Mhidin is a Tanzanian business married man. He runs a photo studio at Yombo Vituka in Dar es Salaam. He produces all types of photos including passport size. He purchases business materials from Kariakoo Photo studio shops in whole and retail sales. He has been in the business for four years and he has been our client for seven years. He is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 Tanzanian Shillings to buy more business materials to meet his customers' demand.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. APOLINAR, el es natural de la provincia del Cusco del distrito de piñipampa, ubicado a 40 minutos de la misma ciudad.

Este socio tiene 37 años de edad, conviviente con 2 hijos y alterna sus actividades de la agricultura con la elaboración de tejas artesanales, este trabajo el lo conoce desde muy niño, debido que el ayudaba a su padre a la elaboración de tejas, el solicita el préstamo para poder comprar materia prima para elaborar las tejas de arcilla,  arena, y alquiler del horno para coser su producción y después transportarla a la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado debido que esta zona no hay acceso ala banca financiera, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su préstamo.
texts.en:
Apolinar is native to the province of Cusco in the district of Piñipampa, which is about 40 minutes from the city. Apolinar is 37 years old, lives with his two children, and divides his time between farming and making artisan tiles. He learned to make tiles as a child, when he helped his father with the craft. Apolinar has requested a loan so that he can buy tile-making materials like clay and sand, rent ovens, and afford to transport his tiles to the city of Cusco. Apolinar appreciates this loan because there is no commercial banking available in his area. He has agreed to abide by all the terms of his loan.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clay for tile-making

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya H. is currently in the business of selling hair essentials at her beauty salon and is requesting a loan to increase the stock in her shop. Aya is twenty-nine years old and married with three children, who are all in school. Her husband is a peasant. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a lorry for hire.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more materials in her salon

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
A livestock breeder from a very young age, Zaur R. is 35 years old, married, and responsible for his wife and three children.

With the goal in mind to increase his income and expand his business, Zaur is requesting a loan of $1,500 that will serve him as business capital. The profit he will make from this business will allow him to improve the living conditions of his household and also enable him to make some investments.

loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: Faatafunaina

texts.en: Faatafunaina F., age 56, is married and has five children. She has many years of experience raising pigs. She sells to the villagers/public 3 days per week. She has no previous loans from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Faatafunaina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a pig fence, steel pipe, and nails to start her business

loans.name: Young Tourist Group

texts.en:
This is Amidu K., Adamsay K., Alie K., and Mohammed K.. They call their group Young Tourists. This will be the fifth loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans were very helpful in the businesses and lives of these people. Their businesses, and thus their livelihoods, grow. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are requesting a new loan in order to further strengthen their businesses. They are seeking a loan of Le 1,300,000.00 each.

Amidu K. (middle) is the leader of this group. Amidu was born in Makeri, about twenty-two miles from Makeni City. He is thirty-seven years of age. Amidu is married to a business woman who sells slippers; they have three children. Two of their children are in primary schools and one is still young. Amidu sells slippers and has been in the business since 1994.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
“A man of perseverance lives progressively while a man of laziness lives downwardly” says Rosemarie of Barangay Inaban Dupax del Norte, in Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Eduardo and they have five children. Through their hard work and sacrifice, the couple have able to send their children to school. Two of their children are graduates of a vocational course and are presently working as security guards. The others are still in school. The couple continues to work hard so that their business will progress and they will be able to give their children a good future. 

Rosemarie helps her husband manage their rice-farming business, which is their only source of income.  She is requesting a loan of PHP10000 for the maintenance of their farm. She hopes that their income will grow because their family expenses are growing. Aside from farming, Rosemarie is also engaged in the direct-selling business of AVON cosmetics products, which helps provide for some of their needs.

loans.use: Additional working capital

location.town: Inaban Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca A. is from the village of Colonia, Valencia City. She is 44 years old. Rebecca is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Rebecca owns and operates a business selling vegetables in the local community. Rebecca has been in business for over 24 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rebecca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rebecca from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jamilet De Rosario

texts.es: La Señora Jamilet del Rosario C. F. tiene la edad de 38 años. Es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que posee este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Por lo que sus inicios surgen con muy poco capital, pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Por lo que tenía que pagar las cuentas de su vivienda y además proporcionarles a sus hijos estudios y alimentación. Poco a poco fue incrementando su inventario con las pocas ganancias que su negocio le generaba, sus clientes recurrían a su negocio ya que la atención  de Jamilet es muy buena y además atiende a sus clientes con una sonrisa en sus labios. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa nueva, calzado, ropa interior y bolsos. Su mayor sueño es que cada uno de sus hijos logre finalizar sus estudios y que sigan adelante con esta actividad que les ayudo a salir adelante.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Glaiza

texts.en:
Glaiza R. is from the village of Brgy.4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 21 years old. Glaiza is separated from her spouse and has 1 child who is an infant. To make a living, Glaiza owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dried fish in the local community. Glaiza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Glaiza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glaiza is requesting loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Glaiza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Darjaa

texts.en:
G. is 53 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her two sons, aged 20 and 22, both attend school at the local university and her husband is a driver for a construction company.

G. operates a business in her town making clothes. She not only sews the traditional Mongolian-style clothing, but she also sews European-style clothing.

G. started her own business after retiring from a dressmaking company. Because she has gained a lot of experience, she knows what her customers want and how much they are willing to pay for her quality clothing. She wants to one day upgrade her old sewing machine into a newer, more sophisticated one so that she can experiment with more elaborate designs.

G. is requesting a 550,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase more fabrics and finishing materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics and finishing materials for her business

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar R., 31 years old, lives in a poor community in Parola, Tondo, Manila—a shantytown at the edge of Manila Bay. Her husband, Gary, is a vendor like her. Two of their three children are now in elementary school, and the youngest is not yet in school.

Maricar’s general store has been in operation for eight years now. Her neighbors buy rice, grocery items, and other basic household necessities from her store. She is making more than 30,000 PHP a month in net revenue. She uses her profits to sustain daily family needs and support her children's education.

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005. She has just finished repaying her previous loan with the cooperative, so she has applied for a new loan in the amount of 14,000 PHP to use as additional capital for the continuous growth of her business. She will restock on nonperishable grocery items and rice to sell at her store.

Maricar wishes to see her store grow into a mini-mart or a supermarket someday. She also dreams of a new house and lot for her family.

About CCT: The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical missions in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for retail

loans.name: But

texts.en: But S. is 39 years old and a resident of the best territory in Phnom Penh, the capital. She currently works sewing clothes for a garment factory and gets a set salary of $120 per month. She is a single woman and currently lives with her niece in the family home. However, S. is not comfortable because her house often needs to be repaired. She would like a loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house

loans.name: Meldrin

texts.en:
Meldrin O. is from the village of Pandan, Mambajao Camiguin Province. He is 38 years old. Meldrin is married and has 1 school-aged child.
