To make a living, Meldrin buys and sells "copras" or dried coconut meat in the local market. Meldrin has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Meldrin joined HSPFI to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meldrin is requesting his first loan of 5000 PHP which he will use to purchase additional products to sell.

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
Feliciano se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive en la comunidad de Tahari (Achacachi) de la Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz ubicado a dos  horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz. 

Su esposa solo colabora con los quehaceres de la casa.

 Tiene cinco hijos  los cuales  se encuentran en edad escolar.
 
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de ganado de raza mejorada (una vaca lechera) y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Feliciano raises cows. He sells their milk production to an Andean PIL (Industrialized Milk Plant). He lives in the Tahari (Achacachi) community in the Omasuyos province, La Paz department. It is two and a half hours from the city of La Paz. His wife only works on the household chores. He has five school aged children. The loan is to buy a better breed of cow (a dairy cow) to increase milk production and increase his income. This is his second loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Del Mañana (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Triunfadoras del Mañana se formó en la ciudad de Cuenca,  ciudad llena de tradiciones y  leyendas que encierra una belleza incomparable,  ésta urbe ha sabido aprovechar la riqueza de la zona en la que fue edificada elemento clave para su crecimiento económico y social que le ha llevado a ser una ciudad de gran empuje industrial.

Este banco está conformado por hombres y mujeres muy alegres  que se unieron impulsados a buscar una mejor calidad de vida para toda su familia,  nos brindan sus vivencias.

La señora María Alicia  C. es socia  activa de éste banco comunal  desde hace cuatro ciclos, vive en el sector El Carmen de Guzho  a unos 15 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca con sus cinco hijos de 13,12,6,5 y 2 años de edad, su hijo  mayor no estudia el prefiere trabajar y  lo hace  en una latonería mientras que sus hermanos estudian en la escuela Aurelio Ochoa y el bebe  pasa en una guardería. Gracias a su trabajo logró construir su casa propia.

María Alicia ingresó al banco comunal por incentivo de una amiga quien le hablo  de la facilidad de obtener los créditos y las facilidades de pago, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas desde hace quince años, no tiene un puesto propio por eso sus ventas las hace recorriendo todo el mercado esta actividad la realiza de domingo a domingo sin  descansar.

Nuestra socia nos comenta que con  los préstamos recibidos   ha  ido incrementando su negocio y con el nuevo crédito solicitado va a comprar más frutas como papaya, sandia, melón, guineo, manzana, mangos etc.  Para contar con un stock surtido de frutas para ofrecer a sus clientes y  seguir incrementando su negocio.

Su sueño es hacer mejoras en su casa.

La señora  Margarita Jiménez es otra de las socias del banco comunal Triunfadoras del Mañana, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo y nos comenta que su hermana le incentivo a formar parte de la banca comunal, los prestamos le han beneficiado para seguir con su negocio.

 Margarita se dedica a la venta de legumbres trabaja en este negocio desde que era muy pequeña ya que su abuela y su mamá vendían en el mercado y dice que se podría decir que es una tradición familiar, esta actividad la realiza los  días jueves, sábados y domingos los demás días se dedica a cultivar la tierra.

Con el nuevo préstamo que reciba de la fundación va comprar   tomate, cebolla, arveja, zanahoria y más, para incrementar su negocio. Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Triunfadoras del Mañana” (Tomorrow’s Winners) was founded in the city of Cuenca, which is surrounded by incomparable beauty and full of traditions and legends. The city has taken advantage of the abundance in the area, which has been a key to its economic and social growth that spurred its rise to becoming a high-powered industrial city.

This Communal Bank is composed of enthusiastic men and women who have joined together to seek a better quality of life for their families. They share their experiences with us.

Sra. María Alicia C. has been active member of this Communal Bank for the past four loan cycles. She lives in the area called El Carmen de Guzha, which is about 15 minutes away from the city of Cuenca, with her children ranging in age from 2 to 13 years. Her oldest child is not in school and preferred to pursue a job working at a brass works shop. The other school-age children attend classes at Aurelio Ochoa Elementary, while the baby is enrolled in day care. As a result of her work, María Alicia has managed to build her own home.

She joined the Communal Bank upon the recommendation of a friend who told her about how it easy it was to obtain loans and make repayments. María Alicia has been selling fruit for fifteen years. She does not have an established place for selling her goods, so she travels through the market offering her products every day without resting. María Alicia tells us that the loans have helped her increase her business and will use this new loan to buy more fruits such as papaya, watermelon, honeydews, bananas, apples, mangos, and other products to increase her assortment of stock to offer her to her customers, thereby generating more business. She dreams of making home improvements.

Sra. Margarita Jiménez is another member of the Tomorrow’s Winners Communal Bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca and is participating in her fourth loan cycle. Her sister invited her to become a member of the group and the loans have enabled her business to continue.

Margarita sells vegetables and has been in this business since she was a young girl because her grandmother and mother sold vegetables in the market. She continues the family tradition by selling produce on Thursdays, Saturdays, and Sundays. She is devoted to farming during the rest of the week.

With her new loan from Fundación ESPOIR, Margarita will buy tomatoes, onions, peas, carrots, and other vegetables. Her goal is to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Asiasiga

texts.en:
Asiasiga M. is 60 and married with 7 children (ages 16 - 38).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  Asiasiga has many years of experience in this business.  Asiasiga needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 155 talas or US $65 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Asiasiga joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Asiasiga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a 49-year-old married woman with six children. She has been renting houses and running her retail shop for twelve years in the Kayole slums of Nairobi.

With the KES 80,000 loan, Teresia wants to increase the stock in her shop. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for helping her tremendously raise her income and living standard. She hopes to expand her shop and have more rental houses in the future.

Teresia describes herself as successful.

loans.use: To increase the stock of her shop

loans.name: Natasha

texts.en:
Natasha is married and has a grown son. She lives in Mukachevo. Natasha runs a small retail store called "Scarlett" that is located in downtown Mukachevo. She sells items such as purses, umbrellas, and wallets in her little store. Natasha's enterprise is popular among customers, as it has a favorable location and merchandise is offered at affordable prices. Natasha opened her retail store eight years ago. Presently, she has 35,000 UAH worth of inventory. Her gross income amounts to 15,000 UAH per month.

Natasha is seeking a loan of 7500 UAH to increase her working capital. She works hard to balance her profit and expenses. Despite the financial challenges many small entrepreneurs in Ukraine face these days, Natasha keeps pressing on, hoping for a positive outcome. At HOPE Ukraine/Nadiya, we believe that Natasha's natural determination and hard work will help her succeed in her entrepreneurial endeavors.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn, 20, is a young mother to a 1-year-old child. She married her husband, Nardjun, a year ago. 

Jeralyn is involved in rice farming and she said she learned to keep records of expenses to know if she is earning. She wants to be an active entrepreneur and she wants her farm to grow. She joined CEVI to gain access to its program. She requested a loan of PHP 6,000 that she would use for her farm. With this amount, she will be able to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Kudayberdieva Nurbu`s Group

texts.ru:
Нурбу 52 года, она замужем уже более 30 лет. У нее есть 7 детей. Самому старшему 33, а самому младшему 21. Ее муж занимается строительными работами. Она занимается откормом и разведением домашнего скота. В бизнесе ей помогает супруг. Кредит запрашивается для вспахивания земельного участка, закупка удобрений и 5 баранов. 

Хуруниса, 48, вдова. Она воспитывает 6 детей. Клиент вместе с детьми занимается сельским хозяйством, а именно выращиванием риса, пшена. Земельный надел расположен около ее дома. Кредит запрашивается для покупки и перепродажи скота. 

Гулжан 48 лет. Она замужем и мать 8 детей. Ее супруг работает строителем. Клиент занимается полеводством: выращиваниет риса, пшена и картофель.  Кредит запрашивается для покупки 100 кг семян картофеля, 200 кг удобрений и на посев. 

Зулайхо, 39, замужем. Супруг занимается частным  извозом по маршруту Узген-Ош. Она занимается выращиванием табака и риса. Этим бизнесом она занимается с 1990 года, с момента развала СССР. Кредит запрашивается для строительства парника, где она собирается выращивать перец, помидоры и лук. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Nurbu is 52 years old. She has been married for over 30 years and has 7 children. The oldest is 33, and the youngest is 21 years old. Nurbu’s husband does construction work. Nurbu is involved in livestock fattening and breeding. Her husband helps her with this business. She is requesting the loan for plowing their plot of land, purchase of fertilizers and purchase of 5 sheep. Hurunisa is 48 years old and a widow. She is raising 6 children. The client and her children are involved in agriculture, specifically growing rice and grains. Her land plot is located near her house. Hurunisa is requesting the loan for the purchase and resale of livestock. Guljan is 48 years old. She is married and a mother of 8 children. Her husband works as a construction worker. The client is involved in farming. She grows rice, grains and potatoes. Guljan is requesting the loan for the purchase of 100 kg of potato seeds, 200 kg of fertilizers and for sowing. Zulayho is 39 years old and married. Her husband provides transportation services on the Uzgen-Osh route. She is involved in growing tobacco and rice. Zulayho has been in this business since 1990, from the moment the USSR broke apart. The loan will be used for building a greenhouse, where she will grow peppers, tomatoes and onions.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plowing land, purchase of fertilizers and purchase of 5 sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and tools.

loans.name: Put Together Group

texts.en:
Put Together is a group of five borrowers, headed by Ruth D.. She is 52 years old and did not go to school due to lack of financial support. She is widowed and has four children whose ages range from 30 to 20 years old. Some of her children are high school graduates and the rest are in high school. She also helps to care for two siblings.

Mary sells dried fish and palm oil. She buys in bulk and sells at retail, and she has been doing this business for 19 years. She started her business with the help of her late husband. Her challenge is limited business capital to get more fish and oil for resale. Her business is located on 12th Street in Sinkor. 

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Ruth is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/team/team_leap_liberia

loans.use: To get more fish and oil for resale

loans.name: Albina

texts.es: Albina tiene 39 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Rolando de 40 años, juntos tiene 3 hijos, pero solo viven con los dos menores, mientras que el mayor estudia en la ciudad y es independiente. Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la agricultura, siembra flores de gladiolos, así como lechugas y alverjas, junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Pese a que las faenas agrícolas son muy tediosas, no le importa, ya que le gusta mucho porque sabe bien todas las técnicas para sembrar en cantidad y con calidad; pero lo que no le gusta, es que muchas veces la siembra se hecha a perder por las plagas, pero con la practica se aprende como sembrar cada vez mejor. Dice que cuando es tiempo de cosecha se trabaja mas duro para recoger toda la producción, pero como es una labor conjunta con los miembros de su familia se hace en menos tiempo. Como Albina es una dama muy emprendedora que siempre ha trabajado para salir adelante, para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, pues quiere aumentar sus ganancias. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, asimismo se siente satisfecha con el trabajo de su grupo, pues esta compuesto por mujeres trabajadoras como ella, que buscan salir adelante a base de mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Albina tiene pensado invertir el crédito que solicita en la compra de abono, así como semillas de flores de gladiolos, que necesita para la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Albina is 39 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Rolando, age 40, and two of their three children. Her oldest child studies in the city and lives independently. She is a hardworking woman who engages in farming to earn a living. Albina plants gladiolas, lettuce, and peas with her husband and children. Even though the farm work can be tedious, she enjoys it tremendously because she knows all the techniques needed to grow in quantity and with high quality. What she does not like is dealing with pests that can spoil her crops, but with practice she has learned to improve her plantings each season. Albina says she works harder during harvest time to gather everything she produces, but with the efforts of her family members, she is able to complete the work in less time. Being an enterprising woman who always works to get ahead, Albina has plans for the future to increase her production so that she can generate more revenue.

This is her second loan with MFP. Albina is happy with the work of her Communal Bank, which consists of hardworking women like her who want to get ahead. She plans to invest the loan she requested in the purchase of compost and gladiola seeds for her next crop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & gladiola seeds

loans.name: Juana Salvadora

texts.es:
Juana Salvadora G. Cisnero tiene 48 años, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos,  uno mayor de edad.  La señora G. tiene 8 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de manualidades (arreglos florales para quinceaños, fiestas, misas entre otros) en la localidad de La Paz Centro y sus alrededores, se abastece de los productos en Managua y León.

Doña G. Vive en el casco urbano de la ciudad de La Paz Centro y cuenta con los servicios básicos: energía, agua, alcantarilla, y teléfono.   El dinero que se le otorgado  de los créditos se han invertido en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana is a 48 year old single mother of two children who are both grown. For the past eight years Mrs. Juana has been doing handicrafts (flower arrangements for fifteenth birthday parties, other parties, and masses among other events) in the center and outskirts of La Paz. She gets her supplies from Managua and Leon. Mrs. Juana lives in the urban center of the city of La Paz. She has basic services such as water, electricity, sewer and telephone. The money that she will obtain from the loan she will use to invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest in her business.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella A. is from the village of Rang-Ayan. She is 53 years old, married and has 11 children. Estrella owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Estrella has been involved in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Estrella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Estrella from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Romy

texts.en: Romy M. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 38 years old. Romy is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Romy operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing trisikad (pedicab) services to local community members. Romy has been engaged in his business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Romy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken out by Romy from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Livesock

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es: Alba tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, por lo que siempre está pensando en la forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Alba se dedica a una librería y brindar el servicio de costura, hace mas de 33 años que tiene este negocio y el mantenerlo ha sido muy difícil, pero con la ayuda de los financiamientos ha logrado seguir. Sus 4 hijos trabajan de manera independiente y le ayudan en la atención con sus clientes, por lo que también se mantienen pendiente de ayudarla en lo que ella necesita. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de cuadernos, lápices, borradores, hoja de block y en la compra de tela para la elaboración de sus prendas de vestir. Sueña con ampliar su actividad y seguir innovando con otros negocios.
texts.en:
Alba has collaborated with the Fundación for a long time. She is always looking for ways to generate family income. Alba has a stationery shop and she’s also a seamstress. She has been in this line of work for over 33 years. Keeping the business afloat has been very difficult but with the financial help she’s managed to persevere. Her four children work independently but help her take care of customers and are always watchful in order to help her out in any way they can. The requested funds will be used to buy stock items like: notebooks, pencils, erasers, paper. She will also use it to buy fabric to make clothes. She dreams with enlarging her activity and continue innovating with other types of business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her stationery shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials such as zinc, iron, stone, cinderblocks, sand, and skilled labor.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong S., 29, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. S. is a housewife while her husband is employed at a local construction company, earning an income of USD 7 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 22 years old and single. He has been operating a cafeteria with one employee for three years. He also provides motorbike transport for extra income. He is a member of a group in Faulu Kenya and he saves his money with the group on a weekly basis.  He says that he is doing well and he hopes to expand his business in the future. He sees himself owning more cafeterias in five years. He has requested 20,000 KES to build another cafeteria.

loans.use: To build a cafeteria

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea M., 25, is married and lives with her husband and a child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products. M. is employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of USD 2.50 per day. Every month the family has to spend USD 44 on food and USD 10 on electricity supply.

M.’s husband produces metal axes, earning an income of about USD 4 per day. M. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more metal to improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

This is M.’s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. M.'s husband appear in the photograph because M. is not available.

loans.use: To enable her husband to buy more metal to produce more axes

loans.name: Nasario

texts.es: El señor  Nasario tiene 28 años de edad es soltero vive solo en Colomi Comunidad Mosoj Rancho hacia el norte.                                                                                                                                    Del señor Nasario su actividad principal es la producción agrícola, aparte tiene 6 cabezas de ganado vacuno que los utiliza en las faenas agrícolas, pero el necesita un préstamo para comprar más ganado vacuno lechero y terneros  razón se apersono a nuestra oficina para solicitar un crédito, finalmente el señor Nasario Díaz C. nos cuenta que su sueño es mejorar su actividad pecuaria y tener mejores condiciones de vida a futuro.
texts.en:
Nasario is 28 years old and single. He lives along in Colomi, in the Mosoj Rancho community toward the north. 

Nasario's main work is agricultural production. He also has 6 head of cattle, which he uses in his agricultural work. However, he needs a loan to buy more milk cows and calves. For this reason, he appeared at the office to request a loan. Finally, Nasario Díaz C. reports that his dream is to improve his ranching business and have better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily T.'s main source of income comes from providing jeepney (a multi-purpose vehicle) services to local community members. She is 42 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Amoyong, Wao, Lanao del Sur. Emily has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Emily joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Emily has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase tools needed to provide her service. Emily is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of her jeepney. This will be her fifth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed for the maintenance of her jeepney

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance N.  lives in Naguru, a neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has  3 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (three of her sister's children).  

Constance has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  

Constance sells her products at the market by means of wholesale/retail.  Constance has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  She also generates additional income through a small retail shop.

The main business challenge for  Constance is the rainy season which makes village roads impassable.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only. 

Constance lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en: Marie Chantal is 34 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school. Her husband works as taxi driver. Marie Chantal sells women's clothes and she has been in this business for five years. She has requested this loan to buy more women's clothes to sell.  She says that with the profit from this business, she will buy a motorbike for transportation, which will help her earn more. Marie Chantal praises her business as it has made a great contribution to her life, allowing her to build a house.  In the future, Marie Chantal would like to ask for a larger loan amount.

loans.use: To buy more women's clothes to sell

loans.name: Mhamad

texts.ar:
محمد في عمر 40 سنة يعمل في بيع الخضار والاعشاب محمد متزوج وله اربع اولاد يحب اولاده ويتمنى لهم العيش الكريم يحب الحياة 
كثيرا ويحب عمله وله  فيه اكثر من 20 سنة يحب ان يرقى بعمله الى مستوى متقدم لكي يدعم نفسه وعائلته له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث كان يتلقى دعم كامل
من عائلته وقد ساعده القرض القديم بتحسين مستوى عمله يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء ماكنة للزيتون بسبب  الموسم وشراء الزيت
يحب التجارة ويحب ان يكون متنوع بها طموح يسعى جادها الى تحسين وضعه المادي والاجتماعي والتربوي لأولاده
texts.en: Mhamad, 40, is married with 4 children. He works in selling vegetables and herbs. Mhamad loves his children and wishes to secure them a decent life. Mhamad loves his life very much. With 20 years experience, Mhamad has developed a passion for his work. He wishes to develop his business to support himself and his family. Mhamad has a good credit history with A. Majmoua as he receives full support from his family. The previous loan he got from A. Majmoua helped him improve his work. He wants to get a new loan to buy a machine for extracting olive oil during the harvest season and to buy oil. He likes his trade and he wants to diversify his business. Mhamad is ambitious and he is keen to improve his financiA. conditions as well as his children's sociA. and pedagogicA. life.

loans.use: To buy an olive oil and an oil extraction machine

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.en:
Jose is 40 years old.  He lives in the district of Tambogrande in northern Peru.  It is a semi-tropical zone which is primarily populated by small farmers, many of which own small fruit plantations or raise animals.  Jose maintains a stable home along with his wife.  They have one young daughter.

Jose has a hectare of agricultural land near his home on which he has a crop of rice maturing.  He plants different crops on the land depending on the season.  In addition to agriculture, he and his wife raise animals in corrals behind their home.  They raise sheep and goats.  Their herd currently consists of 20 sheep and 12 goats.  They sell the animals in local markets when they reach the appropriate size.

The loan will be used to support the family’s income-earning activities.  They hope the investment will help them to expand their businesses and improve their income so that they can provide a better future for their child.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Guido Ismael

texts.es: El Joven Guido es soltero  se dedica a la confección,  y heredo el negocio de la confección de la abuela  y la mamá, el tiene buen manejo de costura realiza confección de edredones, almohadas y cojines vive en la casa de sus padres, su taller es pequeño, durante el día trabaja en una empresa de textiles como asistente administrativo, espera a un futura poder consolidad una empresa amplia y propia ya que conoce el manejo de este tipo de actividad. Esta muy contento por contar con el préstamo que lo utilizara en la compra de tela e hilos para la confección de edredones que le pidieron y anticipa que mas adelante solicitará para una maquina de cocer mas moderna, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Young Guido is single and his business is sewing.  He inherited his sewing business from his grandmother and his mom.  He sews well and makes comforters, pillows and cushions.  He lives in his parents' home.

Guido's workshop is small.  During the day he works in a textile company as an administrative assistant.  He hopes in the future that he will be able to set up a big company of his own since he knows how to run this kind of business.  He is very happy to be receiving this loan which he will use to buy fabric and threads for making comforters that people have asked him for.  He anticipates requesting a new loan in the future to buy a more modern sewing machine.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loans.use: To buy material, fabric and threads

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
La señora Pastora V. E.  trabaja como Conserje en un Recinto Universitario, desde hace 12 años

Es soltera de 53 años de edad, no tiene  persona que dependa de ella, vive en la ciudad de Managua en el municipio de Managua desde hace 13 años.

Este es el crédito número 8 con CEPRODEL los que ha utilizado en su mayoría para cubrir gastos médicos de sus familiares y otros para su vivienda. Este en particular lo solicita para remodelar su casa ya que hay partes que necesitan cambio.
texts.en:
Pastora V. E. has been working as a janitor at a university campus for 12 years. 

She is single, 53 years old and does not have any dependents. She has been living in the city of Managua in the municipality of Managua for 13 years. 

This is her 8th loan with field partner CEPRODEL. She used the majority of the previous loans to cover medical expenses for family members and also for her home. She is requesting this loan to remodel her home because parts of it need change.

loans.use: Remodel her home.

loans.name: Jesus Esta Aqui 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Mireya pertenece al grupo Jesús esta aqui 1 & 2, un grupo formado por 10 miembro, cada uno D. ellos días a días realizan sus actividades D. negocios en la ciudad D. Santo Domingo, su comunidad se encuentra al norte D. la ciudad y es una D. las zonas mas empobrecidas. Se dedican mayormente a la venta D. Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosméticos, alimentos, entre otros productos misceláneos.  

Mireya posee una familia conformada por sus 3 hijos) y su esposo. A quienes le ha dedicado todo su vida para apoyarles y ayudarles a crecer, se siente muy útil al poder llevar ingresos extra a su familia, y lucha día a día para tener un techo propio y vivir estables. 

Mireya posee un ventorrillo, en donD. venD. diferentes vegetales, frutas, carbón, carnes, es un pequeño mostrador D. alimentos. Inicio gracias a su primer préstamo en Esperanza, hace alrededor D. 3 años y en la actualidad esta esperando recibir su 5to. préstamo con Esperanza Internacional, el cual invertirá en la compra D. vegetales como zanahoria, repollo, tomates, papas; también en diferentes frutas y carnes D. pollo y res

Su historia representa a los demás miembros D. su grupo y a los clientes D. Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia la República Dominicana desD. Haití, algunos D. ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas D. escasos recursos en la República Dominicana, carecen D. agua potable y energía eléctrica constante.
texts.en:
Mireya belongs to the “Jesús Está Aquí” (Jesus Is Here) 1 & 2 group.  The group is comprised of ten members.  Each one of them works day to day at their business activities in the city of Santo Domingo.  Her community is north of the city, and it is one of the poorest zones.  They mostly work at selling clothes, footwear, accessories, cosmetics, and food, among other miscellaneous products.

Mireya’s family is comprised of her three children and her husband.  She has devoted her whole life to support them and help them grow.  She feels very useful to be able to bring extra income to her family.  She struggles day to day to have a roof over her family’s head and to have a stable life.

Mireya has a small business selling different vegetables, fruit, charcoal, and meat.  It is a small food stand.  She started thanks to her first loan from Esperanza about three years ago.  She is currently waiting to receive her fifth loan with Esperanza Internacional.  She will use it to buy vegetables like carrots, cabbage, tomatoes, and potatoes.  She will also buy fruit, chicken, and beef.

Her story represents the other members of her group.  Her story also represents Esperanza’s other clients, the Haitians (most of whom have immigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them recently) as much as the Dominicans. They generally live in very poor communities. This zone, like a lot of other zones with scarce resources in the Dominican Republic, lacks potable water and reliable electricity.

loans.use: To buy foods like fruit and vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Reyna Ester

texts.es:
La Sra. Reyna L. tiene 45 años de edad y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de donas y relámpagos.
su negocio se a convertido en una micro empresa en donde paga dos empleados uno de sexo femenino que le ayuda a la elaboración del producto y uno de sexo masculino quien es el encargado de distribuir el producto.
Su especialidad es fabricar Donas con cerezas, la Donas con Azúcar de diferentes tamaños y los Relámpagos.
toda la reposteria que elabora es de un sabor exquisito.
Doña Reyna ya tiene clientes con contrato permanente y todo el producto que elabora solo lo entrega, sus  clientes son dueñas de casetas en algunos centros de estudio de la ciudad de Danli.
Doña Reina es madre soltera con tres hijos de los cuales ya solo una depende de ella, le cubre todos los gastos y actualmente esta cursando sus estudios primarios.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de las donas.
texts.en:
Reyna L. is 45 years old and works making and selling donuts and eclairs.  Her business has become a small company and she pays two employees: a woman who helps make the products and a man who is in charge of distributing them.

Reyna's speciality is making cherry donuts, different sized sugar donuts and eclairs.  All the confectionery she makes is absolutely delicious.

Reyna has customers with whom she has a permanent contract and she delivers all her products.  Her customers are women who own food stands in educational centers in the city of Danli.

Reyna is a single mother who has three children, only one of whom (a daughter) is still dependent.  Her daughter is currently in elementary school and she covers all her expenses.

Reyna will use her loan money to buy materials for making her donuts.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, sugar, oil, eggs, baking soda and yeast

loans.name: Cilla

texts.en: Cilla is 26 years old, married, and has 3 children,1 of whom goes to school. Her husband is a security guard.  She is currently in the business of selling bicycles, and has requested a loan to stock more bicycles to sell. She hopes to open a big shop with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more bicycles to sell

loans.name: Marcela De Jesus

texts.es:
Marcela, tiene 44 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 4 hijos, es originaria de Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí pero  actualmente vive en la ciudad, se dedica a vender cosméticos negocio en el cual lleva 5años.
Comenzó a trabajar a los 29 años de edad, vendiendo mercadería ambulante en la calle de los pueblos aledaños de Estelí donde viajaba en bus esto lo hacia los sábados porque los días de semana trabaja como maestra de primaria. Actualmente solamente vende cosméticos por la tarde, tres veces a la semana y por la mañana labora como maestra. En este negocio le ayudan sus hijos menores a vender, le gustaría poder vender sus productos a los almacenes y salones de belleza de Estelí.
El crédito lo solicita para comprar cosméticos de diferente variedad y marcas, pues espera poder atraer más clientes, convertirse en una distribuidora mayorista.
Dentro de sus planes futuros esta incrementar su negocio con diferentes productos, generar empleos para otras personas.
Como meta próxima esta el poder terminar de preparar profesionalmente a su que esta estudiando l segundo año de contaduría publica así mismo el resto de sus hijos, mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar.
texts.en:
Marcela is 44 years old, married, and has 4 children.  She is originally from Pueblo Nuevo, in the municipality of Estelí, but currently lives in the city.  She has been selling cosmetics for 5 years.

Marcela started working at the age of 29, selling merchandise as an itinerant street trader in the villages around Estelí.  She traveled to the villages by bus.  She did this on Saturdays because during the week she worked as an elementary school teacher.  She currently sells her cosmetics in the afternoons, three times a week, and works as a teacher in the mornings.  Her two youngest children help her in her business, selling merchandise.  She would like to be able to sell her products to stores and beauty salons in Estelí.

Marcela is requesting this loan to buy different types and brands of cosmetics.  She hopes to be able to attract more customers and become a wholesale distributor.

One of Marcela's future plans is to increase her business by adding different products and to generate jobs for other people.  Her short-term goals are to help one of her children complete his professional development as he is currently in his second year of a public accounting course, to help the rest of her children, and to improve the infrastructure of her home.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Sorbeh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sorbeh” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone.  They have requested a loan of SLL 800,000 for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

The leader of this group is 48 year-old Fatu K..  She was born in Makeni, where she is currently residing with her husband and one child.  Her husband is a driver, and her child is no longer attending school.  For 16 years now,  Fatu has been selling dishes, rubber bowls, spoons, cups, etc.  With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buys dishes, rubber bowls, spoons, cups, etc., in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
Gulnara K., 48, is the leader of this group. She lives in the town of Kochkorka with her husband and their nine-year-old son, their only financial dependent. In 1994 Gulnara received a piece of land after the collapse of Soviet Union and the Act of Privatization. Having been a farmer for her entire lifetime, Gulnara  decided without any hesitation to continue farming after the country gained independence. She stayed faithful to cultivating the land and cattle breeding. 

Fall is the noblest season for a farmer. In one such fall, she organized a wedding ceremony for their oldest son. In future she hopes to continue improving the state of her business and hopes the loan from Kiva lenders will help her to meet the family needs. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to meet family needs.

loans.name: Gavino

texts.en:
Gavino T. is from Santa Cruz in Tangub City. He is 44 years old. Gavino is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, he owns and operates a pedicab transport service. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Gavino joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This will be his first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for making 'chicha' and to buy animals to raise

loans.name: Haby

texts.fr:
Haby a plus de 53 ans mariée et mère de 7 enfants (5 garçons et 2 filles). Elle réside avec son époux, ses deux coépouses et leurs enfants à Hamdallaye, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Haby après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès notamment l’agriculture au village, s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente des calebasses et divers depuis plus de dix ans. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ sept ans. Après 6 prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une Association des femmes de son quartier (Association BENKADI de Hamdallaye), elle est à présent à son quatrième prêt individuel. Tous  les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle sollicite ce  nouveau prêt pour acheter, 15 colis de calebasses à Tona région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative du Mali) avant de les revendre  en détail au grand marché de Sikasso près de la mairie centrale de la localité à une clientèle composée généralement des femmes et surtout de miniers.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt
texts.en:
Haby is over 53 years old, married, and the mother of seven children (five boys and two girls). She resides with her husband, her two co-wives, and their children in Hamdallaye, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run many businesses without success, especially in agriculture in the village, she got started in the business of buying and selling calabash containers and various other goods over ten years ago.

Concerned about further satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about seven year ago. After six solidarity loans (group loans) in a women's association in her district (Association BENKADI de Hamdallaye), she is now on her fourth individual loan. The previous loans have all been properly repaid. 

Haby is requesting this new loan to buy 15 packets of calabashes in the Tona region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali) and then will sell them retail at the main market of Sikasso, near the central town hall. Her customer base is generally comprised of women and especially miners. 

With this loan, Haby envisions making a monthly profit of 200,000 francs CFA that will essentially be used for increasing her working capital, to help cover family expenses, and to pay the interest on the loan.

loans.use: to buy packets of calabash containers

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, age 46, sells second-hand clothes at the Baray market. From that she is able to earn $2 a day to support her family. 

She doesn’t have a life partner as her husband passed away of illness when her children were very small. Now her children are grown and can support the family by working in a variety of jobs. 

Recently Hong sold nearly all her inventory to her buyers and she wants to replenish her stock but she lacks capital. She is therefore asking for a loan in order to buy more used clothes to resell.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité se formo a iniciativa de la Sra Evangelista domiciliada en la Ciudad de Carapeguá. el comité fue denominado “MARIA AUXILIADORA” y actualmente se encuentra en el primer ciclo con 12 integrantes. Es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, ellas se dedican a la producción de alimentos para su posterior venta.
Cada miembro tiene una actividad especifica dentro de la producción de los alimentos. Todas ellas trabajan de forma responsable y solidaria, donde la ayuda entre ellas es lo más loable. Cada una trabaja para procurarse una vida digna, no solo para ellas sino también para su familia.
La Sra. Regina trabaja en la producción de alimentos hace ya varios años, y todas ellas ya tienen una clientela formada. Solicitan el credito para la compra de los insumos necesarios para que produzcan los alimentos, como ser las carnes, pollo, huevos y demás. Todas ellas están con las esperanzas puestas en el crédito.
texts.en: This group was formed thanks to the work of Evangelista, who lives in the city of Carapeguá, Paraguay. The group is called "Maria Auxiliadora", has 12 members and is in its first loan cycle. This group consists of very responsible and hard-working women who make a living producing food to later sell. Every member has a specific job related to food production. The women work together responsibly and with solidarity, and they consider helping each other out to be very commendable. Each one works for a dignified life, not only for themselves but also for their families. One of the members is Regina, who has made food to sell for a number of years and already has a solid customer base. The women are requesting the loan to purchase the necessary ingredients to make their meals, such as meat, chicken, eggs and other items. All of them have their hopes resting on the loan.

loans.use: to purchase necessary ingredients, such as meat, chicken, eggs and others, to make meals to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Hoda

texts.en:
Hoda, 54, is a widow and has struggled since her husband's death to make a living. She is a kind woman, loved by most of her relatives, neighbors and friends. For work, she prepares "Malban", a classic dessert which traces back to the Middle East and consists of gelatin, sugar, starch and honey. Cooked then cooled, they are made into cubes or any other shape, covered with sugar and mixed with many kinds of nuts.

Hoda is a hard worker. In addition to her famous homemade sweets, Hoda also sells underwear and clothes. She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua in order to prepare herself for Holy Ramadan. With this loan, Hoda will buy extra nuts to prepare requested sweets, in addition to a new clothes collection. Hoda has been an A. Majmoua borrower for eight consecutive cycles and is in good-standing with an excellent reputation. She has a smile that never leaves her face. Even if she's experiencing the worst moment, she won't let you know she's suffering. She hopes to stay capable of making her own living.

loans.use: to buy extra nuts to be prepared for requests during the Holy Ramadan months.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Perlita has a retail shop where she sells snacks, breads, beverages & noodles. She has had this business for 5 years. She hasrequested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Perlita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Perlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Run is 51 years old, and is a rice seller who earns $4 per day. She is a single mother with one child. He is working in Thailand; his income is $6 per day. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $10 on electricity, and another $5 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy rice for resale. This loan will help her to have enough money to buy rice for selling, and she hopes to have more money to buy a stock of rice to sell when there is a good price.

loans.use: To buy rice for resale.

loans.name: Colno Investments Group

texts.en:
Costa is 38 years old and comes from Masvingo. He is married and has one child, age 13, who attends school. He also cares for two dependents. 

Costa runs a leather manufacturing business and he produces belts, jackets and handbags. The business has been in operation for eight years. He says the main challenges he faces are lack of machinery and capital. 

Costa has requested a loan of $400 to buy leather. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enhance the living standard of his family.  

In the future, Costa plans to open a leather factory and employ many workers.

loans.use: To buy leather for making belts, jackets and handbags.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with four children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over 10 years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat oil and kerosene. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat oil and kerosene.

loans.name: Ayesha's Group

texts.en:
Ayesha is married and has two children. Both of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. She supports her family by sewing clothes for neighboring clients. She is known among her clients for her good skills and receives regular orders every month. 

She has applied for a loan from a Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her sewing business. She is confident that, by purchasing a new sewing machine, she will be able to complete her orders on time and increase her profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Ayesha.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra needs another loan in preparation for the Christmas season, when demand is high. She used her previous loan to buy clothing, and with the profits earned she has been able to educate her children. Sandra needs this loan to purchase more clothing to sell.

She faces the challenge of the rainy season when customers don't turn up, so her desire is to operate from enclosed premises.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mairam

texts.fr: Madame Mairam  est une dame de 51 ans  qui vit dans l’une des localités du territoire Sénégalais. Elle est mariée et s’active depuis 10 ans dans le commerce et  la vente de fruits de mer, d’huile de palme, de balaies et de poisons séchés. Elle a choisi cette activité par opportunité en collaboration avec une amie basée dans une région du pays qui lui envoie les produits. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mai 2003 ou elle a déjà remboursé 4 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits qu’elle commercialise. Son but est de renforcer son stock de produits afin de mieux rentabiliser son activité de commerce.
texts.en: Mairam is a 51-year-old lady who lives in a town in Senegal.  She is married and has been working in commerce for 10 years.  She sells seafood, palm oil, brooms and smoked fish.  She chose this business because she had the opportunity to work in cooperation with a friend based in another region of the country who sends her products.  Mairam has been a member of one of U-IMCEC's offices since May 2003 and she has already repaid four previous loans.  She is requesting this loan for 100,000 francs to buy products to sell.  Her goal is to strengthen her stock of products in order to make better profits from her retail business.

loans.use: to buy products to re-sell

loans.name: Clara Valentina

texts.es: Clara Valentina D. 55 años D. edad, habita en casa propia junto con su hijo el cual ya es mayor D. edad. Clara posee un salón D. belleza que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener. Tiene muchos años D. dedicarse al negocio y con la ayuda D. Dios todo poderoso ha sabido estar siempre adelante D. la competencia. Clara se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y dedicada a su trabajo, además es muy amable a la hora D. prestar su servicio. Para ella lo más importante son los clientes ya que sabe que D. ellos depenD. el bienestar D. su negocio por lo que trata D. dar el mejor servicio posible. Últimamente ha estado pensando mucho cómo hacer para seguir mejorando su servicio D. tal manera que los clientes siempre estén motivados a solicitar sus servicios. Todo esto la ha hecho reflexionar y tomar la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar productos D. belleza (maquillaje, champo, cremas, lociones, etc.)  y las herramientas necesarias ( peines, planchas, tijeras, secadora, etc.), para poder dar un buen servicio a los clientes D. tal manera que el negocio florezca y siga dando los frutos necesarios para aspirar a una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Clara Valentina is 55 years old and lives in her own home together with her adult son.  Clara owns a beauty salon that she has managed to keep running with a lot of effort.  She has been in this business for many years and, with the help of almighty God, she has always known how to keep ahead of the competition.  Clara is noted as being a hard-working, responsible woman who is committed to her work.  She is also very kind when she provides her services.  Clara's customers are the most important thing to her as she knows that the well-being of her business depends on them.  For this reason, she tries to proviD. the best possible service.  Lately, Clara has been thinking a lot about how to continue improving her business so that her customers are always keen to request her services.  This has maD. her sit back and think and deciD. to take out this loan from INTEGRAL so that she can buy beauty products (make up, shampoo, creams, lotions, etc.) and the tools she needs (combs, hair straighteners, scissors, hair dryer, etc.) so that she can proviD. her customers with a good service and so that her business will thrive and continue providing the rewards she needs so that she can aspire to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy make up, shampoo, creams, lotions, combs, hair straighteners, scissors, hair dryer, etc.

loans.name: Duo Sembrando Con Amor Group

texts.es:
DUO SEMBRANDO CON AMOR
ROGELIA:la lider del grupo, Es una persona trabajadora que apoya a su esposo con un negocio, y que los a ayudado a salir adelante, se dedican a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras un producto que lo compran en los pueblos cercanos y lo traen a vender en la capital, también parte de su tiempo lo dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos hecho a mano, bajo su responsabilidad están sus hijos que necesitan el apoyo de sus padres para ir a la escuela, por eso  ella necesita un capital para ampliar mas su negocio y para comprar frutas y verduras,como aguacates tomates,y granadias,etc  y así poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Rogelia is the leader of the group Duo Sembrando Con Amor. She is hard-working and supports her husband with their business, which has helped them to get ahead. They buy and sell fruit and vegetables for a living, which they purchase in the nearby villages and take to sell in the capital. Some of their time is also dedicated to making typical hand made fabrics. 

They are responsible for their children, who need their parents' support to go to school. This means that Rogelia needs some capital to further expand her business and to buy fruit and vegetables such as avocados, tomatoes and pomegranate. In this way, they can help their family to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia, de 42 años esposa de Mauro de 38 años; viven en su casa propia junto a sus 06 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindarles mejor calidad de vida. Antonia, es una mujer de arduo trabajo que desde muy temprano se levanta para poder dirigirse a su chacra donde cultiva cacao y café. Con la ayuda de su esposo logran tener cosechas muy buenas ya que se dedican constantemente. El trabajo a la que se dedica lleva 20 años realizándola, ya que le parece rentable por los buenos productos que producen sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es estar en constante cuidado de sus sembrios y considera que lo más difícil es el tiempo de lluvia que a veces no puede ir pero sabe que la lluvia ayuda bastante a sus productos. Con el dinero solicitado hará la compra de productos para hacer el mantenimiento respectivo de sus cultivos como fertilizantes, abono, entre otros. Este crédito es el número 09 con MFP, se compromete en seguir pagando sus cuotas. Con el crédito solicitado de 2,000 nuevos soles podrá comprar fertilizantes, abono, para dar mantenimiento respectivo de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Antonia is 42 years old and has been married to Mauro for 38 years. They live in their own home with their six little children to whom they want to provide a better quality of life.

Antonia is a hard-working woman who gets up very early to go to her farm where she grows cocoa and coffee. With the help of her husband she manages to have good crops due to their incessant attention. She spent 20 years dedicating herself to this activity, ​​as it seemed to be profitable given the good quality of their products.

What she likes most about her job is the constant care she brings to her crops. She also believes that the hardest part is the rainy season which sometimes prevents her to go tend to her crops, although she knows that rain is very beneficial.

With the money requested she will buy products to maintain her different crops, such as fertilizer and manure, among others. This credit loan is the ninth granted by MFP, to which they commit to continue paying their dues.

The requested loan of 2,000 nuevos soles will enable her to buy fertilizer and manure to maintain their crops.

loans.use: Buy bags of fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is 28 years old and is married with two children aged between 3 and 6 years old.  Valentine sells various goods such as: cooking oil, biscuits, eggs, sugar etc. Her business is well known and well organized and has six years of experience in this business. She currently employs one person to help her and she works from 6am to 7pm per week. 

Valentine has requested the loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase various goods such as: cooking oil, biscuits, eggs, sugar etc. to sell. With any profits, Valentine will be able to save money for her future, reinvest in her business and she will be able to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as: cooking oil, biscuits, eggs, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
Sor is 35 years old, married, and has three children who attend primary school. She started growing vegetables and maize 10 years ago to make a living. She supplements her income by working as a worker. She now earns less than $4 per day. 

Leading a group of two female members, Sor and her group members have been with VisionFund for three years. The previous loans have helped her to have sufficient food and decent clothing for her family. Now she is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy vegetable seeds for planting. This loan will enable her to increase her income to feed her family better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds for planting.

loans.name: Edwin Ferney

texts.es: El señor Edwin tiene una tienda desde hace tres años donde vende productos de la canasta familiar, snacks y cerveza, con la cual ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y le brinda el sustento para su hogar. La jornada de trabajo del señor Edwin es de todos los días desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 10:00 p.m. Debido a dificultades económicas no ha podido surtir su negocio y lo cual le ha generado perdida de clientes, por lo cual el señor Edwin necesita de capital para surtir de nuevo su negocio con productos de la canasta familiar y cerveza que pueda ofrecer a sus clientes y así recuperar la rentabilidad de su negocio, seguir apoyando a su familia, cumplir su sueño de entrar a estudiar a la universidad y aplicar sus conocimientos en la tienda.
texts.en: Edwin has been running a general store for three years, and he sells basic products, snacks and beer. Thanks to this activity he has been able to provide for and support his family. Edwin works every day form 7 am to 10 pm. Owing to economic problems he has not succeeded in stocking up his store, consequently losing some customers. For this reason Edwin needs working capital to stock up his store once again with basic products and beer to sell to his customers, thus consequently restoring the profitability of his shop, keeping on supporting his family and fulfilling his dream of attending university and employing his knowledge in his activity.

loans.use: To buy basic products and beer to stock up his store.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is taking another Kiva loan of KES 100,000 to establish another business of selling poultry, build a poultry house, and purchase chicks and chicken feed. She dreams of expanding and keeping 3,000 chickens in the future.

loans.use: to establish another business of selling poultry, build a poultry house, and purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en: Rin,54, is a resident from Battambang province. She married and got two children. She deals with her daily cost of living via rice farming and her paid-working job. She can earn about 43,100 KHR per day from both. This is not first time that Rin with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) ; she has fully repaid back her past loan wisely and her living condition is improved gradually.  She leads a group of two to get a new loan and she is the leader. For Rin, she will spend her entire loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. She really hopes that this loan can make her business better and can increase her income to support family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe is 48 years old and married with four children, all of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She has run a medicine shop in the South Sudan for the past 6 years. Phoebe has requested a SSP 4,500 loan through WOYE MFI to purchase additional medicine items.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her shop

loans.name: Kpedetin Vi Group

texts.fr: KPEDETIN VI est un groupement composé de douze personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C’est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Awahou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 34 ans. Awahou est mariée à un certain Sobiou. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Awahou et son mari. Pour cette raison, Awahou vend de la nourriture à son domicile depuis six ans ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Awahou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Awahou sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe KPEDETIN VI, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du riz, du soja et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Romero Estela

texts.es: Estela tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y tiene 7 hijos de los mismos que 3 aun viven con ella, Estela se dedica a la crianza de animales, el crédito lo solicita para comprar una vaca lechera misma que piensa que por medio de la venta de la leche lograra mejorar sus ingresos, la aspiración más grande de esta señora que es muy trabajadora es poder mejorar su negocio para cambiar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Estela is 54 years old, married, and has seven children, three of whom still live with her. She works raising animals.

Estela is requesting this loan to buy a dairy cow, because she believes selling its milk will allow her to improve her income. This hardworking woman's greatest aspiration is to improve her business in order to change her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en: Uzma is a 34 year old married woman and has been running a school since 7 years.  She desires to provide good quality education for her community children and determined to be successful.  She struggling since 7 years and currently she has 76% female students whereas in total 178 students are enrolled. Uzma desires to expand her school by enrolling more students and through school expansion. Currently, she requested a loan of PKR 150,000 for room construction to accommodate more students.

loans.use: for room construction to accommodate more students.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria M. was born in Guayaquil, Ecuador. This 40-year-old single mother of three opened her restaurant 10 years ago. Her clients are all regulars from her neighborhood, and they all enjoy the tasty food she offers day-in and day-out. Gloria works from 6am serving breakfast to the morning crowd until 4 pm when she serves lunch. This $400 loan will allow her to accomodate her devoted clients better and expand her business.

loans.use: Gloria plans to use her $400 loan to expand her local restaurant and satisfy her regular customers by accomodating them better. She intends to buy more tables, utensils, as well as cooking items like oil, sugar, and rice...

loans.name: Hogbessi

texts.en:
Born in 1954 in Vogan, Mrs. Hogbessi S. is the mother of four (04) children and has three (03) grandsons. She still smartly manages her maize and rice business, something she has done for the past 20 years. Her husband, recently deceased, left in her charge their two youngest children, who are still in school; this makes life even more difficult fot this family already in disarray. To ease her troubles, Mrs. Hogbessi S. wants to enlarge her shop display, which comprises manufactured food products, liquor, and stocks of flour, beans, maize, and rice. Currently, the supply of maize and rice is abundant, which makes their price very low. Mrs. Hogbessi S. is asking for a loan of $600 to supply her store, to stockpile goods, and to re-sell them in times of scarcity, The success of such a business will allow Mrs. Hogbessi S. to resolve her family's many difficulties and to better ensure the education of her children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1954 à Vogan (P/Vo), Madame S. Hogbessi est mère de quatre (4) enfants et grand-mère de trois (3) petits fils. Elle reste encore dégourdie pour le commerce de maïs et de riz, activité qu’elle exerce depuis 20 ans. Son mari, décédé depuis peu a laissé à sa charge leurs deux derniers enfants encore sur les bancs ;ce qui rend plus difficile la vie de cette famille déjà aux désarrois. Pour soulager ses peines, Madame S. Hogbessi veut augmenter son étalage qui comporte des produits d’alimentation manufacturée, des liqueurs et des stocks de farine, de haricot, de maïs et de riz. Actuellement, l’offre en maïs et en riz est très abondante, ce qui fait que le coût de leur bol est très bas. Madame S. Hogbessi sollicite un crédit de $600 pour s’approvisionner, faire des stocks et les revendre en temps de pénurie. Le succès d’une telle activité permettra à Madame S. Hogbessi de résoudre ses nombreux problèmes de famille et mieux assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.

loans.use: To stockpile maize and rice

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
For eight years, Lorenza has sold food for a living, she began by selling tacos outside her home because her husband's salary was not enough to cover family expenses, but as she had many customers, with her savings she decided to open a food-stand. She is 52 years old and is the mother of 2 children. It has not been easy for Lorenza to rise above all her obstacles, but with the support of her family she has succeeded in her goals and has remained working at her food-stand.

At this time, Lorenza needs a loan for $750.00 which she plans to invest in expanding her store and to buy cooking utensils and the items necessary to fabricate her product. She is dedicated to repaying the loan within 5-10 months. You can help the development of this business, Lorenza and her family, who all sincerely appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Desde hace ocho años, Lorenza se dedica a la venta de comida, inició vendiendo tacos afuera de su casa, porque el ingreso que su esposo recibía era insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades de su familia; pero como tenía mucha clientela, con sus ahorros decidió abrir un puesto de comida, ella tiene 52 años de edad y es madre de dos hijos. No ha sido fácil para Lorenza superar todos los obstáculos, pero con la unión familiar han podido salir adelante, y permanecer por tanto tiempo en el negocio

En estos momentos Lorenza requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 750 dólares que planea invertir en la ampliación de su negocio y para la compra de utensilios de cocina y los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de sus productos, ella se compromete a regresar el crédito en un plazo de 5 a 10 meses. Tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, Lorenza y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Expansion and the purchase of cooking utensils.

loans.name: Maria Concepción

texts.es:
Maria is divorced and has four children, all of whom are married. She takes care of one of her daughter's two daughters, but she doesn't have a husband's income and what her daughter sends her couldn't cover the expenses for her granddaughters or herself. So she decided to start her own business. Prior to her current business she sold beauty products, but she met a person who told her it was more profitable to sell Stanhome and Tupperware products, and she switched to selling those and that has gone much better. Since then her business has helped her provide for herself and the granddaughters who live with her.

Maria is requesting a loan of $1,100 to satisfy the orders she has from many of her customers - so they don't get upset and take their business elsewhere -and also to stock supplies so she can offer and sell more products. She plans to repay the loan within five months. Maria is very grateful for your support in helping her move forward and take care of herself and her granddaughters.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

María esta divorciada y tiene 4 hijos, todos están casados y una de sus hijas le dejo a dos de sus hijas, por ello es que María al no tener ingresos de su esposo y lo que le mandaba su hija no cubría los gastos de las niñas ni de ella, fue que se decidió por empezar su propio negocio, antes a su negocio actual ella se dedicaba a la venta de productos de belleza, pero conoció a una persona que le dijo que mejor se dedique a la venta de productos Stanhome y Tupperware y ella cambio a la venta de los mismos y le fue mucho mejor y desde entonces tiene este negocio el cual le ayuda para mantener a sus nietas que viven con ella y a ella misma.

María solicita un préstamo por US $ 1,100 para surtir los pedidos que tiene de muchos de sus clientes y no quedarles mal y así retenerlos y también para poder tener un stock para ofrecer y tener mejores ventas, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. María te agradece mucho el apoyo que le das para poder salir adelante y mantener a sus nietas y a ella misma.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Anh
