texts.en: The family has 5 members. The father  works as a farmer who plants vegetables. His wife and two older girls work as day laborers at the green dragon plant company. Their youngest daughter is in the 4th class. They just owed $312.50 to the poor bank which they borrowed to plant 150 green dragon plants (pictured). Their average income is $12.50 per person/month. Now they want to borrow $75 to invest in planting vegetables to get more income and will pay back it over 5 months.

loans.use: To plant vegetables

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en: A married mother of three, Tatyana has sold footwear for the past seven years in the Krasnodontsev market of Uzhgorod, Ukraine. Tatyana’s character and skill in business have helped her to gain an excellent reputation among clients and other entrepreneurs throughout Uzhgorod. A committed wife and mother, Tatyana works tirelessly to improve the quality of life for her family. Her eye to market trends and customer needs have helped her maintain consistent growth in business. In fact, the growth and success of her business have caused both her husband and son to join in her efforts. Currently, Tatyana is seeking a loan of $700 to purchase additional inventory. With the increased profits, Tatyana plans to continue expanding her business and providing a stable income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Yum

texts.en:
Mrs.Yum K. married in 1992 and has two sons. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor in 1987 and began a business weaving silk in the same year. Her husband, Mr. Von Theara, is a construction contractor. Both of them did not finish high school. They are sending their two children to study at the high school in the local community.

Mrs. Yum K. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of US$ 600. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom and buying construction materials. Yum hopes that this loan will enable her family to prosper and secure a better future for them all.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom as well as buying construction materials

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence M. wants to increase the capital in her charcoal business in order to increase inventory. She also wants to buy iron sheets to complete her house in her village. She looks after 5 children.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase her charcoal business

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Ms. Nicolasa lives in her own house in Los Pinos street Nº 509 in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. She is 59 years old and lives with her husband and son. She is a domestic employee, her husband works as bricklayer. The loan will be use to pay the cost to join a transportation company called “Linea Trufi” for his son. This way, he will be able to work as a driver of one of the taxis that are part of the “Linea trufi”. Her record qualifies her as a good client and can gain access to a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nicolasa vive en casa propia la calle Los Pinos Nº 509 de la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene 59 años y vive con su esposo e hijo, la actividad que realiza es la de empleada domestica en un domicilio particular, su esposo trabaja como albañil. El crédito que solicita es para pagar el costo de ingreso a una línea de trufi para su hijo, quien de esta manera podrá trabajar como chofer de uno de los taxis que forman parte de la línea de trufi. El antecedente histórico la califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Pago de cuota de ingreso a una linea de trufi para que su hijo trabaje como chofer

loans.name: Elita Yanet's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth and Yanet have been members of the “Tulipanes” community bank for one and two years, respectively. In that time, they have learned how to manage money, how to save, and how to work out problems within their families.

Elizabeth is 25 years old. She has a business selling mainly jackets and shoes. Her family also sells clothing, and Elizabeth worked in their store for several years. She opened her own store three years ago.

Yanet is 22 years old. She lives with her partner and new baby. She also sells clothing and has had her own store for two years. In addition, she has a stand where she sells cell phones and cell phone accessories.

Elizabeth and Yanet each need loans of 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying more clothing and shoes.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Elizabeth and Yanet plan to use their savings to add to their family's savings and increase their business together, and to take care of the baby. Their dreams are to have a large business and healthy family.

loans.use: Elizabeth and Yanet each need loans of 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in more clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Karim Khan

texts.en: Karim Khan lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with his own family, and he has a small business in agriculture. He is an educated man but he has lots of experience in his work. He has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years, and he is managing to support his family. He wants to expand his business so he wants to take an individual loan to expand his business and make good income to help his family. He is happy with all members of his family.

loans.use: To expand his small business

loans.name: Hidaya's Motomoto Group

texts.en:
Hidaya is 40 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 20,17,14 and 4. Hidaya owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 6am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Amina and Nuru, who have businesses dealing in kiosk owns and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong B. T. is a 54-year-old widow. She raises pigs from her home in Kampong Cham and sells them off to be bred or butchered. She earns $2 (US) per day. Her six children are all faithful to their mother and use their own salaries to provide her with additional support. One of her kids is a blacksmith and another is a construction worker in Phnom Penh where they do well. Another daughter works as a hairdresser and another two are English translators. Only one of her children still lives with her in Kampong Cham and is still attending school. She is quite thankful for her children but also wants to continue to develop her own business. She will purchase more pigs to raise as well as high quality feed to prepare them for sale. She is pictured here with one of her older pigs.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
"The business I have is a small snack stand. I need more supplies but at the moment I don´t have the capital I need to investment in the business. This is why I am requesting a loan for $1,000 dollars, in order to buy supplies for this business, which is the source of income for my family."

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio que tengo es de un pequeño snack. Pero me esta haciendo falta mas mercancía pero por el momento no tengo el capital necesario para invertirle al negocio es. Por eso que solicito un préstamo de $ 1,000.00 dlls. Para la compra de mercancía ya que este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase supplies.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo is a very hard-working man who spends as much time working in agricultural production as he can. This is the only activity through which he is able to support his family, his wife and five children who are still small and students. The care of his crops requires fertilizer for a good harvest and Leonardo is experiencing tight finances that have not allowed him to purchase these fertilizers. For this, he asks for a loan, money that will help keep his farmlands producing with quality. He is awaiting your response, he hopes, with gratitude, that it will be favorable.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Leonardo es un hombre muy trabajador que dedica el mayor tiempo posible en la producción agrícola, la cual es la única actividad con la cual puede mantener a su familia conformada por su esposa y sus 5 hijos, los cuales son aún pequeños y estudiantes. El cuidado de sus cultivos requiere de abono para una buena cosecha y Leonardo está pasando por ajustes económicos que no le permiten adquirir estos abonos, por ello solicita un préstamo, dinero que le ayudaría a que sus terrenos de cultivo sigan produciendo con calidad. Él estará al pendiente de su respuesta, esperado con agradecimiento sea favorable.

loans.use: Purchase of Fertilizer for his Farmlands

loans.name: Mansurhon

texts.ru: Кетманов Мансурхон житель города Яван.Работает учителем в средней школе. Учит детей  истории и географии. Параллельно занимается торговлей. Имеет место на рынке «Тиджорат» , где торгует канцелярскими товарами. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 16 лет. Дело дает неплохой доход. Но работа сезонная и только в сезон можно хорошо заработать. Поэтому он решил получить кредит  и использовать для ввоза товара. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.У Мансура большая и дружная семья. Он женат и имеет семерых детей. Дети еще школьники. Из них четыре девочки и три мальчика.
texts.en:
Mansurhon K. lives in the town of Yavan. He works as a teacher in the secondary school and teaches history and geography. He also does his own business and has a vendor space in the local market Tidjorat where he sells stationary and office supplies. He has been doing this business which brings him a decent income for the past sixteen years. But this work is seasonal and the profits are made during a specific time. This is why he decided to apply for a loan to bring in more merchandise. Mansurhon plans to pay off the loan within 12 months. He has a big and friendly family. He is married and has seven children who are still in school. They are four girls and three boys.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Tat

texts.en:
Mrs. Tat U., 40, is married with five children and works selling neat water for the people in her area. The majority of the people in the countryside lack neat water and are not yet covered by the state water provider. Mrs. Tat U. started her business in 2000 and typically makes about $2 income a day. Her husband works as a fisherman in TeleSap River which is a large lake rich in various kinds of fish. He has a boat with an engine and other fishing tools to help operate his business. Each day he makes around $5 income.

For many days, his boat engine has not been working properly and was frequently broken, being very old. Mrs. Tat U. and her husband are therefore requesting a loan from KIVA to purchase a new boat engine to replace her husband s old broken one and to buy more fishing nets.

loans.use: To purchase a new boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Group

texts.en:
"Mujeres D. Fe" (Women of Faith) is a new group of 10 women who are all living in extreme poverty and don't have steady incomes. Maxima M., the representative of this group, is the mother of 3 children, who are her main concern. She wants a better life for her children more than anything else in the world.

Maxima plans on taking her loan and starting a small business selling used clothing. She also loves to paint and wants to try and sell her paintings as well. Her goal is to have a thriving business, and she dreams of being able to travel. This group is all excited about this new challenge and opportunity! On behalf of Maxima, the group, and Esperanza International------- Thank you for your support!!!!

loans.use: Start a used-clothing business

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Mariamu S. from Mwanza, a beautiful city on the shores of Lake Victoria. (Lake Victoria is famous not only for being one of the largest lakes in the world, but also because it feeds the Nile River, a very important source of life for Africa.)

Mariamu is single, with one child who is 7 years old. She has been running a used clothing store since 2007. Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe. They are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Tanzania to retailers who re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets and in the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because of their low cost and the general appeal of anything modern.

Mariamu works at her business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. She currently earns about 100 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase additional used clothing for resale. Mariamu thanks you for supporting her business!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional used clothing for resale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes O. sells bags of garri in wholesale and retail. She travels to the village to purchase bags of garri to sell in Benin City. Agnes is a widow with 6 children. She is 45 years old. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags garri to sell

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley A. is married and has 3 children. She has received highschool education. Shirley owns a hairdressing salon at Ola in Cape Coast, which she opened in 2003. Shirley uses her income to pay her children's school fees, the family's utility bills, and other expenses. She will use the loan to purchase different kinds of hair products to meet the demand of her costumers. Shirley plans to invest the additional profit in her children's education.

loans.use: Purchase of various hair products

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en:
Folashade is 50 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria.

She has a business where she produces and sells soap. The demands for her soap are high; she has many customers. She has been in the soap business for long time.

Now, Folashade needs a loan of N50,000 so she purchase more material to produce soap. This will increase the amount of soap she can sell.

She is very grateful to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase materials to produce more soap

loans.name: Kang

texts.en: Mrs. P. is 37 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province where she owns a plot of land in her village, growing corn for sale. She is a mother of three children; they are all still young and under her care. Her husband is a local building worker. P. is widely known in her business of domestic corn growing, in which she plants four time a year. She works hard at her business activities every day and never wastes time. Corn growing is P.'s main source of income and provides her and her family with enough food. Recently, P.’s family has faced a problem with transportation because of the cost of paying a motor taxi driver. To reduce the cost of transportation, P. has requested a loan of $400 to buy a motorbike for family traveling.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family traveling.

loans.name: Diane

texts.fr:
D. Diane est née le 20/01/1988 à Zogbohouè, un quartier de la ville de Cotonou situé derrière le stade de l’amitié de KOUHOUNOU. Mais D. Diane est originaire de la commune d’Allada; elle est célibataire sans enfant. Diane gère une cabine téléphonique dans laquelle elle vend des cartes de recharge téléphonique de tous les réseaux au Bénin. Diane acquiert ses cartes à G8 qui est un point de vente en gros situé non loin de son domicile. La cabine téléphonique de Diane se situe devant son domicile. Diane est à son quatrième crédit et sollicite ce crédit pour s’approvisionner davantage en cartes de recharge téléphoniques.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
D. Diane was born on January 20, 1988 in Zogbohouè, a district in the city of Cotonou located behind Amitié Stadium of KOUHOUNOU. However, she traces her roots to the community of Allada. She is unmarried, has no children, and manages a telephone booth, where she sells recharge phone cards of all the networks in Benin. She acquires these cards at G8, which is a wholesale outlet not far from her home. Diane's telephone booth is situated in front of her home. She is on her fourth loan and is requesting this loan to supply herself with more recharge phone cards.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy recharge telephone cards of all the phone networks in Benin

loans.name: Kutfi

texts.ru: Кутфи, клиентка в Микроинвест с 2007 года.Она торгует на большом рынке города Худжанда по названию"Сомон".У неё вначале деятельности был один маленький отдел, а сейчас она арендует два больших контейнера на рынке.Для увеличения летнего ассортимента детской одежды Кутфи дала заявку на параллельный займ.По результатам мониторинга было выявлено , что для её оборота необходимо дать возможность на параллельный займ, т.к. у неё хороший поток клиентов.
texts.en:
Kutfi has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007. She trades at the big market in the city of Khujand, called “Somon.” When she started her business she had a small location, but now she rents two large containers at the market. In order to increase her product selection of children’s clothing, Kutfi applied for a parallel loan. The loan monitoring results showed that it is necessary to give her a chance to receive a parallel loan, because she has a good stream of customers.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase children's clothing for sale

loans.name: Katale Bwaise Nantogo Sylivia Group

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Sylivia is a married woman, aged 38 years, with five children: three still in school and two dependents.

Mrs. Sylivia is using the loan to purchase wines, beer, bottled water and sodas. She has been in her business for over 10 years and now she is happy for the Kiva loan because it is increasing her stock and, more so, her profits. Her dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase wines, beer, bottled water and sodas for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Marry

texts.en:
Marry has been a clothes and maize seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 2 years. She belongs to DDC 1 group loan (Group code 2017). Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more maize and clothes for resale, to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Marry is 44 years old, married, and has five children: ages 25, 17, 14, 10, and 4.

loans.use: To buy more maize and clothes for resale, to expand her business

loans.name: Idjonoi

texts.ru: Турсунова Айджоной проживает в районе Чоми. Возраст 44 года. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж работает таксистом. Айжоной более 11 лет занимается земледелием. Она в основном выращивает овощи и продает их на рынке. Клиентка просить кредит, чтобы купить ядохимикаты для обработки земли.
texts.en:
Idjonoi T. lives in the Jomi district. She is 44 years old, married and has 5 children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Idjonoi has been involved in agriculture for over 11 years. She mostly grows vegetables and sells them at the market. Our client is requesting a loan in order to buy pesticides to apply to the soil.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pesticides

loans.name: Talalelei

texts.en: Talalelei M., 43, is married with nine children.  She has many years of experience in the sewing business.  She sells to villagers and the public four days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD.  Talalelei expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala.  SPBD loans are Talalelei’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase sewing machine and thread for the sewing business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 57-year-old divorced woman and the mother of seven children. Through hard work, two are currently in school at the moment. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey for breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more money to support her children in school. She dreams of saving enough to build her own house before she dies.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Janat Beakam Group

texts.en:
Janat Beakam is the leader of Janat Beakam Group. There are five members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for his or her business to purchase more materials for their businesses and make a good income for their families in future. 

Sarow Naz and Bibi Khard want to take a loan for their tailoring business to buy one or two new machines of tailoring. Janat Beakam wants to take a loan for her husband’s general store to complete their stock. Fareba wants to take a loan for her carpet weaving business to complete her necessary materials. Also, Pashton Gull wants to take a loan for her husband’s metal shop business. They all want to see expansion and progress in their businesses and want to earn more money to support their families.

With this loan they can make their businesses larger and support their families, and make a better future for themselves and for their families.

loans.use: Expand their various businesses

loans.name: Dev Maiya

texts.en:
Dev Maiya D. lives in Chappagaun Village. She lives with her husband and three children. Her husband's name is Mr. Ramhari D. and he is a farmer. Most of the people in this region are dependent on agriculture and farming. 

Mrs. D. is engaged in handicraft work. She makes different types of traditional sandals, which are made of thick cloth. Most of the people in Nepal use these types of sandals in kitchens. These types of sandals are also used in wedding ceremonies. She has three years of experience in this job. Mostly people use these sandals in the winter season. 

She supplies her products in Asan Market. Asan is one of the very busy bazaars of Kathmandu. Now Mrs. D. is requesting a Rs 10,000.00 loan to buy raw material for her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es:
Araceli tiene 23 años, es madre de una niña de 3 añitos y vive con su esposo, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros. Desde hace 6 meses cuenta en su casa con un pequeño galpón que mandó a construir para criar pollos. En este negocio le está yendo muy bien, ya que tiene buena orientación por parte de un tío, quien le enseña cómo criar a los pollos para que obtengan el peso y tamaño adecuado. Cada 35 días los pollos ya están listos para salir al mercado y cuando los vende obtiene buenas ganancias. Sin embargo, Araceli no se queda atrás, porque también es propietaria de un motocarro, con el que trabaja su esposo en el transporte de pasajeros y ella es la encargada de administrar las ganancias. A Araceli le gustan sus labores porque aprende cosas nuevas y se mantiene ocupada, sobre todo es un gran apoyo para su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
Ella es parte de un banco comunal en MFP y lo que le gusta de su grupo es que son personas solidarias y responsables en sus pagos.
Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más pollos bebés y suficiente alimento para su crianza, así seguirá activa en este negocio donde le va muy bien.
texts.en:
Araceli is 23 and has a three year old daughter. She lives with her husband who works at transporting passengers. Six months ago she had a small shed built at her house to raise chickens. The business is going very well for her. She has good training from an uncle who teaches her how to raise chickens to be the right size and weight. Every 35 days the chickens are ready to go to market. When she sells them she gets good income. Nevertheless, Araceli does not stop there because she also owns a “motocarro” (a three wheeled motorized cart). He husband works with it to transport passengers. She is in charge of administering the earnings. Araceli likes her jobs because she learns new thing, and they keep her busy. Above all, it is a great help to her husband with the household expenses. She is part of a communal bank in MFP. What she likes most about her group is that they are supportive people, and they are responsible with their payments. With the money she is asking for she will buy more baby chickens and enough food to raise them. This way she will continue to be active in this business, which is going very well for her.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy baby chickens and food for them

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn S. is from the village of San Antonio, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 30 years-old and married with four school-aged children. Jocelyn owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling a variety of vegetable products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia B., who lives in Cadiz City, Negros Occidental, in the Philippines, is 50 years old and is married with six children. Her husband works as a timekeeper in Hacienda, which earns him a low monthly salary that barely supports the needs of their family. Although some of her children are already adults and can fend for themselves, she has younger children (the youngest being just 9 years old) who still depend on her for all their needs. Amalia's ambition in life is to be able to send her children to school and to help her husband support their family.

For this reason, she decided to set up a general store. Fortunately, she had the foresight to build it in an area where there is a steady flow of pedestrian traffic -- right in front of the tricycle terminal. As time went on, her business steadily improved. Moreover, she used her business skills to continuously improve and enlarge her product lines, such as by stocking up on fast-selling products for a high inventory turnover rate.

In 2005, when she realized that she needed fresh capital in order to take her store to the next level, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon. By doing so, she was able to borrow much-needed capital to continue her business expansion. And, as she has continued to pay back and borrow new loans, she is happy that her membership with NWTF-PD hsa allowed her to sustain her business momentum. In fact, her business now earns her a net profit of PHP 3,000, which puts her that much closer to meeting her family's dreams.

In her previous loan, she borrowed PHP 7,500 for her 7th cycle loan, which she used as working capital for her general store. Notably, she paid her weekly installment payment in full and in a timely manner, without any delays. For her 8th cycle she is seeking to borrow PHP 15,000 to be used (again) as additional capital. More specifically, she hopes to maximize her income potential with this loan, especially now that the sugar milling season has started once again, thereby opening a new opportunity to sell more goods to the community. She intends to use the income generated from her business to support her family's needs.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 per day to achieving success beyond their wildest imaginations. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable women. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To expand and improve her store by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Felly

texts.en:
Felly L. is a typical mother who dreams of giving her children the kind of life they will enjoy for as long as they are young until they will have their own families someday. Loans she has requested through ASHI since her membership began in 1998 have enabled her to achieve partial fulfillment of her dream.

Felly has her own business which is embroidery. As years passed by, she made it grow and has made herself one of the famous woman in embroidering formal dresses: barong (a typical Filipino formal shirt for men) and Filipiñana (a typical Filipino dress for women).

Her profits have grown, yet regarding all her children’s financial needs for food, clothes, and education, her income as a single parent (after the death of her husband many years ago) is not enough. Though she has sent her three older children to a vocational course and has enabled them to graduate from it, she still has three children to work hard for until they graduate from college.

The loans Felly is requesting now and in the future will bring joy and fulfillment. For a 54-year-old woman like her, she has nothing to dream of but seeing her children enjoying things that life can offer aside from poverty.

loans.use: To buy materials she needs for her embroidery business

loans.name: But

texts.en: Normally, Mrs. But S. and her husband get up in early morning, when the sky is still dark, to go buy fish in bulk from fishermen and then they hurry to bring their fish to sell at the market for a profit. In addition, But S.’s husband uses his motorcycle to pick up passengers for fees. This couple hastwo children, who are employed in garment industry. In order to earn extra income, But S. is applying for a loan to be used to purchase feed and piglets to begin raising.

loans.use: To purchase feed and piglets

loans.name: Daylyn

texts.en:
Daylyn P. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety retail store) selling food, daily use products and a variety of soft drinks in her community. She is 23 years old, married and has one small child. They are from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. Daylyn has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Daylyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Daylyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Daylyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian is 47 years old and married with a child. His child is 12 years old and in a primary school. He hopes to educate his child to the university level.

Christian is a very hardworking man. He sells engine oil and motor spare parts in Delta State, Nigeria. He is excited to take his first Kiva loan. He hopes to invest in his business with the loan by purchasing more engine oil and motor spear parts. He is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil and motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Sènoumè

texts.fr: Z. Sènoumè est née en 1975 et vit depuis 8 ans à Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Mariée à CHAGANOU Firmin, un mécanicien, Sènoumè est mère de trois enfants, dont deux sont à sa charge. Tous ses enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents à Lokokoukoumè. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Sènoumè n’a fait que le cours primaire. Pour aider son mari, Sènoumè mène comme activité, la vente de divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, sardines, tomates en boîte, lait, riz, mayonnaise, couscous, huile végétale, pâtes dentifrices, savons, etc.) dans sa boutique située dans sa maison. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Sènoumè s’approvisionne. Sènoumè exerce cette activité depuis 6 ans, et a obtenu déjà deux crédits auprès de ALIDé. Sènoumè a bien remboursé les deux crédits qu’elle avait obtenus. Sènoumè sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever davantage le niveau de son activité, et mieux répondre à la demande des clients.
texts.en:
Sènoumè Z. was born in 1975 and has been living in Lokokoukoume in Benin’s Seme-Podji municipality for the past eight years. She is married to Firmin CHAGANOU, a mechanic. As a couple, they work together to meet the needs of the family. Sènoumè is the mother of three children, with two being her responsibility. All her children are in school and living with their parents in Lokokoukoume. Sènoumè only completed primary school. To help her husband, Sènoumè sells various products (pasta, sardines, canned tomatoes, milk, rice, mayonnaise, couscous, vegetable oil, toothpaste, soap, etc.) from a small shop in her home. Sènoumè gets her supplies at the Dantokpa international market in Benin. Sènoumè has been running this business for six years. She has previously obtained two loans from ALIDé, and both have been fully repaid. Sènoumè is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to further increase her business activity and better respond to the needs of her customers.


Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk cartons, sugar, bags of rice and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Palanitina

texts.en:
Palanitina S. is 41 and married with 5 children (ages 8 - 23).  She owns a business venture, selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam).  Palanitina has many years of experience in this business.  Palanitina needs a loan of WST $1100 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 140 tala or US $58 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Palanitina joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Palanitina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Palanitina S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.99 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.89 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en:
Mohira O. is 48 years old. She and her husband raised 4 children. Ten years ago, Mohira learned how to embroider the national skull-cap for men and women, and now she run her own business. She works really hard, getting up very early and going to bed very late, selling the skull-caps at the local market. Mohira dreams of arranging the marriage of her son. With this purpose in mind, Mohira is planning to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of $800 USD. Mohira is planning to spend the loan on purchasing materials for embroidering. Mohira had shown herself to be a reliable client of IMON. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to make her dream become reality.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase materials for embroidering the national skull-cap.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en: Mouhamad is a 42-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Mouhamad has been working in agriculture for over 15 years. To facilitate his work, he uses a truck, which allows him to mow the field. He plants potatoes and other vegetables depending on the season. He is special in his work because he is known for his good production. His clients are people from his region. He decided on doing his business because he took over his family’s business. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua to do some maintenance work on his truck. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his truck.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu, age 50, is married with three children who are between the ages of 11 and 20 years old. All her children go to school She resides and rents a two roomed house where she is staying with four people. Nulu takes care of one additional family member. There is no electricity and no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. 

Nulu resides and works in a semi urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. Nulu sells charcoal in Kamwokya market and gets charcoal from delivery trucks, so she doesn't incur transport costs. She sells to an average of 30 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for the business and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the past 11 years.

Nulu has been with MCDT for more than ten years and is servicing her 24th loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal  Nulu aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent place of business. 

.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn S. lives in the village of Bocator tangub city. She is 47 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn runs a specialized retail store where she sells everyday products such as dried fish, shampoo, soap, toothpaste, eggs, sugar, salt and more. She has been engaged in this business for more than two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from her work.

Last year, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, and is now applying for a new one for 7,000 PHP to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Otgonbileg

texts.en:
Otgonbileg is 41 years-old and lives with her two children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. She lives with her two children in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. They have been living together in their current home for six years. Unfortunately, her husband passed away and Otgonbileg has been working hard to improve her family's quality of life. 

At present, she operates a consumer product trading business and also works as a salesperson at another person's counter at a local market called Uliastai. Otgonbileg is a very hardworking person and says, “I am working hard to improve my family's quality of life.”  She is  requesting a 300,000 tugrug (~ 225 USD) loan to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce en détail de cartes de recharges,il réalise de bonnes recettes, pour mieux diversifier son commerce il a impliqué 2 personnes de sa famille et a associé le service téléphonique à son activité. Voulant rehausser son stock afin de bien satisfaire ses clients,  il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 50 cartes de recharges Togocell, 50 cartes de recharges Moov et  20 cartes de recharges Illico.
il est marié et a 2 enfants
texts.en:
Mr Kokou Z.'s economic activity is to sell re-chargeable mobile telephone cards with credit on them. In order to diversify his business he also employs two family members and has associated himself with the telephone service. In order to replenish his stock and better satisfy his customers, he is asking for a loan from WAGES in order to purchase 50 re-chargeable cards from Togocell and Moov and 20 re-chargeable cards from Illico. He is married and has two children.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of re-chargeable phone cards

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom L. is 42 years old and lives in Trakiet village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Seoun Sok is a musician who is able to earn a small income to support his family. He is shown with her in the photo.

With both these businesses, they still earn less income than needed to improve their family living. Thus, Mrs. Sokhom L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. With the new business, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family living conditions.

This couple has four children: two are workers in Malaysia while two other are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Heoun's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Hoeun S. is a 31 year old married woman and is the village bank president selected by nine members, located in Reang Chaor village, in Kandall province. The members of this village loan will use the funds to support their different purposes. Mrs. Hoeun S. and her husband, Mr. Ven Soeun, are rice middlemen to earn funds for their family's costs of living. For supporting this business, Mrs. Hoeun S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy more rice to sell. Aside from this business, Mr. Ven Soeun is a fisherman earning a little income to support his family's costs of living. Mrs. Hoeun S. is a mother of two children who are all students in the local school.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy more rice.

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en: Mustapha G., an active businessman who owns a provision shop on Mahei Boima Road, takes care of his brothers and sisters. One of his brothers assists him greatly in the shop.  Mustapha has decided to request a loan in order to buy more provisions for his shop and use the additional proceeds from his business to finally complete his construction project currently in progress and take care of his brother and sisters who are going to school.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Amy Diagne

texts.fr: Madame Amy Diagne C. est une femme mariée  qui habite dans la localité de Bambilor. Elle est membre de la caisse depuis décembre 2009 et a déjà  bénéficié  d’un prêt antérieur. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce et s’active dans l’achat et la vente de poissons fumes, sel, piments et divers condiments utilises par les femmes pour  la cuisine. Elle sollicite un crédit de 50 000 frs prévu  pour l’achat de tamarin et de piment pour renforcer son commerce. Les crédits lui permettent d’accroitre ses revenus et  de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Ms. Amy Diagne C. is a married woman living in the Bambilor locality. She has been a member of the local group fund since December 2009 and has already benefited from one previous loan. She is involved in the business of buying and selling smoked fish, salt, spices, and various condiments used by women to cook. She is seeking a loan of 50,000 frs destined to buy tamarind and spices to strengthen her business. This loan will allow her to increase her income and provide for herself.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es: Néstor, de 37 años, es un padre de familia muy amoroso y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Valvina de 32 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Con el apoyo de su esposa, Néstor decidió comprar hace 20 años, unos terrenos en los cuales pudiera trabajar y así mejorar la economía de su familia. Actualmente esos terrenos los sigue trabajando, pero ahora son mucho más productivos, ya que sus cultivos de papa, alverja y maíz son de muy buena calidad y con el paso del tiempo ha aprendido a obtener la mayor producción de sus chacras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la relación tan cercana que tiene con la tierra, además disfruta mucho viendo sus sembríos crecer, sin embargo lo más difícil es tener que cuidar sus campos de las inclemencias del clima, ya que cualquier descuido puede afectar la cosecha. Para más adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP; esta muy contento por obtenerlo, ya que lo necesita urgentemente para mejorar su negocio. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy querido, ya que siempre pone mucho orden en las reuniones. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Néstor is 37 years old and a loving hardworking father. He lives in his own home with his wife Valvina, age 32, and their three beloved children for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. Twenty years ago, Néstor received the support of his wife and decided to buy some land so that he could work and improve his family’s financial situation. He continues to work on the land, but now he is much more productive. His crops of potatoes, peas, and corn are of very good quality, and over time, he has learned how to obtain a better production rate at harvest time. What he enjoys most is the close relationship he has with the land. He likes watching his crops grow. On the other hand, Néstor finds it difficult to care for his fields whenever inclement weather is present since any type of neglect can affect the harvest. Later on he hopes to buy additional land so that he can increase his production.

This is his seventh loan with MFP. Néstor is very happy to obtain this loan since he already has an urgent need to improve his business. He is an admired member of his Communal Bank because he always seeks to restore order at the meetings. The loan of 3000 PEN that he requested will be used to buy more compost so that he can improve the productivity of his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es: Olga es de 33 años de edad es unida con su pareja, tiene cuatro hijos dos varones y dos mujeres, se dedica a realizar costuras hace unos 3 años, solicita su tercer crédito para sufragar gastos persónale, la cual le viene ayudar a su familia, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajadora, su crédito anterior lo pago puntualmente, con la de su esposo pagaran las cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Olga is 33 years old and lives with her common-law husband. They have four children: two sons and two daughters. She has worked as a seamstress for three years. She is asking for her third loan to help defray her personal living expenses, which will help her support her family. Her personal references say she is a responsible and hard-working person. She repaid her previous loan on time, and she and her husband will make the monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella M., from the village of Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya, is 45 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Bella owns and operates a business selling fruits and vegetables to the local community. Engaged in her business for over six years, she earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Bella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, Bella plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Kon Tol

texts.en:
Kon Tol B. lives in Kaoh Reah Leu village, Kandal province.  She was born in 1983.  Kon Tol and her husband are farmers who rent a plot of land to grow papaya and mango to sell to support their family.   Her husband is also a horse cart driver. 

Her problem is that her mango field has a lot of insects. To improve production, Kon Tol is asking for a loan to buy pesticides. She is the mother of two children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: Buy pesticides.

loans.name: Abana

texts.en:
Abana E. K. is married and has six dependents. She has no educational background.

Abana sells locally-made pomade and soap at Elmina and, with the support of her husband, she is able to take care of the family. She will use the loan to purchase more of her pomade and soap for sale.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Abana plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more pomade and soap to sell

loans.name: Petronilla

texts.en:
Petronilla A. is 27 years old, married and has two children, one three years old and the other, only three months. She is from the town of Trinidad within Bohol province on the Visayas islands. Petronilla runs a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. She also plans to buy and sell rice at her store.

Petronilla joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Petronilla is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jose Hector

texts.es:
José Héctor es un padre de familia de 70 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el sector Santa Clara del distrito de Pítipo, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Ferreñafe, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a labores asociadas a la agricultura. Por un lado posee vacas de las cuales comercializa a diario la leche que producen a un acopiador de la zona. Adicionalmente posee un pequeño terreno de cultivo en el que suele sembrar maíz y pasto, los cuales utiliza para agenciarse de ingresos adicionales y alimentar con sus derivados a sus vacas.

José desea adquirir material de construcción para implementar el corral que posee con nuevos comederos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

El es una persona con bastante conocimiento y experiencia sobre el manejo de ganado y cultivos. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y respeto.
texts.en:
Jose is a family man who is seventy years old and lives with his family in the Santa Clara sector of the Pitipo District. This is an agricultural zone that is located in the Ferreñafe Province, a little more than an hour from Chiclayo.
Since he was young, Jose has worked in agriculture. On the one hand he has cows that produce milk that he sells each day to a collector in his zone. Also he has a small piece of land where he grows grain and hay, which he uses to eek out some additional income and also to feed his cows.
Jose would like to buy construction material in order to build a corral, as he owns some new animals. It is because of this need that he finds it convenient to ask for a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa. He is asking for a loan of 1000 new soles, money that will help him achieve his objectives. He is a very knowledgeable and experienced person in the fields of ranching and farming. Everyone that knows him looks upon him with much esteem and respect.

loans.use: To buy material to build a corral.

loans.name: Hortense Julienne S.

texts.fr: O. Hortense Julienne S. est née le 12 Avril 1978 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à SAÏZONOU Euphrem, Hortense Julienne est mère d’un enfant qui est scolarisé. Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Il y a juste un an que la famille s’est installée au quartier Yénawa à Cotonou. Hortense Julienne aide son mari à assurer les diverses charges familiales, grâce au revenu de son activité. Hortense Julienne a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire, puis s’est consacrée à la vente de savons en cartons et aussi des biscuits et des produits alimentaires en cartons. Hortense Julienne s’approvisionne au marché Gbogbanou à Cotonou, et vend ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Hortense Julienne sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit, en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et d’accroître sa clientèle, ce qui lui permettra de se faire plus de revenus.
texts.en: Hortense Julienne S. O. was born on 12 April 1978 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Married to Euphrem Saizonou, Hortense Julienne is the mother of one child who attends school.  The couple has another child they look after.  They have only been living in the Yénawa neighborhood in Cotonou for one year.  Hortense Julienne helps her husband manage the various family expenses thanks to the profits of her business.  Hortense Julienne quit school at the secondary level, then devoted herself to the sale of boxes of soap and also boxes of crackers and basic foodstuffs.  Hortense Julienne buys her supply at the Gbogbanou market in Cotonou and sells her products in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  This is the second time that Hortense Julienne has requested a loan from ALIDé.  She is looking to increase her working capital and increase her clientele which will allow her to gain more profits.

loans.use: Buying boxes of soap and crackers

loans.name: Hannah Adjoa Begyina

texts.en:
Hannah Adjoa Begyina A. sells provisions in Elmina. Hannah has received junior high school education. She is married to a mason and has three children. She assists her husband in the care of their children. Her loan will be used to buy more of her goods to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further her children’s education.

In this photo, Hannah is sitting beside some bags of rice, boxes of canned tomatoes, gallons of oil and other things.

loans.use: To buy more of her goods to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros C. is from the village of Tumbao, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 70 and married with nine adult children. To make a living, Milagros runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and instant noodles in the local community. Milagros has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Milagros joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milagros has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI which she used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Milagros is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be her fifth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Jacquiline

texts.en:
Jacquiline C. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 24 years old. Jacquiline is married and has 3 children aged 8, 6 and 4. To make a living, Jacquiline owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jacquiline has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

Jacquiline joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacquiline has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jacquiline is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María Magdalena tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de tipeos, copias, escaneados y grabación de CD's en su domicilio. Ella ofrece este servicio a los estudiantes de la zona y al público en general, el público suele preferir su negocio y durante las temporadas escolares cuenta con bastante acogida. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

María desea mejorar su negocio con la compra de más material y brindándole mantenimiento a sus equipos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María Magdalena is 51 years old.  She is married and lives with her family in Olmos district, an agricultural area with a lot of commercial activity which is located in Lambayeque province, one hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

María provides typing, copying, scanning and CD recording services from her home.  She offers this service to the students in her area and to the general public.  The public is usually loyal to her business and, during term time, her business is quite popular.  She uses the profits that she makes from this activity to help her family get ahead financially.

María would like to improve her business, buying more material and having her equipment serviced.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy material and have her equipment serviced

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” VIRGEN ASUNTA  DE OROPEZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Delia; ella tiene 56 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de plásticos en su casa ella vende platos, vasos, tazas, manteles por metro platos descartables, cubiertos descartables entre otros mas, a la vez la socia también vende útiles de escritorio como lapiceros, borradores, engrampadoras entre otros más, la socia es una persona muy entusiasta y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante por su familia.



La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the "VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPEZA” community bank which is located in Oropesa district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Delia is 56 years old.  She lives with her partner and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling plastic products from a store which is located in her home.  She sells plates, cups, tablecloths by the meter, disposable plates, disposable cutlery, etc.  She also sells writing supplies such as pens, erasers, staplers, etc.  She is a very enthusiastic person who has a great wish to get her family ahead in life.

Delia is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more products for her business and thereby get her family ahead in life

loans.name: Aita

texts.es:
Aita es una madre D. familia D. 58 años D. edad y resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío La Compuerta, una zona agrícola que pertenece al distrito D. Oyotún, una zona D. territorio accidentado que se encuentra situada a dos horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura junto a su esposo, juntos poseen un terreno D. cultivo en donD. suelen sembrar granos y cereales, asimismo ella cuenta con un grupo D. animales menores los cuales cría en algunos corrales D. su vivienda alimentándoles D. granos y pastos naturales, cuando estos se han desarrollado completamente los venD. a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donD. resiD..

Aita desea adquirir pesticidas y abonos para poder brindarle mantenimiento al cultivo D. maíz que tiene instalado actualmente, D. ese modo esperan asegurarse una buena cosecha. Asimismo desea adquirir alimento balanceado para sus animales. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1800 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Aita is a 58 year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the hamlet of La Compuerta, an agricultural zone in the district of Oyotún. It is an area with uneven, hilly land, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She and her husband both work in agriculture. They own a plot of farmland together, where they plant grains and cereals. Aita also has a group of young animals that she raises in pens at her house. She feeds them natural grains and grasses, and once they have fully developed, she sells them to merchants who pass through the zone where they live.

Aita would like to buy pesticides and fertilizers to care for the corn fields that they currently have planted. She hopes this will ensure a good harvest.  She would also like to acquire a balanced diet for her animals.  In order to achieve her goals, she decided to request a loan of 1,800 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her corn fields

loans.name: Cesia

texts.es:
La señorita Cesia es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias del distrito de calleria, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 20 años de edad.
Tiene una pequeña bodega, recién lleva 1 año trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos.
La señorita Cesia invertirá su nuevo préstamo de S/.1,000.00 nuevos soles en la compra de productos para su bodega, como son: ½ caja de leche, 1 caja de galletas, 2 tiras de chistriz, 2 tiras de chizitos, 1 bolsa de galleta de animalitos, 25 kilos de azúcar, 3 bolsas de caramelos, 1 paquete de agua. 1 paquete de guarana, 25 kilos de arroz, ½ caja de aceite de medio litro.
La señorita Cesia está aprovechando su juventud y tiene todas las ganas de seguir trabajando.  Tiene mucha fe de que su cegocio va ir creciendo poco apoco.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos pudo empezar a trabajar, porque le dieron un pequeño capital, para iniciar la idea del negocio que tenia.
texts.en:
Señorita Cesia is a member of the community bank Mujeres Solidarias (Women United) in the Calleria district in the department of Ucayali. She is 20 years old and has a small grocery store. She recently marked her one-year anniversary of working with loans from Manuela Ramos.

Señorita Cesia will invest her new loan of 1000 PEN in the purchase of products for her store, such as 1/2 box of milk, 1 box of crackers, 4 strips of cheese snacks, 1 bag of animal crackers, 25 kilos of sugar, 3 bags of candy, 1 package of bottled water, 1 package of guarana (a local fruit drink), 25 kilos of rice, and 1/2 box of half-liter bottles of oil.

Señorita Cesia makes good use of her youth and has all the will to continue working. She has great faith that her business is going to increase little by little.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos, she was able to begin working, because they gave her a little capital to begin the business that she had an idea for.

loans.use: Stock her store.

loans.name: Marta Etelvina

texts.es:
Marta Etelvina V. R.: es casada de 40 años de edad tiene 3 hijos, ella tiene un salon de belleza el cual inicio hace 4 años ella se dedica a atender todos los dias por las tardes y por las mañanas se dedica a su familia y a la venta de calzado su salon de velleza se llama ethel.
Solicita el credito para la compra de cosmeticos de belleza como uñas,tintes,colorantes,shampoos,etc ella mas adelante desea comprar unas bitrinas mas ya que las que tiene el producto ya no cabe,el sueño mas grande de ella es ver a sus hijos graduados y berlos con un futuro mejor y que sean unas personas de bien el sueño para su negocio, es poder comprar un lotecito para poder tener su salon y no pagar alquiler del mismo
texts.en:
Marta Etelvina V. R. is 40 years old, married, and has three children.  She has a beauty salon, which she started four years ago.  She takes care of her business every afternoon.  In the mornings she devotes her time to her family and to selling footwear.  Her beauty salon is called “Ethel”.

She is requesting the loan to buy cosmetics and beauty products like nails, tints, dyes, and shampoos, etc.  Later she wishes to buy more display cases because the products that she has no longer fit in the case she has.

Her biggest dreams are to see her children graduate, to see them have a better future, and to see them become successful people.  Her dream for her business is to be able to buy a small lot.  Then she would not have to pay rent for her salon.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and beauty products like nails, tints, dyes, and shampoos, etc.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis Eduardo C. G., está en unión libre, tiene un hijo, vive con su esposa e hijo que son sus prioridades. El quiere comprar abonos y otros productos que necesita para la asistencia de su cafetal. El cuenta con el terreno ya sembrado y la topografía donde se encuentra es apta para este cultivo. Lo que el pretende es aplicarle abonos o productos que le mejoren la producción este año. El cuenta con la experiencia de trabajar en café desde hace varios años ya y quiere ir fortaleciendo aun más su proyecto. El espera que con estas mejoras que le hará le produzca una cosecha más grande este año y pueda obtener más ganancias para su bienestar y la de su familia en un futuro.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Luis Eduardo C. G. is in a common law relationship.  He has a son.  He lives with his wife and son who are his priorities.  He wants to buy manure and other supplies he needs for his coffee crops.  He has a planted field with topography suited for this crop.  He pretends to apply manure and other products that will improve his crop yields this year.  He has several years experience growing coffee and wants to strengthen his project still more.  He hopes these improvements will lead to a larger harvest this year to obtain more profits for his family’s future wellbeing.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He hadn’t had any other loans with state banks but FUDECOSUR provided the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.es: Claudia tiene 33 años, es casada tiene 2 hijos. Vive en el reparto Emir Cabeza, una zona que es muy transitada. Desde hace 4 años, cuenta con una pulpería donde vende a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Actualmente, desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería. También, desea responder a la demanda de diferentes productos que le solicitan durante esta temporada de verano. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a un préstamo para puede comprar latas de sardinas, golosinas, pan, refrescos, jugos, granos básicos. Claudia es un cliente muy buena de Fundación y ha cumplido con sus otras obligaciones de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Claudia, 33, is married and has two children.  She lives in Emir Cabeza, an area with lots of passers-by.  For the last four years she has had a grocery store where she sells an assortment of daily use items and groceries to neighbors and customers from the area.

She wants to expand her business buying more merchandise.  She also wants to respond to demand for items her customers request during this summer season.  She has, therefore, thought it convenient to request a loan to buy cans of sardines, snacks, bread, beverages, juices and basic grains.

Claudia is a very good Fundación client and has met her other obligations punctually.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en: Peris is divorced and has three children, all of whom attend school. She and her family live in a rented house that has electricity but no piped-in water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are rent, clothing and food. For the last three years, she has made a living by selling vegetables to her neighbors and passerby. Her main challenges are the high cost of transportation and the seasonal nature of her business. In the future, she dreams of owning a farm. Peris is applying for this loan to improve her stall and buy more vegetables to sell to her customers. She decided to join Yehu after seeing how our program benefits its members.

loans.use: To upgrade her stall and buy more vegetables to sell to her customers. matoes.

loans.name: Mohssen

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 57 years old, married and has three children who all work.

In 1979, Mohssen inherited a farm with calves from his family. He sells all kinds of dairy products. He gained experience with time. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to buy a Friesian (dairy) cow and to build a roof for the farm. He aspires to buy more cows to increase milk production so he will be able to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a Friesian cow and to build a roof for the farm.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years and also earns an income from selling dried fish. Renalyn sustains her business through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Renalyn is requesting a loan of 21,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a fishing boat and purchase materials to dry fish. In the future, she hopes to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat and purchase materials to dry fish

loans.name: Akosua
