texts.en: Akosua sells dresses and cooks wakye (rice and beans cooked together) for sale in Abura. Wakye is normally served with wele (cowhide), macaroni, salad and hot pepper sauce. Akosua has completed senior high school. She is married to a farmer and has four children. She assists her husband in providing for her family's basic needs. Her loan will be used to buy rice, black-eyed peas and other items to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy rice, black-eyed peas and other items to expand her business.

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Madame Oumou a plus 42 ans et vit avec son époux et ses 7 enfants (2 garçons et 5 filles), à Wayerma I, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, Madame Oumou s’est initiée à cette activité de restauration depuis plus de quinze ans. Son activité est menée toutes les nuits devant le domicile conjugal à Wayerma I Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses mets.  
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après 8 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son septième prêt individuel, tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce présent prêt:, 30 poulets, 2 sacs de pomme de terre, 20 paquets de spaghetti, 45kg de poissons frais, 40kg de haricot, 40 sachets d’Attièkè, 30kg de haricot vert et un stock de bananes plantain (Aloko). Elle achète ses marchandises sur place.  Les plats alimentaires sont vendues au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes, de jeunes (célibataires) surtout de noctambules. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt .
texts.en:
Oumou is over 42 years old and lives with her husband and seven children (two boys and five girls) in Wayerma I, the central town of Sikasso (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region).

Having had many unsuccessful business ventures, Oumou began her restauration business more than 15 years ago. She carries this out every night in front of her marital home in Wayerma I Sikasso, where she is in great demand from her customers for the quality of her dishes. 

In order to satisfy her ever growing customer demand, she decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, five years ago. After eight solidarity (group) loans within a women's association in her district, she is now on her seventh individual loan, and all her previous loans have been repaid in full.

With this loan she is planning to buy: 30 chickens, two sacks of potatoes, 20 packets of spaghetti, 45kg of fresh fish, 40kg of beans, 40 sachets of "Attièkè"(couscous made from cassava), 30kg of green beans and a stock of plantain bananas (Aloko). She buys her products locally. She sells her meals for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of women, young (single) people and above all nightowls. 

She expects to make a monthly profit of 150,000FCFA which will be used mainly to expand her business, to contribute to the family's expenses and to pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for restauration business

loans.name: Shapagat's Group

texts.en:
Shapagat, 49, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of the village of Tup, a place where vulnerable groups are concentrated. Shapagat believes that only entrepreneurship can pull the people out of poverty and provide them with employment to make a living. Local training by NGOs focuses on promoting awareness of how to work, get a license and improve the local community. Shapagat founded the business of cattle breeding with an initial capital of 20,000 soms saved out of her husband’s income from driving a cab. Although the business has been running for only three years, the family has saved for the reconstruction of the house. Shapagat’s purpose for the loan is to purchase two head of livestock. She believes Kiva lenders’ assistance will help her both financially and mentally. Unlike many of her acquaintances, Shapagat believes in the possibility of earning money through labor in Kyrgyzstan, without having to go to Russia and risk her life and health.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Hugo Vinicio

texts.es:
Hugo Vinicio tiene 37 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 7 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  SAGRADO CORAZON  se encuentra ubicada en el sector Cuatro Esquinas perteneciente al cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 12 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de los mismos y otras actividades que da utilidades.

Hugo se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, trigo, maíz en tierras propias donde tiene dos cuadras de terreno, también tiene otra actividad un negocio donde presta servicios de funeraria. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es tener un negocio estable para mejorar la situacion economica.

Le gusta las fiestas de San Pedro y Carnaval ademas le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Hugo Vinicio is 37 years old, married and lives with his wife and children in the hamlet Guaranda in the province of Bolívar. He has seven children. 

The members of the communal bank "Sagrado Corazón" [Sacred Heart] are located in the Cuatro Esquinas area belonging to the Guaranda hamlet, fifteen minutes away from the cooperative's office. This group is made up of 12 members who raise crops and livestock in commercial enterprises, as well as other income-producing activities. 

Hugo earns a living in farming. He grows potatoes, wheat and corn on his own land where he has two blocks [about 3 acres] of land. He also has another business of providing funeral services. He does his purchasing in the Guaranda market and his selling in the wholesale market of the same city. 

He is seeking the loan to purchase supplies for his farming. With the support of the loan he would be financially helped to supply his needs. His dream is to have a stable business to improve his financial situation. He likes the San Pedro and Carnaval holidays as well as playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for growing crops.

loans.name: Nuñez Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Núñez está conformado por Milagros Del Socorro y Maria. Ambas tienen diferentes actividades económicas pero se llevan muy bien. Maria es una persona muy emprendedora y disfruta de su actividad económica, la mayoría de sus clientes llegan para disfrutar de los deliciosos platillos que ofrece. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de granos básicos, verduras, carnes, pollos, frutas para la elaboración de refrescos entre otros. Sueña con lograr construir una habitación en su vivienda.
texts.en:
The Núñez Solidarity Group consists of Milagros del Socorro and Maria. Even though they engage in different business activities, they get along well with each other. Maria is an enterprising individual who enjoys her business. Most of her customers come to enjoy the delicious dishes that she offers.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy basic grains, vegetables, meats, chicken, fruits for making refreshments, and other supplies. She dreams of building a room in her home.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, vegetables, meats, chicken, fruits, and other supplies.

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
Melecia, 47, lives in Ozamis City and is married with four children. She has a charcoal painting business from which she earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase materials for her business.

Melecia has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her charcoal painting business.

location.town: Ozamis-Kinuman Norte, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia, de 36 años convive con el padre de sus dos hijos en su casa propia, es una mujer alegre y sobre todo trabajadora que le gusta estar haciendo todo tipo de actividades para poder generar algún ingreso en su hogar.
Sonia tiene como trabajo el de la compra y venta de animales, esta actividad la esta realizando ya desde hace dos años. Ella se va a las chacras y caseríos alejados de la ciudad en busca de animales como patos, gallinas, cerdos, etc., para comprarlos y traerlos a vender a la ciudad, este trabajo es muy rentable ya que hay veces que se puede hasta duplicar la inversión de su dinero.Lo que no le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene que ir sola además de dejar por días enteros a sus hijos. Sin embargo, lo que le gusta es que gana una buena cantidad de dinero y a veces también hay ocasiones en que puede ver a sus hijos días enteros. Hace poco ella empezó con una idea, el de ir a un lugar un poco alejado de la ciudad en donde sus familiares la convencieron de poder sacar oro de forma artesanal, así que ella espera poder incursionar en este negocio en las siguientes semanas.Este es el tercer préstamo entre Sonia y MFP, esta contenta pues agradece que le presten sin necesidad de tantos papeleos y sobre todo le enseñan a como poder utilizar de la mejor manera su dinero.Con el préstamo solicitado 1500 soles ella comprará materiales para la búsqueda de oro.
texts.en:
Sonia is 36, and lives with the father of her two sons in their own house. She is a cheerful woman, and above all hard-working.  She likes to be doing all types of work to be able to generate any income she can for the household.  Sonia buys and sells animals; work she has been doing for two years now.  She goes to the small farms and rural settlements far from the city, looking for animals such as ducks, chickens, pigs etc., to buy and bring to the city to sell.  

This work is very profitable, since there are times you can even double your investment.   What she doesn't like about her work is that she has to go by herself, and be away from her children for days at a time.  However, what she likes is that she earns a good amount of money and there are also times when she can spend whole days with her children.  

A little while ago, she decided to pursue a new idea, that of going to a place, some distance from the city, where her relatives have convinced her that she can extract gold through artisanal means.  So she is hoping to enter this business in the next few weeks. 

This is the third loan between Sonia and MFP. She is happy, and and thankful that they will give her a loan with less paperwork, and especially because they will teach her how she can use her money in the best way. With the loan of 1500 soles that she is applying for, she will buy materials needed to extract gold.

loans.use: To buy materials for her new activity of artisanal gold extraction

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en: Dorah lives in Uganda. She is single and has two children, both of whom are in school. Dorah has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works seven days out of every week. Dorah sells her products at the market by means of retail. Dorah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes (shirts). She also generates additional income through poultry farming. The main business challenge(s) for Dorah include defaulters and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be a wholesaler and to build rental rooms. Dorah lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes (shirts )

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia Elizabeth reside en casa familiar con su esposo y su pequeña hija de 4 años. Para Sonia lo más importante es  su familia y es por quien trabaja duramente día con día. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para todos los géneros, gustos y preferencias. Su puesto de ropa lo tiene establecido a la orilla de la calle y frente al principal parque de la ciudad en la que vive, lugar muy estratégico ya que es muy concurrido y accesible para muchas personas. Sonia ha trabajado  duramente toda su vida para sacar adelante a su familia y sueña con poder darles una mejor calidad de vida. Ella ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de variedad de ropa tanto para caballeros como  para damas. Con el fin de mantener surtido su negocio para que los clientes siempre encuentren lo que buscan y sigan prefiriéndola y aprovechando que se encuentra en un lugar de mucho comercio. Confía en Dios y en su esfuerzo que logrará mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Sonia Elizabeth lives in the family home with her husband and young daughter, age 4. For Sonia, the most important thing is her family. She works hard every day for them. She sells clothing for all types, likes and preferences. She has established her stall on the end of a street and in front of the city's main park. This is a very strategic place because it is well-trafficked and accessible for many people. Sonia has worked hard her entire life to get her family ahead. She dreams of being able to provide them with a better quality of life. She has decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her business, in the purchase of a variety of clothing for men and women. Her goal is to keep her business stocked so that her customers always find what they are looking for, and continue to prefer her business. She trusts in God and that her hard work will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Masudi

texts.en:
Masudi is a married man who has two girls and two boys, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is the high cost of purchasing seedlings for farming.

For the past six years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling in a shop and from home to his neighbours and passersby. In addition he also operates a motorcycle business, which contributes to his other source of income. He faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in his business. Masudi dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 40,000 he wants to purchase stock of food, bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of food, bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 31 years old and married with two children between the ages of three and five. For the last three years, he has been managing a retail shop to earn a living. He also practices poultry and livestock farming to supplement his income. He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future. With the 20,000 Kenya shillings loan, he wants to buy sugar and rice for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar and rice for resale

loans.name: Joriline

texts.en: Joriline is married with two children and lives with her husband. Joriline is from barangay Lusot, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. Nora is in the retail business, operating a general store, or, as we called it in the Philippines, a sari-sari store. She has been in this industry for two years, and she earns a monthly revenue of 2,800 Philippine pesos (PHP). She is requesting a 5,000-PHP loan to buy supplementary goods to vend. She has been a member of GDMPC for a year. She is now on her second loan cycle. Joriline hopes to expand her business so she'll have more returns for the education of her children and for covering the family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Los Naranjos Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Naranjos lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Lino de 43 años quien vende frutas y verduras desde hace 5 años con unos cuantos ahorros luego empezó a prestar y su negocio ha ido creciendo. El utiliza el crédito en la compra de mercadería y especialmente en esta época que suben las ventas.
Los otros integrantes Juana Francisca de 26 años se dedica al comercio de cosméticos Avon y Francisca se dedica al comercio de frutas.
texts.en:
The “Los Naranjos” (Orange Trees) group is made up of three hardworking, entrepreneurial people. One of them is Lino, 43, who has been selling fruits and vegetables for the past five years with some of his savings. Later he started to borrow, and his business has been growing. He uses credit to purchase merchandise, especially during times when his sales increase. 

The other members of the group are Juana Francisca who is 26 and makes her living selling Avon cosmetics; Francisca makes her living selling fruits.

loans.use: to purchase harvests of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom is 43 years old. She is widowed and has five children; three of them are daughters. Making a living and supporting her family, she has been working for others for around 20 years. 

She is a leader of a six-member group. Sokhom and other members of the group are applying for a second loan with VisionFund. She wants to build a house for living in. She hopes this loan will help her to have a decent accommodation for her family.

loans.use: to build a house for living in.

loans.name: Gissela

texts.es: Gissela, de 30 años es una valerosa madre soltera. Vive en compañía de su 2 hijos: Stif y Paola en una casa alquilada, ubicada en el distrito de Palian. A pesar de estar solo, ella trabaja con ahínco para el futuro de sus hijos a los que quiere mucho. Su principal actividad económica es la  crianza de vacas a las que engorda y reproduce para después venderlos a un buen precio. Ya tiene 10 vacas y desea aumentar su ganado. Todo lo que posee, es gracias a sus padres; quienes cuidan de su ganado en su pueblo natal de Huari, donde ella viaja cada vez que pueda. Pues también tiene que cuidar de su tienda de comestibles que hace poco abrió en un espacio al quilado en la ciudad, donde vive. El motivo de mudarse son los estudios de sus hijos, pues quiere maestros de nivel y una vida más cómoda para ellos, que son su única compañía. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Huari” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Gissela de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una vaca para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Gissela is 30, and a courageous single woman. She lives with her two children, Stif, and Paola, in a rented house, located in Palian district. Despite being on her own, she works hard for her children's future, as she loves them very much.  Her main livelihood is raising cows, which she fattens and breeds, to then sell at a good price. She now has ten cows, and wants to add to her herd. 

Everything she has is thanks to her parents, who look after her cattle in her native village of Huari, where she travels whenever she can.  She also has to look after her grocery store, that she opened a little while ago in a rented space in the city where she lives. The reason she moved was her children's schooling, as she wants teachers for their level, and a more comfortable life for them, as they are her only companionship.  

She belongs to the "Huari" solidarity group, and this is her second loan with MFP.  She is hoping for your contribution, so that she can make her plans a reality. Moreover, she promises to fulfil her instalment payments. In addition, she is grateful to be part of her group, because all the members are responsible people, and very supportive.  

When she receives her loan, Gissela will use the money to buy a cow, to add to her herd.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es:
Armandina nació en el distrito de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 39 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos.
 
Armandina desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Urubamba, ella tiene una pequeña librería donde vende útiles de escritorio y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Armandina requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cuadernos, lapiceros y otras cosas más. 

Armandina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Armandina pertenece al banco comunal “Tercer Milenio” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Armandina was born in the district of Urubamba in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco and she lives in the same city where she was born. She is 39 years old and is married and from this marriage she has two children.

Armandina’s daily work takes place in the city of Urubamba. She has a little bookstore where she sells stationery and other items. She has been doing this for several years and her business is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Armandina is asking for a loan in order to buy merchandise such as notebooks, pens and other items. 

Armandina is grateful for the opportunity this loan gives her and she promises to make her payment according to the schedule. Armandina belongs to the communal bank Tercer Milenio of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as notebooks, pens and other items

loans.name: Timena

texts.en:
Timena is married. She has 8 children and she is 35 years of age.

Timena owns & operates a business venture planting & harvesting taro for sale. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Timena needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Timena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Timena's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Yndira

texts.es:
La señora Yndira, pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco, Departamento del Cusco. Es casada, tiene 31 años de edad; y tiene 3 hijos de 14, 10, 2 años de edad. 

La socia se dedica  al elaboracion de chompas, y otros tejidos que ella misma fabrica, la socia suele comprar lanas de colores, cierres, botones, tejedores de todo grozor y teje bellas chompas, chalinas, guantes, gorros de lana, saconcitos , medias entre otros. La socia reparte de forma independiente y en esta ocasion desea invertir el credito en la compra de lanas de colores y grosores, tejedores nuevos, cierres, botones. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Señora Yndira belongs to the Asociación Arariwa’s “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA” (New Light of the Morning) Communal Bank in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco. She is married, 31 years old, and has three children, ages 14, 10, and 2.

The member is engaged in making sweaters and other knitted goods. She plans to purchase dyed wool, zippers, buttons, and thread of all thicknesses. She will knit beautiful sweaters, scarves, gloves, caps, jackets, and stockings, among other things, from wool. She distributes her products independently and, on this occasion, wants to invest the loan in the purchase of dyed, thick wool, new thread, zippers, and buttons. She is thankful for the opportunity offered through this loan and, in addition promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase dyed, thick wool, new thread, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Amani  Group

texts.en:
Beda, 48 years old, is the father of three children, all attending secondary school. He has been growing maize, beans and coffee for over twelve years. He is experiencing low income due to crop diseases and lack of fertilizers.

Beda is looking for financial support to buy fertilizers and insecticides. He also has a vision to increase the scale of production from 15 to 24 acres in five years in order to earn more income to be used to pay school fees, buy clothes and cover medical expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and gum boots

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: El señor Roberto es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador que con mucho esfuerzo ha podido construir su casa desde poner los cimentos hasta construir las paredes. En este momento quiere levantar los cimientos de una recamara mas para extender la sala comedor, de esta manera el podrá ofrecer mayor comodidad a su familia. El trabaja en maquiladora como mecánico desde hace 12 años ingreso que aporta para poder sustentar los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Roberto is a very responsible and hardworking man who, through a lot of effort, has been able to build his own house, from laying the cement to building the walls.  Currently, he wants to lay the foundations for another bedroom so he can extend the dining room.  This will allow him to make his family more comfortable.  He has worked in an assembly plant as a mechanic for 12 years and he uses his income from this job to cover his household expenses.

loans.use: to buy rods

loans.name: Khom's Group

texts.en: A mother of nine children, Khom is 53 years old and a famer who lives in Battambang province. Khom has never been with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She joins a group of two to get a new loan As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed and pesticide for her crop. She hopes that she can make more money for her family.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and pesticide for her crop

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with nine children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Loreta dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: José Ramón

texts.en:
My name is Ramón H., I have a job selling products of daily consumption in the municipal market of the city. I have had this this job for two years, I depend on my loyal customers and I go out of my way to help them and give them good products and fair prices. I have two children and my wife, to whom my earnings go to, to help with expenses and food.

Descripción del Negocio: Mi nombre es Ramón H., tengo un puesto de venta de productos de consumo diario en el mercado municipal de mi ciudad, Tengo dos años de tenerlo activo por lo que cuento con mis clientes fijos ya que me preocupo por atenderles y darles buenos precios y productos. Tengo dos hijas y mi esposa por lo que los ingresos que percibimos me ayuda con los gastos y alimentación.

loans.use: Buying bottled refreshments, sausages, chicken, ham, milk, toilet paper, sugar, basic grains, milk products.

loans.name: Piedad

texts.en:
Piedad has 2 years of experiece with her business selling disenfectants for the home. She started the business thanks to the help of her son in law, who gave her the initial capital. She used to work doing housework but she fell ill, and was no longer able to continue with that job. Because she is a hardworking woman, she decided to look for a way to have her own business. People in the industry recommended that she sell disenfectants. This work has gone very well for her. She works every day of the week in her home and at her clients' homes (when asked) from 7 am till 10 pm.

Piedad would like the loan in order to invest the money in her business, since she doesn't have much capital and is thinking about promoting her products in new places.

Piedad is 58 years old. She is separated and lives with her son, who helps her with whatever she needs. She hopes to sell sweets out of her home in the future. She's had the sweets in mind and will being to offer them the moment she receives her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Piedad tiene una experiencia de 2 años con su negocio de vender desinfectantes para el hogar. Lo comenzó gracias ha la ayuda de un yerno que fue la persona que le dio el capital para comenzar. Anterior a este ella de dedicaba a trabajar en casa pero cayo enferma y no pudo seguir realizando esa labor. Pero como ella es una mujer de trabajo decide buscar la manera de cómo tener su propio negocio y por aliento de personas del sector le proponen que se dedique a la venta de desinfectantes. Esta actividad que le ha ido muy bien lo trabaja todos los días de la semana en su domicilio y también de manera ambulante cuando se lo piden en el horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m.

Piedad desea el crédito para poder invertir en su negocio ya que no cuenta con mucho capital y tiene demanda del producto y piensa a futuro poder ir a promocionar su producto en otro lugar.

Piedad tiene 58 años, está separada y vive con un hijo el que le ayuda en lo que ella necesita , a futuro espera poner en su domicilio también venta de golosinas, algo que tiene en mente y lo hará gracias a la ayuda que le brindaran al momento de otorgarle un crédito.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in the products for her business

loans.name: Chey

texts.en: Chey S. is a local landlord in Phnom Penh and she is using this loan to buy another home.  He husband works as a mototaxi driver and earns $2/day and 2 of her daughters work in a garment factory.  The households combined income is not enough to support their children in going to school, so instead they must work in the factories.  The house Chey S. will buy with this loan will be rented out to garment factory workers who come in for work from the provinces and are away from their families.  As she receives more income, she plans to buy yet another home for renting out until she has enough income to send her children to university.

loans.use: To buy a house for monthly rental

loans.name: Habil

texts.en: Habil is a 29  year old single man, and is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, settled in the Khirdalan settlement. This young man has sold building materials with his truck for 6 years. He now needs a loan of $1200 to repair the chassis of  his truck, so that he can improve his business.

loans.use: To repair the chassis of  his truck

loans.name: Tutiniso

texts.ru:
Tutiniso B. is 43 years old. She has a high-school education. She is married and has four children. Her husband works in sales. Her elder daughter is married. The other 3 are still in school. She has been working in sales for the past 12 years. At the beginning she was in the business of selling eggs. She became a client of MicroInvest back in 2003. After receiving her loan she proceeded to increase turnover, but because the number of people selling eggs increased, she chose to take her business in a different direction. Tutiniso purchased a different sales point and began selling office supplies and household goods. Currently her assets amount to $650. She is planing to increase the size of her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

Бобошеховой Тутинисо 43года, образование среднее специальное. Замужем, имеет четверых детей. Муж занимается торговлей, старшая дочь замужем остальные учатся в школе. Торговлей занимается 12лет. Раньше продавала оптом и в розницу куриные яйца. В МЗФ «Микроинвест» займ получила в 2003 году. После получения займа она расширила товарооборот, но так как продавцов в сфере куриных яиц стало больше, она перешла на другой вид бизнеса. Тутинисо приобрела другую точку торговли и стала продавать канцелярские и хозяйственные товары. Сейчас её активы возросли до 650$. В будущем планирует расширить место деятельности.

loans.use: to extend activity place

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Y. Fatma was born in the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory Gubadli region, situated in the western part of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. She is 39 years old and the mother of two children. Right now she lives with her family in Sumgayit city, situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan.

She started her business in 2000. She sells cassettes demonstrating music of local and foreign musicians. With this business, she has earned enough for only some of her family's basic needs. She has had difficulty in covering other family consumption needs for medication, clothes, school, etc.

Now, she needs $1,000 for expanding her business to buy different music discs and tapes for her shop and improving her family's living conditions. Her daughter helps her at this work. She wants to increase the number of clients and increase income. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy different things for her shop, expand her business and improve her family's living conditions

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en: Hanaa is a 49 year old widow who lives in the region of Borj El Barajneh with her four children. Hanaa sells cosmetics and accessories in her little shop. She needs a loan to buy enough merchandise to keep her business running and to continue generating revenues. Hanaa is happy to be able to sustain her business and to continuously develop it.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rhona's Group

texts.en:
Rhona N. currently rears chickens and pigs as well as makes bricks. She has an investment of 2 million shillings and makes a profit of 50,000 shillings a week (about 35 US Dollars). She raises 5 children and 3 orphans. She will use the loan to buy more chickens, pigs, and material for more bricks.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To add animals

loans.name: Kpolinon

texts.fr:
Mr. G. Kpolinon is 35 years old and resides in Tékponou. Married and a father of six children, he sells sheep for a living. He travels from market to market to sell these animals. Though this trade is profitable, he is often confronted with financial difficulties. To improve his business, he is asking for a loan of $300 to buy more animals and satisfy the his customers' demands. This will increase his sales and therefore improve his family's future.

Translated by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Agée de 35 ans, Monsieur G. Kpolinon réside à Tékponou (P/Vo). Marié et père de six enfants, il est exerce comme activité la vente des moutons. Il se déplace de marché en marché pour vendre ses bêtes. Quoique ce commerce lui soit rentable, il est souvent confronté à des difficultés financières. Pour redynamiser cette activité, il sollicite un financement de $300 afin d’acheter plus de bêtes et satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d’affaire pour un meilleur devenir de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of animals

loans.name: Lucila Nemesia's Group

texts.en:
Eulalia, Lucila, and Maria have been members of the “Virgen del Rosario” community bank for ten years. In that time, they have found great support. They have also learned to be punctual, responsible, and to save.

Eulalia is 70 years old. She is married and has two adult children. Eulalia has a store where she sells food staples, such as rice, flour, and sugar. She has owned the store for several years.

Lucila is 51 years old. She is married and has two sons. Lucila owns a bakery where she makes traditional breads, such as “chapla,” which is similar to pita. She has owned her business for many years.

Maria is 49 years old. She is divorced and has two daughters. Maria owns a restaurant. She started a small café several years ago and, six months ago, opened a much larger restaurant.

Eulalia, Lucila, and Maria need loans of 600, 300, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in their businesses by buying flour, yeast, sugar, wheat, and by buying in bulk in order to reduce the effects of expected price increases.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Eulalia, Lucila, and Maria plan to use their savings to improve their homes and pay for their children’s education. Their dreams are to own a nice home, improve their businesses, and see their children become professionals.

loans.use: Eulalia, Lucila, and Maria need loans of 600, 300, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1) to buy flour, yeast, sugar, wheat, and to buy in bulk, in order to reduce the effects of expected price increases.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi D., 49 years old, has been a member of TYM Fund since 1998. Her family includes Mrs. D., her husband, and their two grown-up children. Her main job is farming and breeding animals. Besides, she also collect recyclables and sell to earn extra money for the weekly repayments. Most of her loan is used towards buying piglets, and what left is used for recyclables collecting. Each day she earns about 3-4USD from collecting and selling recyclables. Each year she sold about 3 litters of pigs, which is about 1000USD. Her job is going smoothly and the loan is used efficiently. Mrs. D. wants to borrow 575USD to continue her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Độ, 49 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và hai con đã trưởng thành. Công việc của chị Độ là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi lợn. Sau khi vay vốn của Quỹ Tình thương, chị buôn bán phế liệu để có tiền trả tuần. Vốn vay được dùng chủ yếu cho việc mua lợn giống và một phần nhỏ dành cho thu mua phế liệu. Thu nhập hàng ngày từ thu mua phế liệu khoảng 3-4USD. Hàng năm chị cho xuất chuồng 3 lứa lợn thu nhập trên dưới 1000USD. Công việc thuận lợi và mang lại hiệu quả, vòng vốn này chị Độ xin vay 575USD để tiếp tục đầu tư vào dự án của mình.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Charity's Pendamoyo Group

texts.en:
Charity is 42 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 20 and 18. Charity is a market seller, who started in 2003. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Charity has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (rice, maize, wheat, and tomatoes) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Joyce and Tatu, who have businesses dealing in food vending and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more items (rice, maize, wheat,tomatoes) for her business.

loans.name: Vorng

texts.en:
Vorng A., 56, lives with her husband and children in Kampong Cham province. They have five children; two are married and live outside the home; two children are construction workers; one is employed by a garment factory. Vorng A. and her husband are farmers and earn a combined income of approximately one dollar per day.

This couple would like to request a loA. to purchase cow. This cow will help them plow the farmland.

loans.use: To purchase cow.

loans.name: José Andres

texts.es:
In the municipality of Esteli, Mr. Jose M. has been selling cattle for more than 30 years. This has helped him move on in his business. He's father to one son who he needs to feed and provide to his daily needs.

One of his main needs is the need to purchase cattle in order to improve his business. For this reason he went to Ceprodel and requested a loan. Not only will his business benefit from it, so will his family.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí, el caballero José M. se dedica con basta experiencia al negocio de ganadería habiéndose desempeñado en esta labor desde hace mas de 30 años lo que ha permitido que alcance gran experiencia en su negocio. Es padre de un hijo al que tiene el deber de alimentar y proporcionarle las condiciones de vida necesarias.

Una de las necesidades que hoy en día atraviesa esta caballero es que necesita invertir en la compra del ganado para su desarrollo. Por esta razón él acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario con el cual adquirir el ganado y además salir adelante con el mantenimiento de su hogar. Con el crédito se beneficia tanto él como su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Magnely

texts.es:
Malgeny is a woman who works in agriculture producing citrus and bananas which is her passion, she works to help give her kids an education. For this activity she is recognized as a woman who commits herself to this work for the wellbeing of her family, she does not leave for work with the same strength everyday. In these moments, Magleny requests a loan that she will invest in her lands, above all in the purchase of coffee plants to begin with this product in addition to the fruit, she is sure that with your support she will make progress and have a prosperous harvest and future.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Magleny es una mujer que trabaja en la agricultura y la producción de cítricos y plátanos que es lo que le apasiona, trabajo que le ayudó a brindar la educación a sus hijos. Por esta actividad es reconocida como una mujer entregada al trabajo por el bienestar de su familia, ella no deja de trabajar con la misma fortaleza todos los días.En estos momentos Magleny solicita un préstamo que invertirá en sus terrenos, sobre todo en la compra de plantas de café para iniciarse con este producto aparte de la fruta, está segura que con su ayuda podrá progresar y tener una producción prospera a futuro.

loans.use: To purchase plants for fruit production, furthermore coffee plants to begin producing this product.

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr:
Née en 1955 à Agbalépédo au TOGO, Madame A. Dopé est une revendeuse très dynamique et très dévouée. Elle a quatre personnes à charge. Son revenu mensuel ne lui permettant pas de faire face aux multiples besoins du ménage, elle sollicite un crédit pour stocker des arachides et revendre en période de soudure.

Le bénéfice issu de cette activité commerciale, lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions et niveau de vie des membres de son ménage. Le crédit qui lui sera accordé lui servira de fonds de commerce indispensable à la sécurisation de sa revenu.
texts.en:
Born in 1955 in Agbalépédo in Togo, Mrs. Dopé A. is a very dynamic and serious merchant. She is responsible for four persons. Her monthly income does not permit her to cope with the multiple expenses of the household, so she is requesting a loan to stock up on peanuts that she will re-sell when there is a shortage of that product.

The income that this commercial business will produce will allow her to improve living conditions for the members of her household. This loan will serve as indispensible business capital that will ensure that she is able to earn a living wage.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking up and sale of peanuts

loans.name: Suvada

texts.en: Suvada A. ić was born in 1963. She is from a village called Dubnica, near Kalesija. Suvada lives with her husband and 14-year-old son. Her husband has regular work, and he earns 1100 KM monthly, so they are able to pay their daily costs. But Suvada wants to earn more; she wants to have her own income. That is her reason for taking the loan in the amount of 1000 KM. She will buy chickens for fattening and reselling. Her wish is to make a small poultry farm. She hopes that she and her son will do it together in the future.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Estali

texts.es:
La señora Estali, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Cucardas II”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo. Se dedica a la venta de  productos de belleza a través de pedidos por catálogos y tiene stock en su casa. Estali vende visitando  a sus vecinos, amigos y familiares, quienes le recomiendan otros clientes, incrementando así sus ventas.
 
Con este crédito de S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará productos de belleza en oferta como perfumes para damas, caballeros y niños, desodorantes, joyas, esmaltes, lociones, etc., y productos que tienen mayor salida entre sus clientes, para ello desea tener de todo para vender con facilidades de pago y mantener a su clientela.

Estali tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su esposo y 03 de sus 05 hijos quienes son estudiantes y todavía dependen de ella. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer decidida y sobre todo muy trabajadora. Más adelante desea comprar una vitrina para exhibir sus productos, así como arreglar su casa para poner su negocio  en su propia domicilio.
texts.en:
Estali is a member of the "Las Cucardas II" community bank. She lives in the area and province of San Martin, in the district of La Banda de Shilcayo. She sells beauty products by taking orders from catalogues and she has a stock in her home. Esteli sells to her neighbours, friends, and family, all of whom recommend other clients to increase her sales.

With this loan amounting to S./800 (which will be repaid in 6 months) she will purchase beauty products that are currently on sale, such as perfumes for ladies and gentlemen, deodorants, fashion jewlery, nail polish, lotions etc, and all other products that are of great demand amoung her clientele. She wishes to be well stocked so that she will be able to sell quickly and maintain her clientele.

Estali is 49 years old and she lives with her husband and with 3 of her 5 children. They are students and they are still dependent on her. She has always proven herself to be a very strong woman and above all, very hard working. In the near future she hopes to purchase a display case to showcase her products and she also wishes to renovate her home to set up her business there.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products currently on sale, such as perfumes, nail polish, and lotions, etc.

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa K. est revendeuse de sels depuis 3 ans au grand marché d’Atakpamé, une ville située au centre du Togo. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 5 ans et souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son activité. Kossiwa est âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
For three years Kossiwa K. has been selling salt at the main market at Atakpamé, a town located in the centre of Togo. She has been involved in this activity for five years and wants to use the loan to increase the size of her business. Kossiwa is 35 years old, married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy salt for resale

loans.name: Mujeres De La Fe Group

texts.en:
Rosa B. is hoping to receive her second loan. She came to Esperanza International around 6 months ago with no job and was having a difficult time providing for her only child. She comes from a very poor city in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic.

After receiving her first loan, she started a small stand selling various types of candy and other small items. With this next loan she hopes to expand her business and sell a more varied selection of goods. Her goal is to one day have her own grocery store. She said that she has never been more happy than she is right now. She has finally found a way to have a steady income, and she also found something was all hers.

Rosa wakes up every day excited to go to her business and excited to try and improve what she has. She said she can finally provide for her child and wants to send him to a college someday. She feels like this next loan is just going to help her expand even more, and she is so excited about this opportunity!

loans.use: Buying products for her small store

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La Señora Santos es una socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, vive en la región  San Martín provincia y distrito de Moyobamba, se dedica a la venta de productos de pan llevar como plátanos, menestras, yuca verduras, Mani, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado central de la ciudad,  a donde acuden diariamente a comprar sus clientes que son los visitantes del mercado.

Con este préstamo de S/.  2 000.00 nuevos soles, que pagara en 6  meses, comprará plátanos en racimos, yuca en sacos, frijoles en sacos de diferentes variedades así como también en la compra de peluches que en esta época del año tiene buena acogida por las fiestas de fin de año. 

Santos tiene  58 años,  ella es madre de 9 hijos, ya todos son independientes, ahora vive con su esposo y uno de sus hijas quien le apoya en su negocio y acompaña a sus padres, esta agradecida por el apoyo brindado por Manuela Ramos que le permite crecer en su negocio a ella así como también a las demás mujeres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
Ms. Santos is a member of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) microfinance institute. She lives in the San Martin region of the province and district of Moyobamba. She sells produce such as plantains, legumes, cassava, vegetables and peanuts. Her business is located in the city’s central market, where her customers go everyday. With this 2,000.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase plantains by the bunch, sacks of cassava, sacks of an assorted variety of beans, and plush toys that are in demand this season because of the year-end festivities.

Santos is a 58-year-old mother with 9 children who are all independent. She now lives with her husband and one of her daughters, who helps her with the business. She is grateful for the support she has received from Manuela Ramos, which allows not only her business to grow, but also those of the other working women.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plantains, cassava, beans and plush toys

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El microempresario José Q. M. tiene 57 años de edad, es viudo con dos hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando en nivel secundario tiene una pulpería desde hace 25 años en un barrio periférico de esta ciudad de Bluefields.

Este negocio tiene la ventaja que en ese sector existen pocas pulperías lo que hace que el negocio sea bastante visitado por sus clientes que le compran productos para el consumo diario. Este negocio le ha permitido poder mantener a sus hijos ya que es el único ingreso que tiene en la actualidad. Sin embargo necesita tener variedad de productos para que sus clientes no deban comprar en otros negocios.

Para tal fin requiere se le financie para comprar los siguientes productos: 100 libras de pollo las que les toca comprar en US$ 1 dólar cada libra, 2 quintales de arroz americano que compra a US$ 56 dolares el quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar que compra a US$ 30 dolares el quintal, 2 bidones de aceite que compra a US$ 28 dolares cada bidón, 2 cajas de huevos que compra a US$ 50 dolares cada caja, 2 quintales de frijoles que compra a US$ 56 dolares el quintal y 6 cajas de jabón de lavar que compra a US$ 15 dolares cada caja .
texts.en:
Small-businessman José Q. M. is a 57 year old widow with 2 children who are studying in the second level. For 25 years, he's had a local store in an outlying neighborhood of the city of Bluefields. This business has the advantage of being one of only a few local stores, so the business is frequently visited by its clients that buy products for daily consumption. This business has enabled him to care for his children now that he is the sole wage-earner that they have. Nevertheless, he needs a variety of products for his clients so that they don't have to buy at other businesses. For such purpose, he will use the loan to buy the following products: 100 lbs of chicken which cost $1 per pound, 2 kg of American rice which cost $56 per kilogram, 2 kg of sugar which cost $30 per kilogram, 2 containers of oil which cost $28 per container, 2 boxes of eggs which cost $50 per box, 2 kg of beans which cost $56 per kilogram and 6 boxes of laundry soap which cost $15 per box.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 100 lbs of chicken, 2 kg of American rice, 2 kg of sugar, 2 containers of oil, 2 boxes of eggs, 2 kg of beans and 6 boxes of laundry soap.

loans.name: Yodgorboy

texts.en:
Yodgorboy A. is 31 years old. He lives in Isfara town. He is married and has two children. Yodgorboy processes and sells dried fruits in the central market. He is experienced in the business of processing dried fruits. He purchases dried fruits from local farmers wholesale and after processing, sells them to his customers. Because he buys his goods wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices.

Yodgorboy offers a wide assortment of goods for customers of different means. This allows Yodgorboy to make his business quite successful and it brings in a stable income for the family. Currently, he needs a loan of 550 USD to buy supplies so he can continue to offer a good product to his customers. Yodgorboy expresses his gratitude for everyone supporting him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing his range of goods

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
La señora Lucy V. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, vive en el Jr. Victoria Vásquez Nº 273, Distrito de Morales, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 33 años, y es madre de 02 hijos.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, por iniciativa propia  se inicio vendiendo refrigerios en el cafetín de un centro educativo. Tiene 04 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de Abarrotes, en un local especialmente acondicionado en su propia casa. 

Con el préstamo de S/2,000.00 que cancelara a plazo de 06 meses, lo invertirá comprando más productos, como  arroz, azúcar  en sacos, aceite, galletas dulces y saladas; conservas de pescado en cajas, fideos en paquetes, productos para aseo personal y del hogar surtir su negocio y satisfacer a su clientela.
Ella es quien maneja los gastos y ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, ahora es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Lucy, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Lucy V. C. is a member of the "Las Moralinas" community bank. She lives in the district of Morales in the department of San Martín. She is single, 33 years old and the mother of two children. With her first loan of S/.300 soles which she applied for on her own initiative, she began selling snacks in the snack bar of a school. She has been working with the bank for four years. She now sells groceries in a room she has specially set up in her own home. With this loan for S/2,000 soles which she will repay in six months, she will buy more goods such as rice, bags of sugar, oil, sweet cookies and savouries, crates of canned fish, packages of noodles, personal hygiene products and household products to stock her business and satisfy her customers. She is the person managing the expenses and revenues of her business. On a personal level, she is now a woman with a great desire to progress. Lucy is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, cookies, canned fish and personal hygiene products

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda C., 52 years of age, lives in Lao Santa Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is asking for an amount of PHP 7,000 to grow her business. She wants to make a living and at the same have fun with it.  She is comfortable raising pigs which is an advantage of doing it in her own backyard.  She said that Paglaum has been there for all her capital needs. She is positive that one day, her little business will grow.

loans.use: Additional capital for raising pigs

location.town: Plaridel-Lao Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occident

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris tiene 56 años, vive con su hija mayor en su casa propia. Trabaja día a día en la crianza de su ganado vacuno y ovino desde hace varios años atrás, pero hace un año implementó una granja de cerdos que vende periódicamente en la feria ganadera de su zona. Para tener buenas ganancias sus animales tienen que tener buen peso y esto se logra a base de una buena alimentación, por lo que pastea a sus animales todas las mañanas a una distancia de 3 horas de caminata de su casa y regresa en horas de la tarde. Para Doris esta actividad suele ser una distracción porque ella va al campo a respirar aire puro y está acostumbrada a esa rutina. Para más adelante, espera incrementar la cantidad de animales para tener mayor capital de trabajo. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, está muy dispuesta a  seguir trabajando por el bienestar de su  familia y también de los demás integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero que está solicitando es para invertirlo en la compra de más ovejas y cerdos.
texts.en:
Doris is 56 years old and lives with her oldest daughter in her own home. She has worked day to day, breeding cattle and sheep for several years, but a year ago she started a pig farm that she periodically sells in the livestock fair in her region. In order to have good earnings, her animals have to have a good weight. This is achieved through good nutrition, for which she grazes her animals every morning at a distance of 3 hours by foot from her home. She returns in the afternoon. For Doris, this activity is usually a distraction because she goes to the countryside to breathe fresh air, and she is accustomed to this routine. For the future, she hopes to increase the quantity of animals in order to have more working capital. This is the second time that Doris has had a loan with MFP. She is very determined to continue working for the well-being of her family and also of the other members of her community bank. The money the she is asking for is to be invested in the purchase of more sheep and pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and pigs

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora Alicia M. R. vive en el departamento de Ahuachapán, Dora está acompañada y tiene solo una hija de 10 años de edad, Dora tiene una venta de verduras donde posee 10 años de experiencia en este negocio, Dora obtiene buenas ventas;  ya que su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la terminal de buses de Ahuachapán, donde sus clientes la buscan por que los precios son muy buenos al igual que sus productos, Dora está solicitando este crédito por que quiere comprar variedad de verduras para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dora Alicia M. R. lives in the department of Ahuachapán. Dora is accompanied and has one ten-year-old daughter. Dora sells vegetables, which she has spent ten years working. Dora has good sales, since her business is located in the Ahuachapán bus station, where her clients look for her because her prices and products are very good. Dora is requesting this loan because she wants to buy a variety of vegetables to offer her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Alan

texts.en:
Alan A. is a tenant on a 1-hectare farm. He is 41 years old and has four children. He hopes to have his own farm someday, which is why he is working so hard to be able to pay for the school and other needs of his children. Currently, he is very busy preparing the farm for the next planting. His only wish is to have an abundant harvest to save enough money for his family's future.

He is requesting a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (or about $175 US) from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase insecticides, complete fertilizers and other farm necessities. 

CEVI helps farmers sustain their livelihood. It provides not just loans but also offers training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase insecticides, complete fertilizers and other farm necessities

loans.name: Võ Thị

texts.en:
Võ Thị H. is a 35 year-old woman living in Đô Lương. She is married and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Võ Thị makes and sells food. Her main source of income comes from selling rice products in the local community. She has been in this business for over four years and earns approximately 3000000VND a month.

In 2007, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund to expand her business.

H. is requesting a loan of 12000000 VND to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be her fourth from TYM Fund. H. plans to use revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.

loans.name: Lusiana

texts.en: Lusiana I., 28, is married with 1 children.  She has 4 years of experience in the taxi business.  She provides service to the public 6 days per week.  She has no previous loans with SPBD.  Lusiana expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Lusiana’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.  Loan will be used to renovate her home.

loans.use: Home improvement.

loans.name: Najibeh

texts.en: Najibeh is a 50-year-old married woman and mother of four children. She has been working as a home-based bag producer to help her husband satisfy the household demands. Today, Najibeh is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy a paper-packaging machine to develop her work in order to increase her income.

loans.use: Buy a paper-packaging machine

loans.name: Filifili

texts.en:
Filifili P. is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Toamua A.  She is married with four adult children. To make a living, Filifili makes and sells food. While not the only means for generating revenue, her main source of income comes from selling baked goods to the local community.  Filifili has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1000 WST a month.

Filifili joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Filifili has successfully repaid a previous loan from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  Filifili is now requesting a new loan of 1700 WST which will be used for the same reason.  The loan will be her fifth from SPBD.  Filifili plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Lide Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Lide de 47 años de edad, casada procreo  dos hijos los dos estudiantes, reside en el barrio Francisco Salazar en la capital de Managua, su esposo se desempeña como carpintero y se esfuerza para cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Vende cosméticos, ropa y zapatos desde hace ocho años, el cual inicio con dinero propio y con prestamos que Afodenic presto. Con esta solicitud e préstamo comprara cosméticos, perfumenes y ropa para incrementar las ventas y la captación de clientes nuevos. Espera lograr ganancias y poder sastifacer las necesidades de su casa, a si como poder terminar de construir su casa, ya tiene una parte construida pero va poco a poco ya que todo esta caro pero afuturo espera lograr terminarla y cosar de una casa digna. tambien  apoyar a sus hijos para que sean hombres de bien.

loans.use: Comprar cosmeticos, perfumenes y ropa

loans.name: Leyla

texts.es:
Leyla es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Caña”  que esta ubicado de el distrito de Plateria, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 21 años de edad, estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos y estudio educación superior incompleta (Administración de empresas), vive en Plateria.

Leyla trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de lanas de diferentes colores. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de lana de alpaca y acrílica de diferentes colores para la elaboración de artesanías ella se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir como chompas, chalecos, chalinas, etc.

Su mayor sueño es terminar su carrera.
A ella le gustan los ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos
texts.en:
Leyla is a member of the “Señor de la Caña” Communal Bank, located in the Plateria district of the Puno province, department of Puno. She is a 21-year-old sing woman with no children who lives in Plateria. She has not yet finished her degree in Business Administration. Leyla has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 2 years. She used her initial loan, in the amount of 300.00 PEN, to purchase wool of various colors. At this time, she is requesting a 500.00 PEN loan to purchase alpaca wool and acrylic yarn in different colors so that she can make her handicrafts. She weaves clothing, such as sweaters, vests, scarves, etc. for a living.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase acrylic and alpaca yarn

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
“Exert more efforts and have more patience to survive in the midst of crisis” said Marites F. of Barangay Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Alejandro and they were blessed with four children who are now studying in the elementary level. They wanted them to finish their studies so that they will not follow their poor living experiences.  

Despite of the hardships of life, Marites remains strong and continuous in persevering for the betterment of her family living. Farming is their primary source of income, they till their land twice a year by planting rice and some vegetables. Furthermore, Marites is engaged in the buy and sell business of coconut in their village. She wanted to borrow loan from KIVA lenders for the maintenance of her business.  She hopes to avail the amount of PHP10, 000 as additional business capital for she believes that this amount will make a way for business improvement.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul has been a mechanic in Naivasha town for two years now. He is 25 years old and still single. Paul was introduced to KADET by his friend. This will be his first loan and he is planning to buy more tools for his garage. Paul’s future dream is to buy a piece of land and build houses for rent in Naivasha, a fast-growing town. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more tools for his garage

loans.name: Charles Ooko

texts.en: Charles is married to Pascaline and they have two children: Frodito and Elvins. Charles was introduced to KADET through existing clients and he has no previous credit history. He has been in the tailoring business for nine years. He will use this loan to add to his stock of fabric as this time of the year the demand is high due to the festive season. Charles' place of business is situated in an open air market where many customers get their produce. With the extra profits, he would like to make ready-made clothes and enter into the wholesale market. Charles' dream is to own his own house; he believes he is hardworking. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add fabric stock to his tailoring business

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon D. is a 63-year-old entrepreneur from Norala, South Cotabato.  Her main source of living is managing a sari-sari (retail) store.  She also sells dried fish and various foods.  She is the mother of six children.  She would like to request a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., in the amount of 8,000 PHP to buy supplies for her business.

loans.use: Groceries and dried fish

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita E. is from the town of Alicia, Isabela. She is 47 years old, is married, and has three adult children.

Lolita owns and operates a business providing photography services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

Lolita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Charles Ojango

texts.en:
Charles Ojango A. is a carpenter who is married and has three children. He operates a woodworking shop in rural Kenya. He has been in business for the last ten years and has two employees. While Charles faces strong competition from similar businesses, he describes himself as hardworking and dedicated.

Charles wishes to use a loan of 20,000 KES to buy wood to make more furniture such as beds and chairs. His goal is to have electrically-powered woodworking machines like routers and sanders. In the future he would like to open two new workshops.

loans.use: Purchase wood to make more tables, beds and wall units.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 36 años, vive con sus tres hijos de 13, 11 y 9 años en su casa propia.
Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a diferentes oficios, es por ello que se acostumbró al trabajo duro. Hace 5 años optó por algo que le gusta realizar y que además le brinda buenos ingresos, la preparación de “ceviche” (platillo peruano muy popular a base de pescado y limón), negocio con el cual alcanza buenas ventas gracias a la gran demanda de este rico platilllo. 
Alejandrina vende en uno de los mercados más concurridos de su zona, lo hace desde tempranas horas en la mañana hasta promediarse las 2 ó 3 de la tarde, tiempo en el cual se acaba todo lo que prepara. Adicionalmente tiene un restaurante en su propia casa, al cual se dedica sólo sábados y domingos.

Este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete ser muy puntual en los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más ingredientes para preparar sus ricos platillos, además de mejorar algunos muebles de su restaurante para captar más clientela.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 36 years old, she lives with her three children, 13, 11, and 9 years of age, in her own house.Since she was very young she has had different occupations and therefore she is used to hard work. 5 years ago she decided to do what she likes the most and what provides good income: the preparation of "ceviche" ( a popular Peruvian dish made with fish and lemon). With this business she has had good sales thanks to the demand of this delicious dish.

Alejandrina sells at one of the most popular markets of the area from early in the morning until 2 or 3 p.m. when all the food has been sold out. She also has a restaurant at home where she works Saturdays and Sundays.´

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to repay punctually. With the requested money she will buy more ingredients for the preparation of her delicious dishes as well as modernize her restaurant in order to increase the number of customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Amélie

texts.fr: Née le 09 Septembre 1966, A. Amélie réside depuis sept ans au quartier Zogbo à Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin. Amélie est mariée à ANADI Dominique, un professeur de sport, et vit ensemble avec lui. Le couple n’a pas encore d’enfant. Le mari de Amélie assure surtout les charges de la famille ; mais Amélie lui vient parfois en aide grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Il y a environs 4 ans que Amélie s’est lancée dans la vente de charbon et de fagots de bois à son domicile. Amélie vend également des œufs, ce qui lui permet de diversifier ses sources de revenus. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Amélie s’approvisionne. Amélie a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. La clientèle de Amélie s’accroît au jour le jour ; et Amélie n’arrive pas à la satisfaire parce que les moyens financiers dont elle dispose sont faibles.
