Mrs. M. already owns two cows, and she sells cow's milk door-to-door in her locality.

Now she is asking for her fifth loan of Rs30000 to buy another young cow, because demand for milk is constantly increasing in the area, because people believe fresh cow milk is better for nutrition than dairy milk.

loans.use: To buy another young cow

loans.name: Hamida's Group

texts.en:
Hamida N. wants to expand her stock by adding more chickens and goats to her business (she only has a few she is rearing at the moment). She expects to build a Kraal for her goats and a poultry house for her chicks. She currently raises her animals in a small room in her house. This will expand her business and her income as well.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To expand her goat herd

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama J. is 46 years old, and married with 4 children. Mariam started her business 10 years ago and with the loans from SMT, she has been able to expand her business. She sells her goods in Kabala town in Sierra Leone.

Before receiving the loans, Mariama used to purchase 2 to 5 bags of peanuts. But with the loans, she can purchase 30 bags of peanuts at a time, and sell them wholesale. Her customer base has also increased so much that Mariama is requesting a loan of $1200 to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: Purchase more peanuts to keep up with the growing number of customers

loans.name: Emeldina

texts.es:
Emeldina is 33 years of age, a single woman and has been working for 10 years selling natural medicines. The business is in her home, where she offers curative medicines in the form of tablets, tea, powders, creams to treat the body, or medicinal plants that alleviate inconveniences and cure common illnesses such as problems of the skin, acne, rheumatisms, and constipation, among others. The great majority of her clients have a lot of confidence in natural medicines. Besides that, they are easy and economic medicines to find. . At the same time Emeldina delivers merchandise such as clothes and shoes to people that trust her. In this manner she has been able to do well and to maintain a healthy business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Emeldina tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la venta de medicamentos naturales, el negocio lo tiene en su vivienda, en la cual ofrece medicamentos curativos, ya sea en pastillas, te, polvo, cremas para sobar el cuerpo, o plantas medicinales que alivian molestias y curan enfermedades comunes como problemas de la piel, acne, reumas, estreñimientos entre otras. La gran mayoría de sus clientas tienen mucha confianza a los medicamentos naturales, además que son medicinas económicas y fáciles de encontrar. . Al mismo tiempo Emeldina entrega mercadería varias como ropa y zapatos a personas que le encargan, de esta manera es como ha podido salir adelante y mantener activo su negocio.

loans.use: To buy natural medicines, clothes, and shoes for ladies.

loans.name: Hariyono

texts.id:
Hariyono is a bread vendor who has to travel 3 km from his home to sell bread. He does all this for his family. He lives with his wife and 2 year old child. He rents a 100 sq feet room for $11 per month. The rising costs of ingredients have affected his profit somehow. In the past he can sell 100 packs, now he can only make 80 packs to avoid big loss. He makes about $4.4 to $5.5 per day. It is barely enough to pay rent and daily needs. He hopes loan from DINARI may increase his business.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Hariyono adalah seorang penjual Roti yang setiapharinya harus menempuh perjalanan sekitar 3 kilometer dari tempat tinggalnya. Usaha ini dia lakukan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Tinggal bersama istri dan anak yang berumur dua tahun ini mengontrak sebuah kamar yang berukuran 3x3 meter dengan membayar uang sewa sebesar 100.000/bulannya. Menurutnya naiknya harga bahan pokok makanan mempengaruhi usahanya berjualan roti, kalau dulu dia bisa menjual sampai 100 bungkus sekarang harus dibatasi 80 bungkus untuk menghindari kerugian yang besar. Keuntungan yang didapat Hariyono berkisar antara 40.000 – 50.000/harinya. Cukup untuk ditabung membayar uang sewa kamar dan kebutuhan setiaphari. “Sekarang kan saya mendapatkan bantuan modal dari DINARI kiranya ini dapat meningkatkan usaha saya dalam berjualan roti”. ungkapnya.

loans.use: Purchase Ingredients

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
A small entrepreneur from Mikhailovka, Irina owns a business selling gifts and lampstands in a local mall called “Torgovyi Dom” (Trade House). She is a married mother of two daughters and a son. Irina has a nice selection of inventory that is trendy and affordable, too. She has been in the trade for 12 years. Currently, she has about $3400 in inventory.

Irina is an experienced entrepreneur. She has tried working in different business spheres. However souvenir sales became a niche that Irina chose for herself. Irina is an outstanding example of a perseverant and focused high-achiever. She can balance family and business and manage her time very effectively. Today Irina is requesting a loan to stock her vending place with new merchandise. We believe all her positive qualities will help Irina repay the current loan and achieve her goals.

loans.use: Irina would like to grow her business selling gifts, lamp stands and souvenirs.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en: Ernestina A. owns a provision store. She is married and has 2 children. Business is going very well, so Ernestina wishes to increase sales and improve her income. However, she is running out of stock. So she is asking for a loan to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim C., 42, has the biggest stall in the village selling groceries. She just started doing this business in 2007. Her revenue is about $20 each day. Her husband Mr. Chin Chea sells fish in large amounts in the market in the village. This couple has four children, two of whom are married and live away from home, while one is a garment worker and the other is a construction worker and live at home.

Because the children sometimes spend money on a motor taxi to get to and from work, Kim would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.use: Kim would like to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Lucero, Judith And Teresa Group

texts.en:
Lucero, Judith, and Teresa are members of the Suni Village Bank. (Suni meaning “Secure” in Quechua).

Lucero is an unmarried twenty-one year old woman. Lucero sells many different types of men´s pants that she acquires in Lima and in different markets of the city of Ayacucho.

Judith is a twenty-five year old mother of one son. Judith makes “roasted milk,” a dessert of fresh milk and eggs) with a rented oven. She sells them to different stores.

Teresa is a thirty-one year old mother of two children. Teresa buys firewood from suppliers and sells the firewood from her home.

Lucero, Judith and Teresa need respective loans of 600, 300 and 900 Peruvian Nuevo Soles to invest in more pants, milk, sugar and firewood to further expand their businesses.

Lucero, Judith and Teresa´s dreams include having their own grocery and clothing store and providing a good education for their children.

loans.use: To purchase pants, milk, sugar and firewood to further expand their businesses.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr:
Madame B. Jeannette est née en 1956 à Agomé-Tomégbé. N’ayant pas eu la chance de faire de brillantes études, elle a embrassé le Commerce de céréales et de fruit. En faisant ce commerce, elle voulait se procurer de revenu et a mis un accent particulier sur la vente de fruits et de céréales.
 Mariée et mère de six (06) enfants, elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille grâce à son revenu minimum. Très dévouée et sage dans ses réactions, elle gère bien ses activités et 
sollicite un financement qui pourra lui permettre d’agrandir son stock de céréales et de fruit
et par conséquent augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Jeannette B. was born in 1956 in Agomé-Tomégbé. Having lacked the opportunity to really shine in school, she embraced commerce in grain and in fruit. By working in commerce, she wanted to have an income and has focused on fruits and grains. Married and the mother of six, she manages to provide for her family's needs thanks to her minimum income. A very devoted woman who is wise in her reactions, she manages her business well and is requesting financing that will enable her to enlarge her stock of grain and fruit. This would then increase her sales figures to help more with improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell fruit and grain

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sat B. (in the middle with her daughters and grandchild), 56, is a widow with four daughters. Her oldest daughter is a fruit seller. She is married but still lives with Mrs Sat in their family home. Mrs Sat's three other daughters are garment factory workers. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sat has been selling clothes for twenty years. She buys secondhand clothes from the market in Phnom Penh for resale in her village and nearby villages. Currently, her eldest daughter (shown in the picture on the left) sells fruit in Phnom Penh and she needs a motor trailer to help carry her goods.

Thus, Sat is requesting a $600 loan to purchase a motor trailer for her daughter to carry fruit to sell at the market in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To purchase a motor trailer for her daughter selling fruits.

loans.name: Iris Beltzy

texts.es: Doña Iris es casada, y con dos hijos que son unos hermosos gemelos de un año y medio, tiene 30 años y habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama El Riguero, su esposo es comerciante y vende en los departamentos cosméticos y perfumes. También ella vende en su casa cosméticos, gaseosa y golosinas, lleva once años en las ventas, empezó desde muy joven vendiendo con su mamá, pero después de algún tiempo decidió independizarse. Con la solicitud de préstamos es para invertir en la compra de productos como cosméticos y golosinas. Sus planes son aumentar el inventario y así poder montar una pulpería para solidificar su negocio y que este sea más formable. Espera poder contar siempre con trabajo para asegurar el futuro de sus pequeños ya que desea darles una vida, ylo más importante poder darles estudios.
texts.en:
Iris is married with two children, beautiful twins that are a year and a half old. Iris is 30 years old and lives in a neighborhood of Managua called El Riguero. Her husband is a businessman, selling cosmetics and perfumes. Also, she has sold cosmetics, soda, and candy from her house for the past 11 years. She started her business when she was very young with her mother, but later she decided to go out on her own. The purpose of this loan is to invest in the purchase of products like cosmetics and candy. Her plans are to increase her inventory so she can always work and secure a future for her small sons that she wishes to give lives to, and most importantly, education.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and candy

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đào tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000. Trước đây  kinh tế gia đình chị rất khó khăn do các con còn nhỏ vợ chồng chị buôn bán ở chợ thu nhập thấp. Sau 8 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn về đầu tư vào buôn bán và trồng cây cảnh đến nay kinh tế gia đình chị đã có nhiều đổi thay. Hiện nay thu nhập từ buôn bán, trồng cây cảnh đạt 2,5triệu/tháng N.ài ra gia đình chị còn có một vườn cây cảnh trị giá gần 100 triệu đồng.
 Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay  9 triệu đồng để đầu tư vào buôn bán và kinh doanh cây cảnh
texts.en:
Mrs. Dao Thi N. joined the TYM fund in 2000. Before, the family faced many financial difficulties because their children were still small, and their business made little revenue. After 8 years of borrowing money from the fund and cleverly investing it in bonsai, her family’s finance improved much. Now, income from selling bonsai reaches 2,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. Besides, the family possesses a bonsai garden, worth 100,000,000 Vietnamese Dong. Mrs. N. plans to make the next loan of 9,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to expand the business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en:
Faustino is a member of the Huascahura Village Bank. Faustino is 62 years old and married with seven children. Faustino buys horses in different regional villages. He travels for 10 to 15 days at a time until he has acquired enough horses, which he then brings to the city of Huancayo to sell. Faustino needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy more horses. Faustino’s dreams are for his children to go to school, to build his own home, and to progress with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Faustino es socio del Banco Comunal Huascahura. Faustino es casado, tiene 62 años y 7 hijos, Faustino se dedica a la compra de ganado equino que compra de los diferentes pueblos de la región, Faustino viaja durante 10 a 15 días hasta reunión la cantidad suficiente de ganado, luego lo transporta a la ciudad de Huancayo en donde lo comercializa.

Faustino necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado equino. Los sueños de Faustino son que sus hijos estudien, construir su casa y progresar en su negocio.

loans.use: Buy horses for re-sale

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. is thirty-two years old and married with three sons, who are all in elementary school. She lives with the family in a mining and farming dominated town called Bibiani in the Western Region. Felicia’s husband is a commercial driver in the Bibiani Township.

Felicia enjoys trading very much. She owns a provision shop in which she sells groceries such as milk, milo, sugar, biscuits, bread as well as other food items. She has been in business for five years. Felicia also sells minerals such as Coca-Cola and Fanta. She says that she procures most of her goods from the big cities nearby.

Felicia is in the process of expanding her business. She has acquired a bigger store by the main road where she hopes to make very good sales. Felicia wants to use the loan to complete work on the new shop and also procure goods in large quantities to stock both shops. She hopes to run the two shops concurrently by seeking a helping hand. She is in the Genesis Trust Bank group. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To complete work on her shop and procure groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary O. is the 36-year-old married mother of six boys and two girls, two of whom are in senior high school while the rest attend basic and elementary schools. The entire family lives in a rented room in Offinso, a farming and commercial community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Her husband is a farmer who cultivates cassava, plantains, etc., while Mary has sold cassava in the local market square for the last 12 years to help support the family. Her customers are mostly restaurant operators who use the cassava to pound ‘fufu,’ a pounded cooked cassava and plantain dish served hot with soup.

Mary procures the cassava from the farmers in the surrounding villages, and she is now requesting a loan to buy the vegetable on a larger scale in order to increase her customer base and profit margin. It is her dream to ultimately send her children to university.

loans.use: To buy cassava in bulk

loans.name: Mirta

texts.en:
Mrs. Mirta R. is married and she has four children. Her business is located in the Abasto Municipal Market, a highly commercial district, where she rents a small space. She started her business with an initial investment of 1,000,000 Guaranis, or approximately US$ 180. She began by selling clothing door-to-door and as time passed, her business grew and she obtained a large number of customers, and eventually was able to begin renting her own space.

Mrs. R. will use her loan to purchase new merchandise for the spring/summer season, which has just begun. She needs to replenish her stock in order to satisfy all of her customers, who have already placed their orders for the season.

One of Mrs. R.’ aspirations is to open her own store. By refurbishing her home she would be able to grow her business as she would be able to add the appropriate furniture and create a more comfortable environment for her customers.

loans.use: purchase of clothing for the spring and summer season

loans.name: Amarilis

texts.es:
La señora Amarilis T. D. L., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, vive en el Jr. Sucre Nº 354, Distrito D. Morales, departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 53 años y es madre D. 02 hijos.

Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 que fue por iniciativa propia, inició vendiendo productos,  pensión D. comida a estudiantes y alquiler D.  cuartos. Tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad se dedica a la Venta D. cosméticos, como talcos, colonias refrescantes, Shampoo, cremas que los compra por catálogos a pedido D. sus clientes etc.
 
Con el préstamo D. S/1,500.00 a plazo D. 06  meses, comprará más cosméticos y una vitrina para  exhibir sus productos. Ella es quien toma las decisiones en las ganancias D. su negocio, se siente más segura al ofrecer sus productos, se considera una mujer luchadora, constante y responsable con el pago D. sus cuotas.

Amarilis, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Ms. Amarilis T. D. L. is a member of the “Las Moralinas” Microfinance Institute. She lives in the district of Morales, in the department of San Martín. She is a 53-year-old married mother of 2 children.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan, which she obtained on her own initiative, she started selling products, offering meals to students, and renting out rooms. She has been working with the institute for 2 years.

She currently sells cosmetics, such as talcum powder, body splashes, shampoo, and lotion by catalog to her customers.

With this 1,500.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 6 monthly installments, she will purchase more cosmetics and a glass display case for her products. She is the decision-maker in her business, which makes her feel more comfortable when selling her products. She considers herself to be a hardworking and persevering woman who is responsible with her payments.

Amarilis expresses her gratituD. to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow both as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more cosmetics and a glass display case

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy products and implement her food sales business

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena T. is divorced with four children and operates a chop bar in Siwdo. She is an experienced businesswoman and has been in business since 1992.  Helena uses her income to pay for her family’s needs, especially school fees and bills.  She will use this loan to purchase additional ingredients which she will then use to prepare the food she sells at her chop bar.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Helena plans to continue to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients used to prepare food for a chop bar

loans.name: Progreso Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de señoras sencillas, trabajadoras que se unieron con el fin de alcanzar un crédito para uso e inversión en sus oficios, ellas  poseen las ganas de trabajar en grupo, tienen  espíritu emprendedor y por sobre todo las ganas de progresar conjuntamente es por eso que  unieron  con el propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida en lo personal, familiar y en sus negocios, atravez de la formación de un grupo solidario en donde están  dispuestas a ayudarse, de esta forma las señoras asumen una responsabilidad  de manera conjunta,.- Algunas Señoras se le otorgara un crédito de 500.000 gs. Otras 300.000 gs.

Las integrantes del grupo son: 

Rogelia M. - 	Macatera vta de ropas
Karen Griselda V. - 	Macatera vta. De ropas usadas
Lucida M.	 - Almacén
Ignacia E. - 	Macatera vta. De utensilios, mercaderías
Lorenza G.- 	Venta de Frutas y Verduras
Saturnina N. - 	Vendedora Ambulante de mandioca
Antonia C.	- Almacen
Gregoria M.  - 	Vendedora de queso y miel
Maxima C. - 	Vendedora ambulante De Verduras
Maria Marlene R.	- Vta. De frutas y verduras
Liduvina L.	- Vta. de Gallina
Justine C.	  - Vat. De gallina
Rosalie C.	 - Copetín
Claudia E.	 - Despensa, Almacen
Gloria R. E.  - 	Almacén y vta. de verduras
Arminda G.	 - Despensa
Maura Andresa M. - 	Merceria
Silvina Rolón	 - Vendedora ambulante de menudencias
texts.en:
This group of working women have come together with the objective of obtaining a loan to invest in their respective businesses. The women benefit from the collective spirit of hard work and above all the desire to achieve success together. This is why they've come together to improve their personal, family and professional situations through the formation of a group. The women support each other and share responsibility for the loan together. Some of the women will receive 500gs and others 300gs. The members of the group are: Rogelia M. - Clothing sales Karen Griselda V. - Clothing sales Lucida M. - General store Ignacia E. - General store Lorenza G.- Sales of fruits and vegetables Saturnina N. - Door to door sales of cassava Antonia C. - General store Gregoria M. - Sales of cheese and honey Maxima C. - Door to door vegetable sales Maria Marlene R. -Sales of fruits and vegetables Liduvina L. - Sales of chickens Justine C. - Sales of chickens Rosalie C. - Sales Claudia E. - General store Gloria R. E. - Vegetable shop Arminda G. - Shop Maura Andresa M. - Shop Silvina Rolón - Sales

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell and grow their respective businesses, including fruits, vegetables, chickens,  cheese, as well as other household items

loans.name: Sakin Muhammad Sarwar Group

texts.en:
Sakina Baji operates a tailoring business. She sews clothes to pay off the utilities. Her husband, M. S., runs a grocery shop in the community.  They have lived in the historical site of Yadgar in Lahore, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Sakina Baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband's grocery shop.
Rasoolan Baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her dairy business. 
Razia Baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).
Nadia Baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.
Hamidan Baji and Razia Baji each want a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell.
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery store

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina, a sus 35 años ha tenido que pasar por muchos sacrificios para mantener a sus 3 hijos; Yuseling de 14, Arturo de 12 y Fernando de 3 años, vive en su casa propia y desea mejorar su vida. A lo largo de su vida ha trabajado mucho para brindarle a su familia las comodidades necesarias, actualmente está en el negocio de la venta de comida, vende salchipollo (comida rápida hecha con salchichas y pollo frito) por las noches en el mercado Santa Bárbara (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), al cual concurren todos sus clientes en busca de algo sabroso para comer. A Marina le gusta mucho trabajar con comida, aunque siempre le es difícil y le demora preparar todo lo necesario para la noche. Ya lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y espera que en el futuro su negocio crezca y pueda tener un restaurante, de esa manera mejorará sus ingresos y le dará una vida más digna a su familia. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y tiene mucha confianza en que podrá pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy tranquila y disfruta de trabajar en equipo con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para preparar una mayor cantidad de salchipollos y así incrementar sus ventas diarias.
texts.en:
Marina, 35, has made many sacrifices to support her three children; Yuseling, 14; Arturo, 12; and Fernando, 3. She lives in her own house, and she wants to improve her life. She has worked hard throughout her life to give her family the necessary comforts. She currently sells food. In the evenings she sells “salchipollo” (fast food made from sausages and fried chicken) in the Santa Bárbara market (important market in the city of Juliaca). The business is popular with her customers who are looking for something delicious to eat. Marina really likes working with food, even though it is always difficult and time consuming preparing everything for the evening. She has been doing this for twenty years. She hopes that in the future her business grows, and she will be able to have a restaurant. That way she will improve her income and give a more decent life to her family. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She has a lot of confidence that she will be able to make her payments on time. In her community bank she is secure, and she enjoys working as a team with her colleagues. With a loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy more ingredients to prepare a greater quantity of salchipollos. This will increase her daily sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for her “salchipollo” (fast food made from sausages and fried chicken)

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta L., 39, is married with six children. She has one year of experience in her pancake business. She sells to the school and villagers four days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala. She has no previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Ruta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, a frying pan, baking powder, a filter, spoons and forks

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
D. Nguyễn Thị (1405030151) is a 51-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has six adult children.

D. owns and operates a manufacturing business, primarily manufacturing and selling mattresses to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in this business for over seventeen years and earns approximately 2,200,000 VND a month.

In 2003, D. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

D. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 7th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Ahmatchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Ахматчон Чурабоев мужчина 53 лет,образование среднее,женат и имеет четырех детей.Его жена Суюдиева Мухаббат присматривает по хозяйству и её основным делом является присматривать за скотом,которых покупает ей её муж.Ахматчон любит своё дело,которым занимается больше 20 лет.Узнав про нашу организацию, эта семья став нашим клиентом, купила дойную корову на первый займ.С тех пор они работают с нами благодарны нам за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Ahmatchon C. is a 53-year-old man with secondary education. He is married and has four children. His wife, Muhabbat Suyudieva, looks after the household. Her primary task is to take care of the livestock that her husband buys for her. Ahmatchon loves his business, which he has been involved in for over 20 years. Having learnt about our organization, this family became our client and purchased a dairy cow with the first loan. They have been working with us since then and are grateful to us for the financial support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
María tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos de 22 y 10 años de edad en el centro poblado Saltur, en el distrito de Zaña, ubicado a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de cinco años ella maneja un pequeño negocio de venta de comida al paso; todas las tardes ,a las cuatro en punto, sale con su mesa a vender champús (una bebida hecha a base de maíz) y sánguches a una esquina cercana al lugar en donde vive; los productos que vende son muy solicitados por los vecinos del lugar que rápidamente consumen todo lo preparado para el día.

Su esposo es ayudante en el camal del lugar y con lo que ganan tratan de sacar adelante a su familia, pero esto no es suficiente para solventar sus gastos económicos así que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por pirmera vez a nuestra institución un crédito de 500 nuevos soles, los cuales piensa utilizar en la compra de un carrito sanguchero para ampliar sus negocio con la venta de hamburguesas y así sostener mejor la economía de su hogar.

Ella desea brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y poder brindarle algún tipo de estudio superior, en Saltur, ella es muy querida y estimada por sus vecinos los cuales la toman por una mujer responsable y activa.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two children (ages 22 and 10) in the central village of Saltur in the district of Zaña, located 40 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past 5 years, she has managed a small business selling fast food. Every afternoon around 4pm, she sells champús (a beverage made from corn) and sandwiches from her corner stand located near her home. Her products are frequently requested by the locals every day and are consumed rapidly as soon as she prepares them.

Her husband works in a slaughterhouse as an assistant and tries to support his family with his income, but it is not enough to cover all of their expenses. For this reason, María is seeking her first loan from our Institution in the amount of 500 soles. She plans to purchase a food cart so that she can expand her business by selling hamburgers and earn more money to sustain her household.

María wants to give her children a better quality of life and provide them the opportunity to pursue higher education in Saltur. She is loved and respected by her neighbors and considered to be a responsible and industrious woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a food cart for selling hamburgers

loans.name: Alma Alexandra

texts.es: La señora Alma Alexandra es casada, vive con sus 2 hijos y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo el señor Marco Antonio  quien labora para una empresa como asistente de gerencia desde hace 2 años, ellos tiene un negocio en casa  que su giro es de un ciber café de nombre “ San Isidro “donde tienen un total de 5 computadoras; las renta por horas a todos los estudiantes y personas que deseen utilizarlas, con tal negocio ellos están solicitando este crédito para la compra de teclados y otros tipos de accesorios para las computadoras ya que desean ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
La señora Alma Alexandra es casada, vive con sus 2 hijos y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo el señor Marco Antonio quien labora para una empresa como asistente de gerencia desde hace 2 años, ellos tiene un negocio en casa que su giro es de un ciber café de nombre “ San Isidro “donde tienen un total de 5 computadoras; las renta por horas a todos los estudiantes y personas que deseen utilizarlas, con tal negocio ellos están solicitando este crédito para la compra de teclados y otros tipos de accesorios para las computadoras ya que desean ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Mrs. Alma Alexandra is married and lives with her two sons and is supported by her husband Marco Antonio. He has worked in a business as the assistant manager for the last 2 years. She has a cyber cafe business at home named "San Isidro" where she has 5 computers that she rents hourly to students and people who want to use them. She is requesting a loan for her business to buy keyboards and other types of computer accessories so she can offer better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy computer accessories (invest in her business)

loans.name: Moudjibatou

texts.fr: E. Moudjibatou est née le 13/06/1959 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Moudjibatou est mariée à LAWANI Affissou Lay, un commerçant. Ce couple a à sa charge cinq enfants dont quatre sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis quatre ans à Donatin, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Moudjibatou vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Moudjibatou vend des bijoux en gros à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. C’est en CHINE que Moudjibatou va acheter ses bijoux. Moudjibatou a déjà trois ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Moudjibatou a déjà eu trois crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour continuer à développer son activité, Moudjibatou demande un quatrième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
E. Moudjibatou was born on March 13, 1959 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin.  She is married to LAWANI Affissou Lay, a shopkeeper.  This couple has five children to support.  Four of them are their own.  For four years, the family has been residing in Donatin, a district of Cotonou.  Thanks to the income from her business, Moudjibatou comes to her husband's aid in covering family expenses.  Moudjibatou sells jewelry wholesale at Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace in Benin.  She goes to China to purchase her jewelry.  She already has three years of experience in this business.  She had three loans with ALIDé before and has repaid them.  She was able to use them to raise her level of business.  To continue to develop her business, Moudjibatou is asking for a fourth loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry

loans.name: Sophia Achando

texts.en:
Sophia is married to Wycliffe and they have four children: Joyce, Shawyne, Victoria and Blessings.

Sophia has been in the clothing material business for five years. She was introduced to KADET through existing groups and she has no previous credit history. Sophia will use the loan to increase the stock of materials as the demand is higher than she can currently accomodate with existing materials.

The client's area of business is within an estate occupied by middle level residents, her customers are house occupants in the estate. With the extra profits  Sophia plans to purchase a sewing machine.

Sophia's hopes are to own a clothing material shop as she believes she is hardworking and focused.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: The loan will be used to increase the stock of materials for Sophia's clothing material business

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa T. wants a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to pay school fees and other school-related charges for his children. Musa is thirty-six years old and married to a businesswoman. They have five children, three of whom are in secondary schools and two in primary schools.

loans.use: Pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Sok Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey S. is the group leader of her four-member loan group. The members all live in Ta Press Village in TaK. Province. 

Mrs. Srey S. grows rice on a piece of land that she owns. However, the soil in her field is infertile, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crops more productive. Her husband, Mr. Din Sam Art, breeds ducks. Mrs. Srey S. is 35 years old and the mother of three children who attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes S. is from the town of Alicia, Isabela. She is 25 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Lourdes operates a restaurant, serving lunch foods to customers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately Php 3,000 a month. In 2009, Lourdes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. She is requesting a loan of Php 5,000 which will be used to add other menus to her restaurant business. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To add other menus to her restaurant business

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Nuestro socio JAIME tiene 46 años, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Sus hijos son: George y Javier estudian en la escuela de oficiales de policía y Darwin y Caty estudian en colegio. El socio es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

El socio tiene su empresa de transportes de turismo tiene tres carros y hace el servicio al Valle sagrado de los Incas. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de los carros y comprar repuestos como accesorios y lubricantes.           
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member, JAIME, is 46 years old, married and has four children. His children are: George and Javier, who study at the police academy; and Darwin and Caty, who are still in school. He is a native of the city of Cusco, and belongs to the ‘RICCHARY CUSCO” cooperative bank of the Arariwa Association. He has a business that involves tourist transportation. He has three cars and services the Sacred Valley of the Incas. He has had the business for several years now, and things have gone very well given the amount of effort he puts forth in his work. He is a hardworking entrepreneur, who helps his family get ahead. This member requires a loan in order to maintain his vehicles and to buy supplies such as auto parts and motor oil. He is very grateful for the opportunities presented him via this medium, and likewise commits to make his loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain his vehicles and to buy supplies such as auto parts and motor oil.

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
Abelardo tiene 41 años, vive con su esposa Juana y sus 3 hijos, en su casa propia.
Gracias a que logró comprar un motocarro trabaja brindando servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su localidad, pues es un lugar donde los autos no ingresan fácilmente, porque no hay pistas asfaltadas. Esta labor es dura, ya que muchas veces el motocarro sufre más de lo debido en este terreno, felizmente la demanda es buena, ya que mucha gente necesita movilizarse, siendo los motocarros el transporte preferido.
Por otro lado, Abelardo agradece los buenos ingresos que obtiene, ya que con ellos puede mantener a su familia.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual y responsable con cada uno de los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita refaccionará su motocarro, que como mencionamos se desgasta más rápido en este tipo terreno.
texts.en:
Abelardo is 41 years old, and lives with his wife Juana and their 3 children in their own house.

Since he was able to buy a motocarro (a 3-wheeled light truck), he has been providing passenger transport in his area, as it is a place where cars can't travel easily because there are no paved roads. This is hard work, since his truck suffers more than it should in this terrain. Fortunately, the demand for his services is good, since many people need to move, and motocarros are the preferred mode of transportation.

Abelardo is grateful for the good income he earns, so that he can support his family.

This is his first loan with MFP, and he promises to be very punctual and responsible with each of his payments. With the money he requested he will rebuild his motocarro, because it wears out quickly in this type of terrain.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his motocarro

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase additional traditional clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Monohari

texts.en: Monohari D. is a 46 years old woman. She has a son and two daughters. She lives with her family.  She has a restaurant that is situated on the main town of Kakanadura.  At this point in the business, she has four employees. She wants to expand her restaurant now, so she needs a loan of 60000 LKR to develop her restaurant.

loans.use: Buy rice,Fish,Meat,vegetable and spices.

loans.name: Los Tres Barrios - Qoricancha Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal  “ LOS TRES BARRIOS - QORICANCHA”, ellos están ubicados en la provincia de Urubamba en el distrito de Chinchero perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestros socios se dedican al comercio minorista, entre los miembros del banco comunal en su gran mayoría se dedican a la ganadería y a la agricultura, como principal actividad; otras dos socias venden chicha, crían animales menores, otro socio es albañil y dos socios se dedican a la artesanía, y un socio fabrica baños sanitarios. Nuestra socia la Sra. Alejandrina Huamán L.; natural de chinchero, de la comunidad de Qoricancha, es casada y tiene 2 hijos estudió primaria completa y se dedicó de lleno a la crianza de ganados desde casi una niña, nuestra socia ahora se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados, ella viaja a la feria en la provincia de Quispicanchis a comprar ganados pequeños (maltones), los cría y engorda, saca nuevos ejemplares y a los papas después de un tiempo los venden, o también si tiene toros ella alquila para que se procreen con vacas de los vecinos, es toda una actividad algo compleja y dedicada, la socia solicita el préstamo para comprar algunos bebes de ganados.

Nuestros socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the "Los Tres Barrios - Qoricancha" Communal Bank, located in the province of Urubamba, District of Chinchero, in the Department of Cusco. The majority of the bank members work in agriculture and raising cattle, with some working in retail sales as well. Two members work selling chicha [a fermented corn drink], another is a bricklayer, two work as craftsmen and one works making toilets. One member, Alejandrina Huamán L., who is originally from Chinchero and the Qoricancha community, is married and has two children. She completed a primary school education and has been raising cattle since she was practically a little girl. Now she works buying and selling cattle. She goes to the fair in Quispicanchis province to buy young animals. She then raises and fattens them, breeds and raises their young, and sells the older animals. When she has bulls she also rents them so that they can breed with her neighbors' cows. It is a complex and time-consuming job, and she is asking for this loan in order to buy new calves. All of our members are thankful for the opportunity offered by the loan process and promise to repay their loans within the established time period.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to buy and sell cattle.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 48 years old and married with seven children between 10 and 23 years old. All of her children go to school. The family resides in and owns   a five-room house where she stays with six people. She takes care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home.  The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees for her children and medication. Florence deals in produce like beans, maize, and millet and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. She serves about five customers a day. She has done this business for over 15 years. Besides this business, she also sells cosmetics in Kampala city shops. Her main challenges are transportation and seasonality.  She sells at retail and at wholesale. She has been with MCDT for six years, taking her 14th loan working all along with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of maize, beans and millet plus cosmetics  She hopes to see her business grow bigger and to start employing at a least five people.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, beans and millet

loans.name: Adjouavi Charlotte

texts.fr: A. Adjouavi Charlotte est née le 17 Juillet 1978 et vit depuis 23 ans à Fidjrossè Kpota, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à AMANDOU Sèmiou, un transitaire, Adjouavi Charlotte est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Adjouavi Charlotte vient en aide à son mari et contribue à assurer avec lui les différentes charges familiales. Adjouavi Charlotte a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au secondaire. Il y a 15 ans, Adjouavi Charlotte mène comme activité la vente de tissus de façon ambulante dans son quartier. Parallèlement à cette activité, Adjouavi Charlotte vend également des pâtes dentifrices. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Adjouavi Charlotte s'approvisionne. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Face à la demande multiple de sa clientèle, Adjouavi Charlotte sollicite un quatrième prêt en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Charlotte A. Adjouavi was born on the 17th of July, 1978 and for the past 23 years she has lived in Fidjrossè Kpota, a neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Sèmiou Amandou, a forwarding agent. Charlotte Adjouavi was educated just to the high school level. For 15 years, Charlotte Adjouavi has had a business selling cloth throughout her neighborhood. In parallel with this business, Charlotte Adjouavi also sells toothpaste. Charlotte Adjouavi supplies herself in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is an old client of ALIDé, having benefitted from three loans, all of which she properly repaid. In order to handle the needs of her clientele, Adjouavi Charlotte is requesting a fourth loan, which she will use in order to strengthen her business and better satisfy the needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cloth and toothpaste

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma A. is from the village of Dioyo, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Gemma is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a business selling home furniture like chairs, tables, etc. to tourists and local community members. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gemma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama E. is married and has five dependents. She has been through junior high education.  Ama sells vegetables, cassava and plantains at Akotokyire. Her husband is a steel bender.  Ama uses her income to help her husband in the general welfare of the home.  Ama will use the loan to purchase other varieties of vegetables and plantains for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to save to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: purchase other varieties of vegetables and plantains for resale

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 56 years old and married with eight children.  He has been selling shoes and clothes for 20 years. In addition, he does farming.  George works hard in his business so that he can provide for his family and educate his five children who are still in school.  He joined a group in Faulu Kenya called Forty in One to easily access financial support.  This is because when a member takes a loan he is guaranteed by the group members.  He wants to buy more clothes and shoes for sale. Hence, he has requested a loan of Kes. 80,000 from Faulu Kenya.  He believes that this loan will help him meet the needs of his different customers.  He dreams of opening other shops in other areas in the future. He wants to invest deeply into dairy farming in 10 years time.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for sale

loans.name: Evelyn's Group

texts.en: Evelyn P. is from the village of Brgy. Lantap, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 49 years old. Evelyn is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Evelyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn provides a transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating a motorcycle-transport business. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2006, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Evelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Natsagdorj

texts.en: Natsagdorj S., age 41, lives in his own apartment in Zavhan province, western Mongolia with his two sons. Since 2000 he has been operating a food trading business. Initially, he rented a small shop but he has built and completed a shop with his business revenues. Natsagdorj is a modest, clever and experienced businessman. He is saving for his children's future tuition fees. Natsagdorj is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase and import products from Erlian city, China.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu M. prepares 'banku' (a dish prepared of maize dough) with different varieties of soups (such as okra, palm nut and groundnut soup) at Abura. Ramatu has received senoir high education.  She is married to a mason. 

Ramatu has been selling 'banku' for some time now. She helps her husband with the general welfare of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare 'banku' and to sell to those who want to buy the raw maize. She hopes to use the new earnings she will be getting as a result of the loan to complete a kitchen she has started renovating.

loans.use: to buy more maize to prepare 'banku' and to sell to those who want to buy raw maize

loans.name: Ángel Agnelio

texts.es:
Ángel Agnelio V. M. tiene 61 años.  Es casado y vive con su esposa, en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos, 2 que son casados, 2 pequeños y los otros adolescentes.

Ángel es un socio de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Ángel trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando papas, trigo, cebada y maíz. Realiza sus compras y sus ventas en Guaranda cuando haga la cosecha.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para sembrar papas. Quisiera tener plata para comprar lo que necesita y salir adelante. Falta dinero para trabajar. 

Le gusta jugar voleibol.
texts.en:
Ángel Agnelio V. M., 61, is married and lives with his wife in Guaranda canton, Bolívar province. He has 6 children: two who are married, 2 who are still little, and the rest who are adolescents. Ángel is a member of the Patrón San Juan communal bank located half an hour from Guaranda. It has a total of 16 members most of whom are potato and corn farmers. This is their first loan request from Cooperativa San José. Ángel farms potatoes, wheat, barley and corn. He makes his purchases and his sales in Guaranda when he harvests his crops. He is asking for funds to buy raw materials for potato farming. He’d like to have money to buy what he needs and move ahead. He lacks money to work. He enjoys playing volleyball.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for potato farming.

loans.name: Zoila Wendy

texts.es:
Zoila de 32 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, hace unos años atrás ella hacia manualidades y dibujaba para tener ingresos para solventar sus gastos, pero como quería su propio negocio decidió invertir las ganancias de los dibujos en papelería.

Poco a poco desde que comenzó a dibujar e invertir su dinero comenzó a ganar dinero para hacer readecuaciones en su casa y construir un local para su negocio, por la buena decisión de tener más ingresos ella ahora tiene una papelería trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días, su hija de 14 años le ayuda atender la papelería mientras que ella hace la comida. 

Para poder incrementar su papelería ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cuadernos, papelería, plumas, en el futuro quiere ubicar su negocio en un lugar mas concurrido.
texts.en:
Zoila, 32, lives in a built up area on the outskirts of Guayaquil. Until a few years ago she made handicrafts and drawings as a way to make ends meet, but wanted to start her own business and so decided to invest her profits from the drawings in a stationery shop. Little by little as she invested the money from her drawings, she began to earn enough to turn her home into a suitable location for her business. It was a good decision and she now has her stationery shop, where she works from 9am to 8pm every day. Her 14 year-old daughter helps in the shop when Zoila goes to make their meals. To grow the business, Zoila wants to buy notebooks, stationery, and pens with the loan. In the future she would like to relocate the business to a busier location.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks; stationery

loans.name: Maricon

texts.en:
Maricon H. is from the village of Bantay, Solana, Cagayan. She is 35 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

Maricon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and the ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase medication for her livestock. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase medication for her livestock

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa M. is from the village of Cabisera 8. She is 41 years old and is married with two adult children. Felisa owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Felisa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Felisa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 4th from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama O. sells cloth at Elmina. She has acquired a senior high level of education. She is divorced and has two children.

Ama has been selling cloth for five years and, with the income she makes from her sales, she is able to take care of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more cloth to sell.

Ama hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more cloth to sell

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with five children. Three of her children currently attend school and the other two have graduated. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated her beverage selling business for over five years. From home, Asha sells juice and ice cubes to her neighbors and school children. Her major challenge in the business is seasonality. During the rainy winter season (June-July) the demand for juice is low compared to during the hot dry season (January-February). She hopes to be self-reliant in the future and expand her business.

Asha decided to join Yehu to get a loan with the hope of improving her business. With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to repair her refrigerator (which she stands next to in the photo) as well as purchase a sack of sugar and packets of flavoring that she uses to make natural juices.

loans.use: To repair refrigerator, and purchase a sack of sugar and flavoring to make natural juices.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina, a mother of two, is 45 years old. She is a hard-working entrepreneur who wants to be able to help her family. Working closely with her husband Reynato, she makes and sells ready-to-eat food. She started the business seven years ago to help her family meet its education expenses, as well as water, electricity and food expenses. All of these items are very expensive.  

Now, Gina has requested 35,000 PHP as additional working capital for her business. She is positive that her business will grow, since she already has regular customers in her local area submitting orders. Specifically, the loan will be used to buy more ingredients. She is pleased because, in the past, she has managed to utilize the loans to invest in her business.

With working capital, Gina's business will continue to grow and she will be able to provide excellent products to her regular customers. With the support of KIVA lenders, Gina hopes to improve the standard of living for herself and her family and lift them out of poverty. 
 
She dreams of having a permanent space in the marketplace where she can sell her food in order to earn a much larger income. Gina is grateful to ASHI for offering her happiness in life and group support in achieving her goals.

During the course of her membership in ASHI, Gina has been a model member, dedicated to managing her family’s operations.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron has been practicing mixed farming for sixteen years in Kisii town, western Kenya. His farm produces maize, beans, bananas and tea which are sold locally and through Kenya Tea Development Authority. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater for the needs of his family. His biggest challenge has been weather changes especially drought which affects his production.

Haron is 49 years old. He is married with 6 school-aged children who are currently attending school.

He has requested this loan of 45,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and maintain a dairy cow. He says that the dairy cow will be an added asset to the family. The proceeds from the sale of milk will go towards the education of his children. In future, he hopes that the proceeds from his farm will enable him open a cereals and general shop in the same region.

loans.use: To purchase and maintain a dairy cow.

loans.name: Yaa Nana

texts.en: Yaa Nana T. sells smoked fish at Elmina. She has received a junior high education. She is single. Demand for her fish is high and she is looking to expand her business. The loan will be used to buy more fish to smoke and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa wishes to purchase land.

loans.use: To buy more fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna B. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 54 years old, married, and has three adult children. To make a living, Edna raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Edna also grows hogs and sells dried fish. She does all these activities to earn enough for her family and have savings.

Edna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Edna is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, hog feeds, and additional dried fish. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, hog feeds, and additional dried fish

loans.name: James Omwansa

texts.en:
James Omwansa N. is 30 years old, married to Regina Karemi, and a father of two wonderful children. He buys clothes and shoes in bulk and sells them to customers in Kitale Town. James has been in this business for three years now and he gets a monthly income of 26,000 KES.

This will be James's first loan from KADET. He plans to buy more clothes and shoes to increase his inventory since it is the busiest shopping month in Kitale. With the extra income, he plans to pay school fees for his two children and purchase more inventory. 

In the future James wants to own a shop of his own. Currently he sells clothes in a field. He also wants to increase his inventory to 100,000 KES.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Floravilla

texts.en:
Floravilla A. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 26 years old. Floravilla is married and has two small children. To make a living, Floravilla owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and snack foods in the local community. Floravilla has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Floravilla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Floravilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Floravilla is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like biscuits and snack foods. This will be the second loan taken out by Floravilla from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lesbia Danubia

texts.es: Lesbia Danubia M. H. tiene 43 años de edad, es casada, no tiene hijos, reside en la Colonia Porvenir Norte  la ciudad de Juticalpa, Olancho. Lesbia tiene una venta de abarroteria que opera desde hace 4 años bajo el nombre de Pulperia Hernandez, iniciò su negocio con el apoyo de su esposo ya que èl tenia un dinero ahorrado y decidiò que era la mejor forma de invertirlo. Su esposo le ayuda a atender la pulperia mientras ella realiza los quehaceres del hogar, su horario de atencion es desde las 6:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm. Su mejor ventajas es que en toda la colonia su pulperia es la mas surtida y eso hace que la afluencia de clientes sea mucha. El prestamo que solicita lo necesita para surtir de mas y variados productos de la canasta basica familiar. Con el apoyo de este prestamo podra mantener la misma afluencia de clientes que visitan su pulperia porque tendra lo que ellos necesitan comprar para su hogar. Su desafio es poder alcanzar una estabilidad economica que le permita ahorrar para asi poder comprar su vivienda, ya que por los momentos tiene que alquilar. Su sueño es poder convertirse en madre asi que adoptara a dos pequeños niños y seguir trabajando cada dia para poder sostenerlos y darles una buena condicion de vida. Ha sido clienta de FAMA por dos ciclos y ha demostrado ser puntual y responsable en la cancelacion de los prestamos obtenidos y espera seguirlo siendo.
texts.en:
Lesbia Danubia M. H., 43, is married and has no children. She lives in the Porvenir Norte neighborhood in the city of Juticalpa, Olancho.  Lesbia has had a grocery store for the last four years called “Pulpería Hernández.”  Her husband helped her start the business with some money he had saved up and he decided this was the best way to invest it.  Her husband helps her tend to the store while she takes care of household chores.  She is open for business from 6am until 9pm.  Her greatest advantage is that her grocery store is the best stocked in the entire neighborhood and this leads to her having a large customer base.

She needs the loan she requested to better stock the store with a larger variety of items that form a family’s basic grocery cart.  Support from the loan will make it possible for her to retain her customers that visit her store because she’ll have everything they need to buy for their homes.

Her challenge is reaching a point of economic stability that will permit her to start saving in order to buy a house because she is currently renting.  

Her dream is to become a mother so she plans to adopt two small children and continue to work every day to support them and give them good living conditions.

She has been a FEMA client for two cycles and has shown punctuality and responsibility in her repayments and expects to continue to do so.

loans.use: To buy assorted groceries.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a young man from Bethlehem, he shares taking care of the household expenses and his 6 members family with his sisters and brothers. Ahmed and his brothers works in making olive wood statutes and souvenirs.

Ahmed's brother is getting engaged, Ahmed wanted to help him and pay for his engagement expenses and has taken out a loan from FATEN to participate in his brother engagement expenses.

Ahmed appears in the picture here in FATEN's office when receiving the loan.

loans.use: Ahmed's brother engagement party expenses

loans.name: Savina Del Rosario

texts.es: Esta señora es la delegada del MINED municipal de telica, donde tiene de laborar 22 años, iniciandose como maestro, hasta obstentar el cargo que hoy representa, es casada madre de 2 hijos, los cuales estudian en la UCAN leon el Tecnico Lasalle de la misma cuidad, convive con su marido y sus hijos, es originaria de la comarca Rigoberto Morales Chavez a tan solo ½ KM de el poblado de telica carretera leon san isidro, sus padres son agricultores de la zona , dichos esfuerzos de los mismos para darle la preparacion academica, que tiene, y legado que esta aprovechando para transferirselos a sus hijos por el mejoramiento de la s condiciones de vida, ademas apoyado con los financiamientos obtenidos con la empresa, ha mejorado y sigue mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
This woman is the MINED (Ministry of Education) representative in the Telica municipality.  She has worked there for 22 years.  She started as a teacher and worked until she got the position that she now has.  She is married and has two children.  The children attend school at UCAN (Autonomous Christian University of Nicaragua) el Técnico Lasalle in the city of Leon.

She lives with her husband and their children.  She is from the Rigoberto Morales Chavez region, which is ½ of a kilometer from the town of Telica on the San Isidro highway to Leon.  Her parents are farmers in the zone.  Through their hard work they gave her the academic preparation and legacy that she has.  She is taking advantage of this to pass it on to her children in order to improve their living conditions.

Supported by the loans she got with the business, she has improved and continues to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To pay university registration and module fees

loans.name: Luz Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora. Luz C. es socia del banco comunal Azogueñitas, vive en la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es hermosa por su estructura colonial y l moderna, también es reconocida por su iglesia catedral que se encuentra en lo mas alto de esta ciudad, su gente es muy cordial y amable.
 
Doña Luz tiene 29 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos que estudian en la escuela, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Nuestra socia trabaja realizando los quehaceres domésticos en diferentes casas y le gusta esta actividad por que no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo, en su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos y cerdos.

Se encuentra trabajando con los créditos del banco comunal hace un año y ha llegado ha tener un buen laso de amistad con sus compañeras, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos. Su meta es tener una casa y un negocio en ella como una tienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz C. is a member of the communal bank named "Azoguenitas". She lives in the city of Azogues. This city is beautiful for its colonial and modern architecture. It is also well known for the cathedral church that is located on the most elevated part of the city. The people are very polite and kind.

Luz is 29 years old, married, and she has 4 children who are still in school. She doesn't own a house, so they rent their space. 

Our client provides janitorial services in various private homes and she enjoys the business because she doesn't have a fixed schedule to follow. At home she raises chickens and pigs.

She has been working with loans from the communal bank for the past year and she has come to form a great friendship with her colleagues. The funds from her loan will be used to invest in the purchase of pigs. Her goal is to have a house of her own and a business, such as a store.

loans.use: To purchase pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: So

texts.en: The woman in the photo is So L., aged 65, who lives in the province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia. She earns a living by raising pigs. She has run this business for many years and it has provided her with income to attain her current standard of living. In addition, So L. also sells different kinds of dessert near her village in order to make additional income. So L. is married with four children; all of them are married, and two of them are employed in different jobs. Her husband is a firewood seller as well as a local farmer. So L. is asking for a loan to buy two cows to be used in her farming business.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Solidario Las Trabajadoras De Sumpango Group

texts.es:
Las Trabajadoras D. Sumpango

María Luisa, Nancy,Y Elsa integran el grupo D. las trabajadoras Sumpangueras,ellas reciden en  Un pueblo que se encuentra muy cerca D. la ciudad Capital. Doña Luisa se dedica a la venta D. comida en una fabrica textilera que se encuentra aproximadamente a 10 km del pueblo, al igual que Nancy Y Elsa (hija y nuera) pues ellas tienen el mismo oficio, ellas preparan alrededor D. 200 almuerzos diarios algo que no es suficiente ya que tienen mas demanda D. almuerzos pero el capital no les alcanza es por eso que solicitan un crédito a Fape para tener mas capital  Para comprar productos comestibles para elavorar comida y así preparar mas almuerzos ellas han trabajado por mucho tiempo con Fape y han sido muy puntuales en cuanto a los pagos, es por eso que ellas estarían muy agradecidas si les otorgara un crédito ya que así podrían ampliar sus negocios y tener una mejor calidad D. vida
texts.en:
